loans.name: Luyen's Group

texts.en:
Luyen T. T. is 45-year-old woman with two children who is living in Dai bi hamlet. She joined our credit program in 2004 when she first received a loan of 1,425,000 VND, which she invested in opening a small restaurant that serves breakfast.  Her business has developed more and more and created a stable income for her to manage her family life. Since she has participated in our credit program, she has always been a good re-payer. To buy more equipment for her restaurant, she wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND.
 
 Minh T. D. is 45 years old. She grows rice and vegetables, and is raising 50 chickens. She wants a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy food for them.

loans.use: to buy more equipment for her restaurant

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 41 and is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 12 years old.  He sells various products such as slippers, umbrellas, underwear, bananas, etc. He operates his business from 7am to 6pm every day except on Saturday, and he has been engaged in this business for eleven years. His place of business is clean.

Francois has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy more products, such as slippers, umbrellas, underwear, bananas, etc. to sell.  He will reinvest any profits in this business and save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers, umbrellas, underwear, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza A. is from the village of Hinaplanan, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old. Annaliza is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she prepares and sells pork and chicken barbecue in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Annaliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed, like meat and spices. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed, like meat and spices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena V. is 32 years old and married with two school-aged children. She is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. To make a living, Rowena owns and operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes from buying and selling coconuts and green bananas in the local community. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. 

Rowena joined HSPFI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowena is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase green bananas and coconuts. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase green bananas and coconuts

loans.name: Tserendorj

texts.en:
Tserendorj is 58-year-old widow who lives with her daughter and son in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband died in early 2010. Her son lives by himself and works as a taxi driver in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter, who is 23, helps with the family business. 

Tserendorj operates a clothing business from a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in 2002 at an outdoor market. Tserendorj worked hard to expand her business and rent a stall at an indoor market. In 2005, she expanded to rent another stall at a different indoor market that her daughter now manages. Tserendorj has gained a great deal of business experience and has built good relationships with her partners. She is a well-known businesswoman who says, “I want to buy a house for my children in order to make their living conditions better.” 

Tserendorj is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes to sell in the springtime when demand is high.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Vinh

texts.en:
Vinh T. N. is 49 years old and lives with her family in Dai bi village. She grows rice and baby bamboo on a plot of land that is 3.5 square meters. Vinh also raises deer and cultivates crab in a lake that is on her land. She sells the crab in the summer. Vinh earns a monthly profit of 3,000,000 VND from her businesses and she is working hard to improve her standard of living.

Vinh has participated in SEDA’s credit program since 2004. She is a good leader with an excellent repayment record. Vinh is requesting a loan of 9,810,000 VND to improve her land to raise deer.

loans.use: to improve land to raise deer

loans.name: Leonie

texts.en:
Leonie is 30 years old and is married with three children between one and six years old.  She earns a living by selling products such as cassava and sorghum. Leonie has been successfully running her business for ten years. Her business is well-organized and she currently employs one person to help her. Leonie works from seven in the morning until six at night every day except Saturday.

Leonie has requested a Kiva loan through the Vision Finance Company to buy more sacks of cassava and sorghum. By expanding her business and increasing her inventory, Leonie hopes to earn more profits. Leonie will save her profits for the future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cassava and sorghum

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex K. M. is 30 years old. He is married to Violet and they have three beautiful children. Alex lives with his family in Kitale, where he runs a food stall. He has been in this business for the past three years and earns a monthly income of 18,000 KES. 

Alex is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD to purchase food such as beans and rice to sell. He will use the profit from his loan to open another food stall to provide a better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 36 and is married, with four children between 3 and 13 years old. She owns a small business where she sells beans. She has been engaged in this business for five years, and her business is clean. She opens her business from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day except Saturday. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy more beans to sell for a good profit. With any profits, Clementine will reinvest in her business and save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beans to sell

loans.name: Loi

texts.en: Loi T. L. is 48 years old with five children. Three of them got married. She is providing education for two children. She did farming when her children were young and mostly focused on growing rice and vegetables and raising cows for meat, because this agricultural work would meet her family's food demand. Being a client of our credit program since 2007, she has used loans effectively in expanding farming. Because of this reason, her loan size is higher year after year. Now, she needs to have a loan of 9,810,000 VND to buy fertilizer for the next crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her next crop

loans.name: Handsuren

texts.en: Handsuren is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their own apartment in the Narantuul area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her older daughter, who is 23, attends college, while her youngest, who is 18, goes to a secondary school. Handsuren and her husband own a public-transportation service business in Ulaanbaatar. They started their business in 1998 with one minibus. Now they have several minibuses and employ several conductors. Their monthly earning is 65,000 MNT, and they pay 325,000 MNT of salary for one conductor. They are very diligent people who worked hard to stabilize their business for 13 years. Handsuren says that she would like to have their apartment certificate as soon as possible. She is requesting a 1,000,000-MNT loan to make repairs on her minibuses in order to transport people comfortably.

loans.use: to make repairs on minibuses

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to grow her business and purchase a modern machine and equipment

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita N. is from the village of Zayas, Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 45 years old. Rosita is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Rosita owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing (or RTW), like blouses, t-shirts, and shoes, in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2000, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products, like blouses, t-shirts, shorts, and underwear. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Rosita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like blouses, t-shirts, shorts, and underwear

location.town: Zayas, Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: C6230 Ingenzi Group

texts.en:
Aisha is 35 years old and is married with three children who are between the ages of 3 and 12 years old. She also takes care of ten dependents from her family. She has a salon that is three years old and she employs three persons in her business.

Aisha has now requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing her business through purchasing more materials for her beauty salon. This purchase will allow her to serve more customers from the community which will help her to earn more money. The profits she expects to earn will be one of the ways she will develop her business and will provide all the basic needs of her family, including her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more material for her beauty salon

loans.name: Tien

texts.en:
Tien T. T. is 30 years old and has two children who attend high school. She did farming when her children were young and mostly focused on growing rice and vegetables and raised chickens for meat. Because these agricultural activities would meet her family's food needs. 

Being a client of our credit program since 2007, she has used loans effectively in expanding her farm. Because of this reason, her loan sizes have been higher year after year. 

Now, she needs to have a loan of 9,810,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy fertilizer and food for chickens.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and food for chickens

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony N. O. is 28 and married to Abigail. Together they have two children. He has been in the motorbike transport business (bodaboda) for the past three years. 

He was introduced to KADET by a credit officer, thus applying for his first loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from KADET Ltd, which he will use to improve his business by servicing the motorbike.

With the profits generated from his business he plans to pay school fees for his children. He dreams of being rich. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more despite limited resources.

loans.use: to improve his business by servicing the motorbike

loans.name: Jossie

texts.en:
Jossie P. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old. Jossie is married and has four adult children. Jossie makes and sells snacks & other delicacies like rice & cheese cakes in the local community. Jossie has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2008, Jossie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 17,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional ingredients & working capital.

This loan will be her sixth from HSPFI. Jossie is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase raw ingredients needed like flour, eggs & sugar. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like flour, eggs, & sugar

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen V. habita en casa propia con sus tres hijos y un primo, quienes por el momento se encuentran estudiando. Doña María es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, se las ingenia para salir adelante y llevar el sustento a su casa. Se dedica  a la venta de tamales de diferentes tipos como: tamales de chipilín, tamales pisques  y tamales de elote. En el Municipio de Antiguo Cuscatlán, departamento de La Libertad sus ricos tamales son muy demandados por sus vecinos, ya que ofrece calidad, buen precio y sobre todo buen servicio. Ella tiene muchos sueños y uno  de ellos es mejorar su negocio, para esto solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en los materiales necesarios para la venta de tamalitos. Tales como: maíz, frijoles, pollo, condimentos, agua, hojas, y demás materiales que son indispensables para su elaboración. De esta forma espera lograr una mayor aceptación de sus sabrosos tamales y lograr incrementar las ventas las cuales traerían mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen V. lives in her own house with her three children and a cousin, who are currently in school. Maria is a very hard-working and proactive woman, and she's always thinking of new ways to support her family and come out ahead. She works selling different types of tamales, offering tamales filled with chipilín (a leafy vegetable native to Mexico) or sweet corn, as well as "pisques" tamales (which have a small amount of ash added in to the ground corn for color).In the Antiguo Cuscatlan Municipality in the La Libertad department, her delicious tamales are in high demand amongst her neighbors because Maria offers quality, a good price, and above all else, good service. 

Maria has many dreams, and one of these dreams is to improve her business. For this reason, she is applying for a loam from INTEGRAL to invest in the materials necessary to sell her tamales, such as corn, beans, chicken, condiments, water, leaves, and other ingredients that are indispensable to the creation of each dish. In this way, she hopes to gain even greater success with her flavorful tamales, and be able to increase sales, bringing more income into her family.

loans.use: to purchase primary materials to make tamales, such as corn, beans, chicken, condiments, water, and leaves for wrapping.

location.town: Antiguo Cuscatlán, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Wallan's Group

texts.en:
Wallan is the resident of Mian channu which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agricultural industry. She owns a 4 room house there and has been living in it with her family for the past 14 years. 

She is a very helpful person by nature and always ready to help her family in difficult times. Her husband's name is M. A.. He operates a livestock business. He buys animals (goats & cows), raises them and then sells them. 

Wallan herself is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and do housework. She also supports her husband in running his livestock business. She takes care of his cattle by giving them food and water and by keeping their place clean. She is the mother of 3 sons. Her eldest son is a daily wage laborer, her second oldest helps his father in his business, and her third son is 15 and stays at home.  

Wallan couldn’t provide an education to her children due to poor financial conditions. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband who wants to buy some goats for selling at a good profit. He has been operating this business for past 11 years and Wallan is confident that he will be able to take his business to a better position with the help of a loan. 

She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her family.

loans.use: to buy goats for resale

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra F. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 58 years old. Alejandra is married and has three adult children. Alejandra makes and sells snacks & other delicacies like rice & cheese cakes in the local community. Alejandra has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Alejandra joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 8,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional ingredients & working capital.

This loan will be her third from HSPFI. Alejandra is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase raw ingredients like flour & eggs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like flour & eggs

loans.name: Reina Isaura

texts.es: Reina Isaura G. C. de 38 años de edad, vive  en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos. Doña Reina vive en condiciones muy humildes y durante mucho tiempo a trabajado duro para poder ayudar  a sus hijos a que sigan estudiando. Tiene un  puesto de tortillas dentro de su casa ubicado en el Municipio de Nuevo Cuscatlán Departamento de La Libertad. Durante años ha trabajado en este negocio ya que siempre tiene muchos clientes que la buscan debido a  que sus tortillas siempre están a la hora. Doña Reina quiere mejorar la calidad de su servicio, ofreciendo más tortillas para así poder satisfacer a más personas y lograr a traer a más clientes ya que se encuentra ubicada en una zona muy estratégica y transitada. Solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en la materia prima como: maíz, agua, gas propano y darle mantenimiento a su plancha para que siempre este en buenas condiciones y se pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio a los clientes y lograr obtener mayores ingresos con los cuales pueda seguir ayudando a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Reina Isaura Guzman C. is 38 years old, and she lives at home with her four children. Reina lives in very humble conditions, and she has worked hard for a long time to help her children continue with their studies. She has a tortilla stall in her house, located in the Nuevo Cusclatan Municipality in the La Libertad Department. Reina has worked at her tortilla stall for years, and she always has a lot of customers, since her tortillas are always ready on time. She hopes to improve the quality of her service, offering more tortillas to be able to satisfy more people, attracting more customers as she is located in a heavily trafficked and very strategic area.

Reina is applying for a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in primary materials, such as corn, water, and propane gas, as well as to do some maintenance on her grill so that it is always in good condition. This investment will help her offer a better service to her clients, and get more income, with which she can continue to finance children's studies.

loans.use: to buy primary materials, such as corn, water and propane gas, as well as to do maintenance work on her grill.

loans.name: Phannath's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members who will each use their portion of the loan for a different purpose. Each hopes the loan will help them improve their family's standard of living. 

Mrs. Phannath is a group leader who has been selected by the other members. She owns a general store in the local village where she can sell groceries to make some income to support her family. 

Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand it. For this purpose, Mrs. Phannath is applying for a loan to buy more groceries to resell. Her husband, Mr. Sorl, is employed in a garment factory. This couple does not have children yet.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth D. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 52 years old. Ruth is married and has four adult children. Ruth owns and operates a mini-restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals like chicken & pork adobo, bulalo & afritada. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Ruth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 8,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional ingredients & working capital.

This loan will be her third from HSPFI. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Diep's Group

texts.en:
Diep T. B. is 52 years old. She lives with her family in Van thuong village. Being a farmer, she focuses on growing rice and potatoes and raising pigs. Every day, she takes vegetables to the local market to sell at retail. 

Beside this, raising cattle creates a stable mount of money every quarter. Joining with our credit program since 2007, she has always been a good group leader. Now, she needs to have a loan of a 6,758,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy more food for her pigs.

Nam T. D. is 35 years old. She is raising 200 chickens for eggs and three pigs for meat. She wants to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy food for them.

Thiem T. N. is 46 years old. She is raising 10 pigs for meat. She needs to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to improve the housing for them.

Nga T. H. is 49 years old. She is raising 200 chickens for meat. She needs to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy food for them.

010107050034-4907

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Rosa Melida

texts.es: Rosa Melida A. A. de 30 años de edad reside en casa propia junto a su abuela y dos hijos, los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Rosa se dedica a la venta de ropa, lociones y cremas en el municipio de San Francisco Gotera del Departamento de Morazán. Ella visita las casas de sus clientes para poder ofrecer sus productos, aunque también les atiende en su casa en donde cuenta con exhibidores para mostrarles sus productos o prendas de vestir.  Como toda mujer emprendedora Rosa sueña con mejorar su negocio ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene, como madre soltera. Solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL con la firme idea de que es la mejor forma para prosperar con su negocio. El crédito lo solicita para comprar mayor variedad de prendas de vestir (pantalones, blusas, ropa interior, etc.), así como diferentes tipos de cremas y lociones. De esta forma espera lograr aumentar sus ventas y  su nivel de ingresos que le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida de todos en su hogar
texts.en:
Rosa Melida A. A. is 30 years old, and she lives with her two children, who are currently in school, and her grandmother. Rosa works selling clothing, lotion, and creams in the San Francisco Gotera Municipality in the Morazan Department. She visits her customers' houses to be able to offer her products, although she also receives customers in her home, where she has displays set up to show them her products.

Like any enterprising woman, Rosa dreams of improving her business, partly because it is the only source of income that she has as a single mother. She is applying for a loan from INTEGRAL with the belief that it is the best way to make her business prosper. She will use the loan to buy a wider variety of clothing (pants, blouses, underwear, etc.), as well as different types of creams and lotions. In this way, she hopes to increase her sales and her income, allowing her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, underwear, dresses, lotions, and creams.

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Ha's Group

texts.en:
Ha T. H. is 46 years old. She lives with her family in the village of Van Thuong. Being a farmer, she focuses on growing rice and potatoes, and raising pigs for meat. Her efforts create a stable mount of money every quarter. 

Having joined our credit program in 2004, she has always been a good group leader and used loans effectively in developing her farming activity. Now, she needs to have a loan of 7,194,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy more food for  her pigs.

Mai T. H. is 35 years old. She is raising 200 chickens for eggs. She wants to have a loan of 6,758,000 VND to buy food for them.

Dinh T. H. is 44 years old. She is raising 10 pigs for meat. She needs to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND to improve the housing for them.

Cuc T. H. is 47 years old. She runs a shop that makes wood tables and desks. She needs to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy material.

Minh T. N. is 35 years old. She is raising 200 chickens for meat. She needs to have a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy food for them.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 40 years old. She is single and supports three children who are dependent relatives. She owns and operates a small business selling various styles of African clothes. Agnes has been running her well-organized business for the past year. 

Agnes is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders through the Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing additional women’s clothing. This loan will allow her to attract more customers to help earn more profit and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase African-style women's clothing to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Sarong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is comprised of fifteen people who will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their standard of living. The village bank president is Sarong, who was selected by the group members. 

Sarong was born in 1973. She is a widow with four children, two of whom are seamstresses in garment factories while the others are studying in the local public school.  Although the family works hard, it is difficult to earn enough to provide for the family. Sarong is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice to sell and support her family. She is requesting a loan to add to her savings and buy a breeding cow to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas C. F. is 32 years old and single. For the past two years, Lucas has been in the motorcycle transport business in Mtwapa, Mombasa. He earns a good income.

Lucas is applying for his second loan from KADET to purchase spare parts to repair his motorbike. He has never borrowed from a microfinance institution other than KADET. Lucas will use the profits from his loan to improve his business. His dream is to have a Matatu (minibus) business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorcycle repair

loans.name: Aida Nely

texts.es: Aida Nely P. G. madre soltera, vive sola, en casa propia en San Antonio del Monte en el departamento de Sonsonate, ella  realiza comercio ambulante  y vende en su casa prendas de costura que ella misma realiza; Aida es una mujer muy emprendedora y sabe cómo ganarse la vida honradamente, ella  realiza su labor en una zona muy concurrida de los cobanos y últimamente ha tenido buenas ventas y quiere abastecerse con mas mercancía para poder realizar sus prendas,  es así como se decidió a solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar telas, hilos, aguja entre otros para así poder confeccionar las prendas de vestir y salir a vender con el mejor de los ánimos, pues sus clientes la prefieren por ser novedosa con su producto. Aida tiene mucha confianza que su actividad laboral podrá seguir sosteniendo su hogar y a su familia.
texts.en: Aida Nely P. G. is a single mother who lives by herself in San Antonio del Monte, in the Sonsonate Department. She works selling clothing that she herself makes; she sells her products both in a a moving stall and from her home. Aida is an enterprising woman, and she knows how to make an honest living. She does her work in a busy area of Los Cobanos, and she has had very good sales recently; she wants to stock up on materials to be able to finish her work. For this reason, she decided to apply for a loan from INTEGRAL, which would allow her to buy fabric, thread, and needles, among other things, to be able to sew more clothing and go out to sell her wares in better spirits, because her clients prefer her for her originality. Aida is confident that her labors will be able to continue supporting her family and her home.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Mui Thi Nguyen's Group

texts.en:
Mui T. N. is 31 years old. She has three children who attend secondary school. Mui is a farmer who grows rice, corn, and potatoes to provide for her family. She also raises chickens for meat and has been running her business for many years. Mui received a loan in 2007 and was able to expand her farm and buy a cow. Since then, she has has a new calf every year and has been able to use her cows for labor. Mui has a good loan repayment record and is a good group leader. She is requesting a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy cattle feed. 

Lanh T. D. has two children. She runs a mechanical workshop that is always busy and she gets orders for services from the local villagers. Lanh is requesting a loan of 6,758,000 VND to buy metal to use in her workshop.

Xuyen T. H. is 47 years old and has two children. She manages a workshop that makes aluminum frame doors and windows. Xuyen is requesting a loan of 5,886,000 VND to buy materials for her workshop.

Xuyen T. H. is 50 years old. She is raising 100 chickens for meat. Xuyen is requesting a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy instant soups, bread, eggs, beverages, and candy.

loans.name: Vital

texts.en:
Vital is 27 years old and is married with a three-year-old child. He makes a living as a photographer. Vital’s business is well-organized and he has two years of experience. His studio is open from seven in the morning to ten at night every day. 

Vital has requested a Kiva loan through Vision Finance Company to buy new materials for his photography studio such as a new camera and computer. Vital plans to reinvest the profits from his loan into his business.

loans.use: to buy materials for his photography studio

loans.name: Tan

texts.en: Tan V. T. is 48 years old and has three children, two of whom attend university. He has been a farmer for many years, and today grows a range of crops that include rice and vegetables. He also owns a small herd of cows. He joined our microloan program in 2007 and has made good use of loans to expand his farm. Because he has been such a reliable client, the size of his loans has increased annually. He is now applying for a loan of 9,810,000 VND to buy  fertilizer for his next crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more electronic items

loans.name: Chorn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chorn is the group leader, as selected by the four members of a group loan. Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standards of living. 

Mrs. Chorn was born in 1957. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. She is a widow with three children. One of the children is a grocery seller who gets a low salary, while the other one is a stave maker. The third is still studying in local public school. 

Now Mrs. Chorn has a problem because one of her children is going to be married. She needs some money to support the costs of the wedding. To improve this condition, Mrs. Chorn is asking for a loan to pay for her child’s wedding.

loans.use: To pay for her child’s wedding.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en: Delphine Abong is 23 years old, lives in Kisumu city, is married and has a two-year-old child. For the last two years, she has made a living by selling second-hand clothes and is now applying for her first loan, which she plans to use to buy more clothing to sell to her customers. She is confident that she can make good use of this loan because she currently earns enough money to meet her family's needs and prepare to pay her child's school fees. In the future, she hopes to provide her family with a better life by continuing to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Le

texts.en: Le T. C.  is 40 years old and has two children, both of whom are in high school. She makes a living by running a shop where she sells fresh fish and meat that she procures daily from a local supplier. She earns about 100,000 VND in profit from her work. She went into business in 2005, after securing a loan from our program, and has made good use of the funds she has borrowed. She is applying for a new loan, for 8,502,000 VND, to buy equipment that will allow her to provide better service to her custmers.

loans.use: to buy equipment for a small meat and seafood business.

loans.name: Sab

texts.en:
Mrs. Sab was born in 1983 and she is a wedding beautician and a pig breeder. She earns enough profit to support her family. 

Since business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So to fulfill this purpose, Mrs. Sab is applying for a loan to buy five more piglets, pig food, and to build a pigsty. Her husband, Mr. Phorlla, is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land where he can grow rice. He will sell some of the rice and rest of the rice will support his family. Through this activity, they support a child who is attending a local public school. Her husband is presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy five piglets, pig food, and to build a pigsty.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet U. lives in the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old, widowed and has three grown children. She makes a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells canned goods, snacks, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits to people who live in her community. She has been in this line of work for more than five years and earns about 10,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2010, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid two previous loans from HSPFI and is applying for a new one, for 8,000 PHP, to buy more goods to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to continue expanding her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel M. E. de treinta y cinco años de edad vive en Lourdes en el departamento de La Libertad. El posee una tienda en su residencia desde hace mas de tres años, la cual le ayuda a solventar las necesidades de su hogar. Su tienda es muy reconocida por las personas pues siempre encuentran lo que necesitan además el lugar es muy higiénico y en el les ofrece muy buen servicio. Miguel es un hombre que se esmera por salir adelante y por ello además de la tienda ofrece servicio de transporte cuando lo requieren sus mismos clientes de la tienda. La demanda en su tienda por parte de sus clientes ha sido más frecuente, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más productos como cereales, lácteos, bebidas, productos enlatados entre otros. Miguel es un hombre de metas y espera que su negocio le permita cumplirlas además le dé un futuro mejor y más seguro económicamente.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel M. E. is 35 years old and lives in Lourdes, in La Libertad department.  He has a store in his home which he has had for more than three years.  His business helps him to cover his household needs.  Miguel's store is very well known because people can always find what they need there, it is very hygienic and he offers very good customer service.

Miguel is a man who goes to a lot of trouble to get ahead in life and, for this reason, he also offers a transport service whenever the customers who shop in his store require it.   Miguel's customer demand has increased and so he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy more products such as cereals, dairy products, drinks, canned goods, etc.  Miguel is a man who has goals to achieve and he hopes that his business will allow him achieve these goals and also provide him with a better and more financially-secure future.

loans.use: to buy cereals, dairy products, drinks and canned goods

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Therese

texts.en:
Therese is 62 years old and is married with one child. She owns a small business selling various goods such as breads, cakes and soft drinks in her store. This business is well organized. Therese has 7 years of experience and her business is open from 6am until 8pm every day except on Sunday. She currently employs three people to help her. 

Therese has now requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to increase her business by purchasing new goods like cooking oil, rice, breads and so on for resale. She will be able to satisfy her customers, which will help her to earn more profits. With any profits, she will reinvest in her business and she plans to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase various goods to sell like breads, cooking oil, and rice

loans.name: Lallan's Group

texts.en:
Lallan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her livestock business. She will use the loan money to buy goats and sheep to sell for profit to butchers. Her business grows busier during the Muslim festival of Eid-ul-Azha because people purchase animals to slaughter. 

She is married to K. B. who is involved in different kinds of work to financially support the family. He is a rickshaw driver as well as a farmer. He provides transport services to his passengers. He also works in the field growing different seasonal crops.  

Lallan has given birth to a son and 2 daughters. Her children are very young and are not of school age yet. Lallan is fully aware of the importance of education. She wasn't educated due to the poor financial conditions of her parents, but she wants to provide a good quality education to her children. 

She has been doing this business for the past 10 years and hopes that the loan investment will be profitable for her. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She is a responsible client and paid her responsibilities efficiently.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for selling

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is 35 years old and married with 3 children between the ages 3 and 8 years old. Jean Marie Vianney earns a living by sewing different styles of clothes. This is his 10th successful year in this business. His business is well-organized. He employs three people to help him.

Jean Marie Vianney needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more fabric for sewing. By expanding his business and adding more equipment and workers, Jean Marie Vianney hopes to earn more profits, and he will save for his future. Thus, he will create another job for the people in his community.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric for sewing

loans.name: Leonilo

texts.en:
Leonilo C. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. He is 54 years old. Leonilo is single. To make a living, Leonilo owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling vegetables like eggplants & squash & retailing rice per kilogram in the local community. Leonilo has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leonilo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Leonilo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Leonilo is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional sacks of rice to be retailed. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Leonilo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to be retailed.

loans.name: Manushak

texts.en:
Manushak M. was born in 1966. She is a widow and she lives in Kapan city with her two sons. Manushak’s daughter is already married and she lives separately. Manushak’s younger son is a student. Her elder son helps Manushak in her business, which consists of fruits and vegetable trading in Kapan market. 

Previously, Manushak was engaged in clothes trading, but then she decided to change her business because she believes that food trading is more profitable. Part of Manushak's income goes towards her younger son’s education and another part is spent towards supporting her family. 

This is Manushak’s 7th loan from Nor Horizon. This time she is seeking a 600.000 AMD loan to buy tomatoes, cucumbers and fruits to resell.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, cucumbers and fruits to resell.

loans.name: Mr. Ly Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Ly, who was born in 1949, is the village bank president, as selected by ten people who make up a village bank loan. Each portion of the loan will be used for different purposes to improve their families' standards of living. 

Mr. Ly is a vice village chief and a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land where he can grow rice. He sells part of the rice and uses the rest of the rice to support his family. In the rice field he has some problems because it is time for growing. So to improve this condition, Mr. Ly is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to do farming this dry season. He is a widower and has three children, one of whom is a monk, while the other one is a seamstress in a garment factory. The third child is a cow breeder.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to do farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy steering wheel covers, oil and cleaning fluids

loans.name: Alansan

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Alansan from Kissy, Sierra Leone. He is married with one child who is four years old. Alansan’s child attends school. He also takes care of three relatives.

Alansan runs a food commodities store. He sells rice, sugar, oil, and flour. He has been running this business for seven years. Alansan has requested a loan in order to purchase more food commodities. The extra income from this loan will allow him to expand his business and improve his standard of living. In the future, he plans to open another branch shop.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, sugar, oil, and flour.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly F. is from the village of Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 48 years old. Beverly is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Beverly owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, junk foods, shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community. Beverly has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Beverly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Beverly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Beverly is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, detergents & junk foods. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Beverly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, detergents & junk foods.

location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Teresa Ermelinda

texts.es: Teresa Ermelinda G. M. D. cuarenta y tres años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida en Ilopango departamento D. San Salvador. Ella tiene una venta D. productos D. uso personal y belleza, es con esto que ella sostiene su familia. Teresa es una excelente vendedora y es muy servicial, la gente prefiere sus productos porque son D. muy buena calidad y a un buen precio. La demanda D.  parte D. sus clientes ha aumentado últimamente y esto la motivo a solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más cremas, perfumes, desodorantes, cosméticos entre otros. Teresa como toda mujer dedicada está dispuesta a sacar adelante su negocio para que en un futuro este le ayuD. a darle una mejor calidad D. vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa Ermelinda G. M. is 43 years old.  She lives with her life partner in Ilopango, in San Salvador department.  Teresa sells personal care products and beauty products in order to support her family.  Teresa is an excellent saleswoman and is very helpful.  People like to buy her products because they are good quality and a good price.

Teresa's customer demand has increased recently and so she decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL which would allow her to buy more creams, perfumes, deodorants, cosmetics and other products.  Teresa, in common with all dedicated women, is keen to get ahead in her business so that, in the future, it will help her to proviD. her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes, deodorants and cosmetics

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina M. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 60 years old. Josefina is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Josefina owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish, like sardines & milk fish, in the local community. She also buys and sells coconuts & bananas. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josefina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts & bananas. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Josefina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts & bananas.

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 24 year old, single man. He repairs vehicles in grogan Ngara area, near the city center. This is his primary business which he has been doing for the past four years. He earns a good income.

Leonard has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD. so that he can improve his services to his customers. He hopes to accomplish this by buying more tools (e.g. spanners for KES.10,000 and screw drivers & nuts worth KES.20,000) so that he can manage to attend to all issues raised by his customers.

He desires to further his education in future.

loans.use: to buy tools like spanners for KES10,000 and screw drivers and nuts for KES20,000

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel S. A. de 34 años de edad habita en casa propia con sus dos pequeños hijos  uno de los cuales se encuentra estudiando. Isabel tiene una tienda en su hogar de residencia en la cual ofrece productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, papel, detergente, golosinas, productos de belleza, verduras, bebidas. Además de esto también se dedica a la venta de ropa. En el Municipio de Sonsonate del Departamento de Sonsonate. Es una mujer increíble con muchos sueños y metas. Ha trabajado durante mucho tiempo para mantener su tiendita y quiere seguir haciéndolo para que un día pueda pasar a manos de sus hijos y les pueda seguir dando frutos como hasta ahora a sido con ella. Esto la ha impulsado a solicitar este préstamo a INTEGRAL ya que es la única forma de poder abastecer su negocio con variedad de productos de primera necesidad tales como: cereales, detergentes, golosinas, verduras, accesorios de belleza, condimentos etc.  Para que su negocio luzca más atractivo y los clientes sigan prefiriéndola. De esta manera poder aspirar a una mejor vida para sus hijos.
texts.en: Isabel S. A. is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her 2 small children, one of whom is in school.  Isabel has a store in her house where she offers everyday consumer goods such as: rice, sugar, toilet paper, detergent, candy, beauty products, vegetables and drinks.  In addition to this she also has a business selling clothing in the municipality of Sonsonate in the Sonsonate department.  She is an extraordinary woman who has a lot of dreams and goals.  She has worked for a long time to keep her little store running, and she wants to continue doing this work so that some day she can pass the business on to her children and it can continue to provide for them, as it has done for her.  This has motivated her to request this loan from INTEGRAL, since this is the only way that she will be able to supply her business with a variety of consumer products such as: cereals, detergents, sweets, vegetables, beauty products, condiments, etc.  This will make her business will look more appealing so that the customers will choose to shop there.  In this way, she hopes to be able to provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: To buy cereals, detergents, sweets, vegetables, beauty products, and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy livestock, seeds and pesticide

loans.name: Otgonsuren

texts.en: Otgonsuren is 41 years old and lives with her husband and son and daughter, who are 18 and 15 years old respectively. The family lives in Mongolia's capital, Ulaanbaatar, in a ger or a traditional tent. Both of her children attend public school while her husband works as a firefighter. Otgonsuren supports her family by operating two retail stalls where she sells building materials. She began her business by selling lamps but has since expanded it to also sell electric cords, locks, electric plugs, extension cords and other accessories. She is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy more materials to sell to her customers during the busy shopping season ahead. Her main goal for 2011 is to build a house where her family will enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more hardware to sell to her customers during the upcoming busy shopping season

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo T. P. de 41 años de edad reside en su casa junto a esposa y dos hijas que se encuentran cursando sus primeros años de estudio. Él es un hombre decidido y comprometido en su trabajo. Trabajado esmeradamente para sacar adelante a su familia por lo que día a día se las ingenia para llevar el sustento a su casa. Don Wilfredo se dedica a la compra y venta de pan dulce, venta de desechables y productos de primera necesidad como son cereales, huevos, aceite, detergente etc. Su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado de San Martin del Departamento de San Salvador que es muy visitado ya que Don Wilfredo siempre  agrada a las personas que lo visitan ofreciéndoles calidad, variedad de pan dulce y productos de primera necesidad. Durante algún tiempo acá ha observado que sus productos son muy demandados y cada vez hay más personas buscandolo. Debido a esto ha esto ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar más productos como: variedad de pan dulce, desechables,  cereales(azúcar, frijoles, arroz), aceite, huevos, entre otros. De esta forma espera satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes así como sus propias necesidades y las de su familia. Ya que confía que su nivel de ventas se vera incrementado y por ende sus ganancias.
texts.en: Wilfredo T. P. is 41 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and 2 children, who are in elementary school.  He is a stalwart man who is committed to his work.  He works diligently to get ahead with his family, and day by day he manages to provide for the household.  Wilfredo has a business buying and selling pan dulce (sweet rolls), disposable tableware, and consumer staples such as cereals, eggs, cooking oil, detergent, etc.  His business is located in the San Martin market in the San Salvador department. This is a very busy place where Wilfredo always pleases his customers by offering them quality products and a large variety of sweet rolls and consumer goods.  Over his time there he has observed that his products are in high demand, and that every day more people are seeking out his business.  Because of this, he has decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL to purchase more products such as: a variety of sweet rolls, disposable tableware, consumer staples (cereals, sugar, beans, rice), cooking oil, eggs and other items.  In this way he hopes to satisfy the needs of his customers and also meet the needs of his own family, since he is confident that his sales will be increases and as a result so will his earnings.

loans.use: to buy more products such as: a variety of sweet rolls, disposable tableware, consumer staples (cereals, sugar, beans, rice), cooking oil, eggs and other items

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose R. is twenty five years old, married, and is a mother of two children.  She lives in Cheplaskei on the outskirts of Eldoret.  She sells vegetables in the same area and has been doing so for four years. She earns a monthly income of KES 7,000.

This will be Rose's second loan from KADET LTD.  She had successfully repaid her first loan, and will use this new loan to buy more vegetables to sell.   In the future, she wants to open a bigger grocery store and educate her children to the highest level.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Regine

texts.en:
Regine is 38 years old.  She is married and has three children between 3 and 15 years old. She has owned her small general store for about three years.  Regine sells sugar, cooking oil, clothes, shoes, and so on.

Regine has requested a Kiva loan so that she can expand her shop by adding more cosmetics products, foodstuffs like sugar, rice and different types of flour, as well as other goods which seem to be in high demand in her area.  With the profits that she earns, Regine plans to start saving, pay school fees for her children, and improve her family's situation.

loans.use: To purchase more product to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To have general maintenance done on his truck and to buy tires

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle L. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Annabelle is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Annabelle sells vegetables such as stringbeans, eggplants & cowpeas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Annabelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital for her business. 

Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase additional vegetables like squash & beans to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this investment to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables like squash & beans to sell

loans.name: Rosa América

texts.es: Rosa América C. B. de 47 años de edad habita  en casa propia con sus dos hijos quienes hasta la fecha se encuentran estudiando. Como toda mujer trabajadora y luchadora Doña Rosa ha logrado establecer una tienda, a través de la que suministra productos de primera necesidad, establecida en su misma casa en el Municipio de San Juan Opico del Departamento de La Libertad. Ella trabaja de lleno en su tienda para poder atender a sus clientes cuando necesiten de sus productos como: golosinas, pan dulce, azúcar, macarrones, aceite, juguetes, bebidas, productos de limpieza, entre otros. Depende mucho de su negocio y tiene muchas aspiraciones con las ventas que realiza. Por lo que ha decidido solicitar este crédito para invertirlo en su tienda y poder comprar mayor variedad de productos e innovar su negocio como: cereales, aceite, papel, leche, café, golosinas, y de mas productos que le permitan mejorar su servicio. Ya que como toda mujer emprendedora sabe que debe estar al día con las demandas del mercado. Con esto espera poder obtener los recursos necesarios para vivir en mejores condiciones junto con su familia.
texts.en: Rosa América C. B. is 47 years old and she lives in her own house with two children who are in school. Like a hardworking and courageous woman, Doña Rosa has managed to establish a store where she sells basic products. The store is located in her house in the municipality of San Juan Opico in the department of La Libertad. Rosa works full time in the store to be able to attend to her customers when the need one of her products like: candy, sweet bread, sugar, macaroni, oil, toys drinks, and cleaning products, among others. She depends very much on her business and has many aspirations for the sales that she makes. This is why she has decided to request a loan, to invest in her store and to be able to buy a greater variety of products and to innovate within her business with products like: cereal, oil, paper, milk, coffee and candy and other products that allow her to improve the service she provides. Because like all entreprenuerial women she knows that she has to keep up with the demands of the market. With this she hopes to obtain the necessary resources to live in better conditions with her family.

loans.use: To buy cereal, oil, paper, milk, coffee, and a variety of candy

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia N. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old. Delia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community.  She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Delia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital for her business. 

Delia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to restock her inventory with canned goods & snack foods. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this investment to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more canned goods & snack foods to sell

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia I. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old. Cynthia is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Cynthia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Cynthia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital for her business. 

Cynthia is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP to restock her inventory with products such as detergents & instant noodles. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products like detergents & instant noodles to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand her family's fruits and vegetables shop

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir M. was born in 1984 in Kapan city. He is married and has two children: a two-year-old daughter and a newborn son.  
For about three years Vladimir has been engaged in an auto repair shop. His father helps him in this occupation and from this business they pay for their family’s needs. Vladimir likes his work very much, so he spends a lot of time in his workshop and enjoys his work.   Vladimir needs a $ 1,350 loan to buy the necessary auto spare parts for his business.

loans.use: To buy auto spare parts for his business

loans.name: C9212 Mutimawurugo Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 52 years old.  She is widowed and has seven children between 14 and 20 years old. She is the president of a group called “Mutimawurugo." Agnes sells clothing at the local market. The others in the group have businesses selling beans at the local market. Agnes employs one person in her business and has been working for one year in this business. She is the first person on the left side in the photo, wearing white and black.

Agnes has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy more clothing to sell. She would like to use any profits generated to start saving and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy fresh fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane M. O., 39 years old, is married to Kennedy. Jane runs a cyber café with a good flow of customers located in Komarock, Nairobi. Jane has been running this business for a period of one year, and it gives her a monthly profit of 30,000 KES. She describes herself as hardworking.

Jane was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend. This loan of 40,000 KES is her first loan with KADET LTD, and she intends to buy a printer. If the loan boosts her business, she plans to open another cyber café, which she hopes will be larger in size.

loans.use: To buy a printer

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet K. is 46 years old and married with two children aged twenty-two and seventeen years. She sells secondhand shoes at the Gikomba market which is strategically placed near the city center. For the last thirteen years this has been her primary business.

Harriet has applied for her first loan cycle so that she can expand her business by buying bails of secondhand clothes for sale. She wants to own her own stall in the future and improve her and her family’s lives.

loans.use: To buy more bails of clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy rice and palm oil in bulk to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 22 years old and single. He is a farmer in Nkubu town in eastern Kenya, where he has been farming for the last six years. His mixed farm produces milk, coffee and tea, which are all sold locally. 

John has made a loan request of 36,750 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable him to expand his farming activities and cater for his basic needs. In his farming business, he is faced with challenges in the fluctuation of  market prices for his products, and the prevalence of pests and diseases which affect his production. He plans to expand his dairy farming in the future by acquiring quality-bred dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jaime Godofredo

texts.es: Jaime Godofredo A. A. vive en casa propia con sus dos  pequeños hijos. En el municipio de Tacachico del Departamento de La Libertad. Don Jaime se dedica a la carpintería  en este Municipio por lo que constantemente tiene que estar comprando madera y demás materiales utilizados en la carpintería. Él es muy conocido ya que es muy bueno y responsable como carpintero, para él lo mas importante es la satisfacción de sus clientes. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para poder ofrecer variedad de sus productos a sus clientes. Para esto necesita comprar la materia prima necesaria como: madera, martillos, metal, plástico, entre otros. Pero no puede hacerlo por sus propios medios es por esto que solicita a INTEGRAL este crédito para llevar a cabo su plan ya que tiene la esperanza de que de esta manera su situación económica mejorará.
texts.en: Jaime Godofredo A. A. lives in his own house with his two small children in the municipality of Tacachico in the department of La Libertad. Jaime is a carpenter in this town so he always has to be buying wood and other carpentry materials. He's very well known because he's a good and responsible carpenter. For him the most important thing is his customers' satisfaction. His dream is to expand his business to be able to offer a variety of products to his customers. For this he needs to buy primary materials such as: wood, hammers, metal, plastic, among others. But he's not able to do this by his own means, which is why he's requesting a loan from INTEGRAL. This loan will help him carry out his plan and he hopes that it will improve his economic situation.

loans.use: to buy fine wood and tools for building furniture

loans.name: Work For Yourself Group

texts.en:
Henry B. T. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Henry was born in Masingbi village in northern Sierra Leone. He is married and has 4 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Henry sells used clothes and has been doing this business for many years.

With the help of this loan, Henry and his group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Henry will use his share of the loan (SLL 1,000,000) to buy bales of used clothes to add to his business.

loans.use: Buys used clothing to resell

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: Ana Mercedes P. D. V. vive en casa D. su madre con su compañero D. vida y sus dos hijos. Ana es una mujer luchadora, responsable y dedicada en su trabajo. Tiene un pequeño negocio en donD. venD. panes con pollo, refrescos y frutas. Ubicado  en el Municipio D. San Salvador del Departamento del mismo nombre. Lugar muy transitado y concurrido por estudiantes que siempre prefieren los productos D. doña Ana ya que siempre ofrece un buen servicio y la calidad D. sus productos es indudable. Ella quiere invertir en su negocio para poder contar con mayor variedad D. productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.  Es por esta razón que se decidió por hacer este préstamo a INTEGRAL  para poder comprar  los materiales necesarios como: variedad D. fruta fresca, pan, pollo, verduras,  aderezos,  entre otros. D. esta forma  podría cubrir una mayor cantidad D. clientes los cuales la preferirían por la variedad en sus productos y amabilidad en su trabajo. Y todo esto con la esperanza D. recibir  mejores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Ana Mercedes P. V. lives in her mother’s house with her spouse and two children.  Ana is a tenacious, responsible woman who’s dedicated to her work.  She has a small business selling chicken sandwiches, soft drinks and fruit located in the municipality of San Salvador in San Salvador Department, a place with lots of foot traffic and crowded with students who always prefer Ana’s products because her service and the quality of her products are the best.

She wants to invest in her business in order to have a larger variety of product to offer her customers.  Because of this she decided to take out this loan in INTEGRAL to buy the necessary supplies like: assorted fresh fruit, bread, chicken, vegetables and condiments, among others.  This way she’ll be able to serve a larger number of customers who will prefer her because of the variety of her products and her kindness at work. All of this is with the hope of earning higher income that will allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fresh fruit, bread, chicken, vegetables and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: rebuild her husband's destroyed bakery

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 32 years old and single. He runs a retail shop located in the Tena Estate off outering road, where he has a good flow of customers. He was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of the Eastlands office.

George has been in this business for three years and earns a monthly profit of Ksh 20,000.  He has applied for a second loan of Ksh 29,500 from KADET LTD to add stocks of flour, sugar, cooking oil and sweets to his retail shop. If the loan boosts his business, he plans to open another shop. 

George hopes to operate a wholesale shop. He describes himself as a very hardworking man.

loans.use: To increase his stocks of flour, sugar, cooking oil, and sweets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy clothes in large quantity to resell

loans.name: Paskali

texts.en:
Pascali M. is 55 years old.  He is married to Mary. They live in Kituluni, Kenya.  Pascall runs a  retail shop located at Kituluni market. He was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of the Tala office.

Pascali has been running his business for 10 years.  His business gives him a monthly profit of 10,000 Kshs.  This loan of 50,000 Kshs is his second loan from KADET LTD.  He plans to use it to increase his stocks of sugar, cooking oil, soap, detergents and flour. If the loan boosts his business, he wishes to expand his business.

Pascali describes himself as an honest and hardworking person.

loans.use: restock his store with sugar, cooking oil, soap, detergents and flour

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy torch lights, batteries, toothbrushes/foot brushes, etc. in large quantity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Patrick Kyalo

texts.en:
Patrick is a 36-year-old  gentleman.  He is married and is a father of two children aged between six and two. He has a business selling shoes and has been doing this for the last twelve years. This is his primary business. 

Patrick has applied for a second loan, which he intends to use to expand his business by adding more stock of shoes for sale.  He hopes to expand his business and in the near future own his own farm and a build good house for his family.

loans.use: add more stock of shoes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip has been practicing mixed farming for the last fifteen years in Litein town in Rift Valley Kenya. He sells his products of maize, beans and milk to the local market. 

Philip is 35 and married with five children aged between two and 10 years. All the children attend school except the youngest.

He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes through Kiva Partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable him to pay school fees for his children and improve his family's livelihood.
