He faces the challenge of unpredictable weather conditions and lack of a stable market for his products.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Love Each Other Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present the members of the “Love Each Other” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 1,000,000.00 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Hawanatu K. is the leader of this group. Hawanatu is married with one child. Her husband is a businessman and her child is still not yet of school going age. Hawanatu sells rubber bowls, eggs, cigarettes, etc. and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan she is going to buy more inventory in large quantity in order to increase her business size and quality.

loans.use: To buy rubber bowls, eggs and cigarettes in large quantity in order to increase the size and quality of her business

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is 35 years old and married. He sells computer accessories to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years.  He was previously in the transport business. He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more focused on his business. He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy a photocopy machine and computers.

loans.use: To buy a photocopy machine and computers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used shoes to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard M. is 43, married and has five children aged between eighteen months and thirteen years. Four of the children are currently attending school. He is a farmer in Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya, where he has been farming for the last seven years. He sells milk, maize, vegetables and tea in the local market. He plans to improve his farming despite the challenges of poor weather conditions and a lack of a stable market for his products.

Richard has requested a loan of 35,000 KES through Kiva’s partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help him provide for the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Roderick

texts.en:
Roderick N. A. is 46, married and has five children in school. He is able to raise his children with the income he gets from his workshop where he makes metal doors and windows. He employs three people to help him in his tasks. He also rents out houses for extra income to meet his family’s needs.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to expand his business, thus increasing his number of customers. He has requested 80,000 KES to buy iron sheets. He aspires to operate a big company in the future.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 24-year-old married woman living with her husband and one young child. In 2005, she started running her own business working as a hairdresser and beautician, offering her clients different services such as make up, tattoos, hairdressing etc. She works from her house. Her income is important to help with the household expenses.  Her story exemplifies the day-to-day challenges the Lebanese woman are facing in running a business and at the same time raising children and taking care of their houses.
Today she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new tattoo machinery, additionA. hairdressing tools and beauty products. These purchases will allow her to better support her business. In the future, she is hoping to open a formA. beauty salon where she will be able to serve her customers properly.

loans.use: to purchase new tattoo machinery, additional hairdressing tools and beauty products

loans.name: Kilonzi

texts.en:
Kilonzi M. is 37 year old, married and has three children. For nine years he has been making furniture. He employs four people in his business. He also operates a dairy to supplement his income.

Kilonzi has requested 80,000 KES to open another furniture workshop. He is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because he previously serviced two loans which he used to build up his business. He hopes to fully establish his furniture business in the future.

loans.use: To open another furniture workshop

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 27 years old and married. He has two children. He sells scrap metals and used plastic containers for recycling. He has been running the business for five years.  

Faulu Kenya has been a blessing to John's business because he has managed to use his previous loan to open an outlet of his business.  With his income, he is able to pay his employee and to provide for his family. He hopes to have a stable business in the future. He has requested for a loan of KES 50,000 to buy scrap metals, plastic containers and for personal use.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals, plastic containers and for personal use.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta, aged 39 years, is married and has four children: Raphael, 20 years, Kelvin, 15 years, Irene, 13 years and Japheth, 10 years. They live in Olekatoriori. Benedict runs a retail shop at Olekatoriori center, which is a busy place. Most of her clients are male. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of Kitengela office. He has been in this business for one year and earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000. This loan of KES 50,000 is her second loan from KADET LTD. She plans to add more inventory of sugar, wheat flour, sweets, tea leaves, bread, milk and airtime cards for her shop. 

If the loan boosts her business, she plans to pay the school fees for her children. Benedicta dreams of opening a wholesale shop in the future. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To add inventory of sugar, wheatflour, sweets, tea leaves, bread, milk and airtime cards for her shop.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old and a member of glory group in Faulu Kenya. She sells clothes to earn her living. She has been engaged in her business for eight years. She runs her business with one employee.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Mary has experienced a lot of growth in her business hence improving her living standards. She hopes to expand her business and open another outlet. She wants a loan of 50,000 KES to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Kiprotich

texts.en:
Kiprotich B. is 35 and married with four children aged between four and twelve. He is a dairy farmer in Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been in the dairy business for fifteen years now and employs one farmhand. He sells his milk to the local market. His major challenges have been a lack of enough animal feed and diseases that affect his cows’ milk production.

Kiprotich has requested a loan of 40,000 KES through Kiva’s partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help to pay the school fees for his children. He would like to have a zero grazing unit (stall feeding) within the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her shop’s inventory.

loans.name: Fidelima

texts.en:
Fidelima M. M. is a 46-year-old single mother of one. She operates a butcher shop and is able to raise her child with the income from her business. She has been operating the business for three years and employs two people. She has kept her business premises neat, thus attracting customers.

With a 50,000 KES loan, Fidelima will buy meat and rice to sell. She hopes to open other butcher shops in the future.

loans.use: To buy meat and rice

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand a chicken coop and buy chicks and hardware

loans.name: Margaret Wangui

texts.en:
Margaret Wangui K. is married to Peter, and together they have three children. Margaret operates a hotel and a general store from which she earns an income of 18,000 KES per month. The businesses have been in operation for nine years. Margaret describes herself as hardworking and focused.

Margaret was introduced to KADET LTD by existing clients. Currently she is servicing her ninth loan after successfully paying off her previous loans. She plans to use this loan amount to purchase more stocks of sugar and flour, and tables and seats for her hotel.

Margaret intends to use her anticipated profits to educate her children and save. She plans to grow and expand her businesses so as to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of sugar and flour, and tables and seats for her hotel

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old engaged woman from Lebanon. She is living on her own. She has been working as a private teacher since 2001. She likes her occupation because she feels that she is helping the students to get the needed education. She mostly receives students at her house. She has been active in this profession for the past 15 years and she works hard to be able to handle the heavy life expenses. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to arrange a special room with all the necessary educational equipment so that she can work with students properly. She is a very careful woman and has special concern for children’s education.

loans.use: to arrange a special room with all the necessary educational  equipment.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen W. N. is 29 years old and a single mother of one. She operates a beauty salon. Hellen runs her business in a competitive environment, so she puts extra effort into it. She hopes to expand her current business so as to get enough capital to open another salon.

Hellen is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy hair braids and shampoo and to renovate her salon.

loans.use: To buy hair braids and shampoo and to renovate her salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice A. O. is 43 years old, married, and has three school-aged children.  She has been tailoring for the past nine years.  She also relies on her husband for financial support.  She is a hardworking woman who hopes to expand her business so that she can become financially stable in the future.  She is requesting a loan for 10,000 KES to buy fabric.

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent A. is 23 years old, married, and has two children. He owns a business selling beans, sorghum, and maize. His business is well-known with two employees. Innocent has four years of experience in his business.

Innocent is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, which he will use to purchase a large quantity of beans, sorghum, and maize.  These items will help him to satisfy his customers' needs. Innocent will able to earn more profits to reinvest in his business and he will pay school fees for his two children.

loans.use: To purchase beans, sorghum, and maize

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en: Stanley, a married man with two children in school, has been operating a grocery for two years.  He runs his business in Kibera's slums, so most of his customers are low-income earners.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Stanley has seen steady growth in his business and hopes to develop it into a wholesale operation in the future.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jecklor Wayua

texts.en: Jecklor Wayua N.'s primary business is operating a general store in Tala, which she has been doing for the last eight years.  Her income is 16,000 KES a month.  Jecklor was introduced to KADET, LTD by existing clients and she is requesting her first loan. She plans to use the loan to add stock in her general store with items like cooking fat, flour, and  fruits.  She will save the profits that she will earn and buy more food items for sale so as to be financially stable. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase cooking fat, flour, and fruits

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 21-year-old engaged man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and two siblings. He has two years of experience working with mobile phones. He began as an employee in a mobile phone shop and opened his own store in 2009. With his loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will increase his selection of mobile phones and prepaid telephone cards for resale. The majority of phone users in Lebanon purchase these prepaid cards.

 He reports that both his business productivity and his income will increase as a result of the loan. He is planning to get married soon, so his only purpose at this time is to earn a higher income in order to gather the needed resources to complete all the wedding preparations.

loans.use: to expand his selection of mobile phones and prepaid telephone cards.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude, a single 23-year-old, makes a living by selling a variety of goods such as rice, sugar, beans, body lotion, cooking oil and so on. His three-year-old business is well-organized, and he employs one person to help him.

Jean Claude has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy a variety of goods including body lotion, beans, and cooking oil to sell. With the additional profits arising from the loan, Jean Claude hopes to continue reinvesting in his business and to build his own house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as body lotion, beans, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface, 27, has been selling second-hand clothes for the past five years to earn a living.  A hardworking man who aspires to own apartments, Boniface has learned how to manage both his business and his finances through Faulu Kenya.   He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy more clothes for his enterprise.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie, a 31-year-old married mother of four children between the ages of 7 and 12 years old, is widely known for her business of selling a variety of goods such as sugar, rice, cooking oil, etc. In business for about five years now, she employs four people, and her hours of operation are 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. daily.

Eugenie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by adding such foods as rice and beans and acquiring more sugar, cooking oil, etc. She will reinvest the increased profits to ensure long-term financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as sugar, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Corina

texts.es: Corina tiene 35 años. Desde hace 13 años se dedica a una pulpería, negocio que atiende desde la mañana hasta en la noche, de esta manera su economía se ha estabilizado. Por lo que su necesidad de generar ingresos fue lo que la motivo ha establecer este medio de vida, tiene clientela fija y sus ventas son aseguradas por lo que tiene muchos deseos de seguir creciendo. Es su tercer crédito que está solicitando para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, pan, detergentes, sopas y enlatados. Desea obtener otro negocio en donde pueda brindar más ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en: Corina is 35 years old and for the past 13 years she has had a grocery store. She attends to her business from the morning until night time and this is how her finances have stabilized. She needed to generate an income so it is what motivated her establish this business. She has a loyal client base so her sales are secured and so she is very eager to keep growing. This is the third loan which she requests go purchase sweets, soft drinks, basic grains, bread, detergents, soups, and canned goods. She wants to establish another business from where to earn an additional source of income.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, soft drinks, basic grains, bread, detergents, soups, and canned goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doris, reside en Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután, tiene 35 años de edad, es viuda, vive en compañía de sus dos hijos  son gemelos de 2 años y medio de edad. Ella administra una Nevería, que es la venta de helados, la compraron hace 8 años, trabaja de lunes a domingo, es propio y necesita reparar una cámara refrigerante y también comprar mercadería.
Ella solicita un préstamo que cubra su gasto, que le permita tener en buenas condiciones la cámara refrigerante y al mismo tiempo surtir de mas mercadería el negocio.
Su aspiración es ampliarse a administrar dos locales, trabajando siempre por las buenas condiciones para sus hijos.
texts.en: Doris resides in Puerto el Triunfo, Usulután.  She is 35 years old, widowed and lives with her two and half year old twin boys.  She owns and has run a “Nevería” (ice cream shop) for 8 years. She is requesting a loan to cover the costs of repairing a display freezer and to purchase additional merchandise to keep her shop stocked.  She hopes to expand her business and run two locations.  Providing for her children’s needs remains the end goal of her work.

loans.use: To purchase a display freezer

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is 46 years old, married and has four children.  She operates a curio shop to earn her living. She has eight years of experience in the business.  She hopes to grow her business in the future. She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to buy necklaces and African designed fabric.

loans.use: To buy necklaces and African design fabric.

loans.name: Jose Jeovany

texts.es:
José, tiene 28 años de edad, reside en Usulután, es empleado, vive con su esposa y su hija, la casa es familiar, trabaja de lunes a viernes y en ocasiones los domingos desde hace tres años, en un comercial.
El solicita un préstamo para complementar la compra de un vehículo, este dinero le ayudara a realizar la compra de este medio de transporte que le servirá para trasladarse hacia su empleo.
Su aspiración es trabajar por ver a su familia en buenas condiciones, que su hija crezca sanamente y darle todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
José is 28 years old. He lives in Usulután. He is employed and he lives with his wife and daughter in a family home. For three years, he has worked from Monday to Friday and occasionally, on Sundays for a company.
He is requesting a loan to supplement the purchase of a vehicle. This money will help him make the purchase of this means of transportation which will take him to work. 
His wish is to work in order to see his family living in good conditions, to see that his daughter grows up in a healthy way and to give her everything she needs.

loans.use: to supplement the purchase of a vehicle

loans.name: Eliazar

texts.en:
Eliazar is 33 years old and married. He has one child. For five years, he has been operating a cafeteria. He also owns a tailoring shop for extra income.  He was previously doing carpentry. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Eliazar's business has improved, as has his living standards. He hopes to expand his business in order to employ many people. He has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to buy a deep freezer and a cooler box.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer and a cooler box.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a member of Lion Head group in Faulu Kenya. He does quarrying to earn his living. He has been in the business for six years.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, John has grown, financially. Now, he is able to provide for his family comfortably. He hopes to have a stable business in the future. With KES 30,000 he will buy a machine for extracting stones.

loans.use: To buy a machine for extracting stones.

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es:
Ricardo de 39 años de edad, reside en Santa María Usulután, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, vive con su familia y sus hijos de 11 y 8 años de edad, comenzó hace 2 años a comprar y vender pan.
Por el momento solicita un préstamo para el mantenimiento de una motocicleta, ya que no dispone en su totalidad del gasto y en la motocicleta, distribuye el pan a los clientes.
Sus aspiraciones a futuro, es ser dueño de una panadería, que tenga muchos clientes y le permita crecer como microempresario
texts.en: Ricardo, who is 39, lives in Santa María, in Usulután, where he works making and selling bread. He lives with his family and children, aged 11 and 8. Two years ago he started buying and selling bread. At the moment he requests a loan for the maintenance of his motorcycle, since he does not have enough to cover all the expenses and he uses the motorcycle to deliver the bread to his customers. His dream for the future is to be the owner of a bakery that has many customers, allowing him to grow as a micro-businessman.

loans.use: to pay for maintaining his motorcycle.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna A. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Edna is separated her spouse and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Edna owns & operates a computer & videoke services to local community members. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Edna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide computer and videoke services. Edna is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the business. 

This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Edna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the computer and videoke business.

loans.name: Ruth Maria

texts.es:
Ruth, tiene 35 años de edad, reside en puerto el triunfo departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de merienda, vive con su familia y dos hijas de 18 y 15 años de edad. El negocio lo tiene cerca al centro escolar de puerto el triunfo, tiene 5 años de estar en este lugar comercializando.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para preparar las meriendas, como pollo, frijol, aceite y condimentos, le ayudara a tener lo necesario para seguir trabajando.
Su aspiración es ser dueña de un comedor grande, que atienda a mucha clientela y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ruth is 35 years old and resides in Puerto El Triunfo, Usulutan department. She sells meals and lives with her family and 2 daughters, aged 18 and 15. Her business is located near an educational center in Puerto El Triunfo and has been at this location for 5 years.

At present, Ruth is requesting a loan to buy supplies for preparing meals, including chicken, beans, cooking oil, and condiments. This will help her to have the necessities and continue working.

Her aspiration is to own a large dining place that can serve a larger clientèle and provide greater economic stability.

loans.use: TO BUY COOKING SUPPLIES: CHICKEN, BEANS, OIL, AND CONDIMENTS FOR HER FOOD STALL

loans.name: The Three Pines Group

texts.es:
El grupo los tres Pinos lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras ellos son Margarita del Carmen B., María del Carmen V. B. y Pedro José Enríquez originarios de Masaya, ciudad de las Flores.
La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Margarita del Carmen B. quien se dedica al comercio de ropa de todo tipo desde vestidos, camisetas, shores etc. Ella invertirá el crédito en mercadería de temporada como los trajes de baño, los shores, camisa y vestidos veraniegos.
Los otros integrantes María del Carmen V. tiene una pequeña pulpería la cual inicio con la venta de chiverías y Pedro José Enríquez vende mercadería en general es decir de topo un poco.
texts.en:
The group named "The Three Pines" is made up of three hard working, enterprising individuals, who expend their efforts. They are Margarita del Carmen B., Maria del Carmen V. B., and Pedro Jose E.. They are originally from Masaya, known as the city of flowers.

The coordinator of the group is Margarita del Carmen B. and she has a clothing store selling all types of garments, including dresses, t-shirts, shorts, etc. She will invest her loan in the purchase of merchandise for the season, such as bathing suits, shorts, shirts, and summer dresses.  As for the other members, Maria del Carmen V. has a small grocery store  that she started out by selling souvenirs, and Pedro Jose E. has a general store, meaning  that he sells a little bit of everything.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing for resale

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es:
Doña Elsa, tiene 52 años de edad, reside en Usulután, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y maicillo, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijas de 20 y 24 años de edad. 
Cultiva la tierra en compañía de su esposo, desde hace 18 años, y en este momento iniciaran los cultivos para lo cual, solicita un préstamo y comprar abonos y demás insumos para la siembra, además de pagar el alquiler del terreno y adquirirá todo lo necesario para el cuido del cultivo.
Su objetivo es mantenerse de estos cultivos, sustentar las necesidades de su familia y continuar año tras año con este trabajo.
texts.en:
Doña Elsa is 52 years old and lives in Usulután with her husband and two daughters, ages 20 and 24.  She grows corn and millet for a living.

With the help of her husband, she has been farming land for 18 years.  They are about to begin the planting season and need a loan to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies, as well as pay for land rental and crop care products.  

Her goal is to take good care of her crops to provide everything her family needs and to keep on working year after year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies, and pay for land rental

loans.name: El Jocotal Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Jocotal lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras ellas son María Lucrecia O. Urbina, Neli Susana S. y Lila Lastenia G. Cano originario de Diría municipio de Masaya.
La coordinadora del grupo es la señora María Lucrecia O. quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, perfumes y ropa desde hace varios años. Ella inicio vendiendo cosméticos Avon y luego fue creciendo su negocio.
Actualmente O. con el crédito invertirá en mercadería de temporada es decir a provechar la semana santa.
Las otras integrantes Lila Lastenia G. tiene una comideria en la que invertirá el crédito y Neli Susana S. tiene una panadería y con el crédito comprará materia prima.
texts.en:
The group named "Jocotal" is made up of three hard working, enterprising individuals who expend their efforts. They are Maria Lucrecia O. Urbina, Neli Susana S., and Lila Lastenia G. Cano. They are originally from the Diria municipality in Masaya. 

The coordinator of the group is Maria Lucrecia O. and she has had a business selling cosmetics, perfumes, and clothing for many years. She started out selling Avon brand cosmetics and with time she expanded her business. She will invest her loan in the purchase of seasonal merchandise in order to take advantage of Holy Week. 

As for the other members of the group, Lila Lastenia G. and she has a restaurant in which she will invest her loan, and Neli Susana S. who has a bakery and with her loan she will purchase ingredients.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Francisca Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña francisca tiene 41 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de verduras y a la agricultura, vive con su esposo y dos hijos. Inicio el negocio por que en su familia se lo enseñaron, tiene un año de esta atendiéndolo, trabajado todos los días.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería e insumos agrícolas, ya que quiere sembrar una parcela de terreno, con este préstamo llevara a cabo las inversiones y contara con más ingresos en un futuro.
Su aspiración es aumentar su negocio de verduras, generar más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Francisca is 41 years old and lives in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután with her husband and two children.  She sells vegetables and is a crop farmer, which is the business her family taught her.  She has been doing this for a year and works every day.

She is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies so she can plant a patch of land and increase her income.

Her goal is to expand her vegetable business and make more money for her family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies (fertilizer)

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: La señora Maura tiene 47 años tiene 4 hijos y 3 menores de edad que todavía  están su cargo. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos. La señora ya tiene 6 años de haber empezado con su negocio,  inicio su actividad en su vivienda, fue así que la mayoría de sus clientes la conocen. El crédito será invertido en la compra de cerdos sus ganancias se incrementan ya que es ahora cuando los precios están bajos. Además ella desea vende al por mayor sus mercancías, pues así la mayoría de sus clientes saben el buen servicio que ofrece. El sueño siempre ha sido realizar mejoras a su casa.
texts.en: Maura is 47 years old and she has 4 children, three of whom are minors and they are still in her care. She has a business buying and selling pigs. She has 6 years in the business and she started her business on her property. This is how the majority of her clients know her.  The loan will be invested in the purchase of pigs so that her earnings will increased, especially now when the prices are affordable. She also wants to sell her merchandise in wholesale, and the majority of her clients know the good customer service that she provides. Her dream has always been to make some home improvements.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.es: El señora Tatiana dedicada a la venta de comida ya hace años atrás esta es la actividad con la que puede colaborar en la economía de su familia, actualmente cuenta con dos hijos que se  encuentran en edad escolar y a los que debe de alimentar de la mejor manera, junto a su esposo el que también es parte de la elaboración y venta de comida ya que siempre esta ayudándole a su esposa. El crédito que solicita la señora es para poder comprar cocina más grande y nueva e insumos para su producción. Los deseos de la señora es poder abrir su propio restaurant donde pueda servir platos típicos de nuestra ciudad, La Sra. Tatiana es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora con grande s deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Tatiana's business is selling meals.  She has been in this business for years and it enables her to contribute to her family's finances.  She currently has two school-age children who she must feed in the best way she can, with her husband's help.  Her husband takes part in making and selling the meals.  He is always helping his wife. 

Tatiana is requesting this loan so that she can buy a new, bigger stove and supplies for making her meals.  She would like to be able to open her own restaurant where she could sell our city's traditional dishes.  Tatiana is a very responsible and hard-working person who has a great desire to improve her quality of life.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to buy a new stove and supplies

loans.name: Ana Ersidia

texts.es:
Ana tiene 35 años D. edad, resiD. en Jiquilisco, departamento D. Usulután, se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado, además es secretaria vive con su esposo que es ganadero, juntos administran el negocio, pero ella es empleada como secretaria, tienen cinco años D. comercializar ganado.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar reces, su objetivo con la compra en aumentar sus reces ir creciendo en el negocio, para luego comercializarlas.
Su objetivo es aumentar cada día más su potencial ganadero, ayudara a su familia y juntos avanzar a una mejor condición económica.
texts.en:
Ana is 35 years of age and resides in Jiquilisco, department of Usulután. She works raising cattle for sale and is also a secretary. She lives with her husband who is a cattle farmer with whom she jointly runs the business although she is employed as a secretary. They have been in the cattle business for five years.

She is seeking a loan to buy cows. Her objective is to increase their number of cattle, thus growing the business, and later sell them. Her goal is to continually increase her capacity as a cattle farmer, help her family, and together rise to better economic circumstances.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Reginaldo

texts.es:
Don Reginaldo, tiene 68 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, se dedica a  la compra y venta de cerdos, vive con su esposa y no tienen hijos, don Reginaldo tiene mucha experiencia en el negocio aprendió de sus patrones a trabajar con cerdos.
Actualmente necesita realiza la compra de cerdos y comprar mercadería para abastecer otro negocio donde ofrece productos de consumo, esta inversión le ayudara a aumentar la granja de cerdos y a ofrecer a los clientes diversidad de producto.
El quiere aumentar su comercio de cerdos, expandirse aun mercado más grande, así generar mayores ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Don Reginaldo is 68 years old and lives in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután.  He lives with his wife and has no children.  His business is buying and selling pigs.  He learned to work with pigs and acquired his expertise thanks to what his landlords taught him.

Currently he needs to buy pigs and goods for his consumer products business.  This investment will help him increase his livestock farm and allow him to offer his customers a wider variety of products.

He wants to expand his pig business into a larger market to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy pigs and consumer products

loans.name: Rene Alexander

texts.es:
René, tiene 37 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, es agricultor y ganadero, vive con su familia, su esposa y sus hijos, el heredo este oficio de sus padres, hoy es el principal ejecutor del movimiento, realiza los cultivos desde hace 16 años.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos agrícolas, para la siembra y el alquiler de una manzana de terreno, este préstamo le ayuda a pagar el alquiler y compra los insumos necesarios para poner en marcha la nueva siembra de este año.
Él aspira aumentar su producción y por ende que su ganado le dé más leche para comercializarla y ganar mejores ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
René, 37, lives in Jiquilisco, Usulután department with his wife and children.  He’s a farmer and raises livestock and has done this work for the past 16 years-skills that he inherited from his parents. He is the principal farmer in his family now.

René is requesting a loan to buy agricultural products for planting and to rent about a hectare of land.  The money will be used for the rent and to buy the necessary supplies to start the cultivation for this year.

He would like to increase his dairy production and see that his cows give more milk for sale and then he can receive a better income for his family.

loans.use: To rent farmland to  buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Eugenio De Jesus

texts.es:
Don Eugenio, tiene 52 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, es agricultor en pequeño, sembrando maíz y maicillo, vive con su familia, tiene 12 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, lo aprendió de sus padres. 
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas y preparación de terreno, este préstamo le ayudara a realizar con anticipación lo necesario para la siembra.
El quiere aumentar su producción, tener una buena cosecha y generar más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Don Eugenio is 52 years old and lives in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután with his family.  He has been in farming on a small scale for 12 years and grows corn and millet.  He learned his trade from his parents.

Currently, he is in need of a loan to buy farm supplies and prepare the land before the actual planting season arrives.

He wants to increase production and obtain a good harvest to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and prepare his land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products to stock up the chalet.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita D. is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 48 years old. Lucita is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Lucita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, junk foods, beverages, biscuits, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Lucita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lucita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lucita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. 

Lucita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods & junk foods. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lucita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & junk foods.

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia N. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old. Emilia is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Emilia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, junk foods, shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community. Emilia's husband is providing motorela or habal-habal services. Emilia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Emilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Emilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Emilia is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods & junk foods for her retailing business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Emilia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & junk foods for her retailing business.

loans.name: Linda Mary

texts.es:
Linda Mary C., mujer trabajadora, esforzada, emprendedora y con iniciativa ella inicio hace dos años con el comercio de ropa, está actividad la empezó con la venta de unas cuantas piezas de ropa la cual fue  ha aumentado gracias a los préstamos. 

C. está muy a gradecida con adim por los beneficios que le ha proporcionado tanto en crédito como en capacitación lo que le ha permitido primeramente mejorar su autoestima, invertir y administrar su negocio.
texts.en:
Linda Mary C. is a hard-working, determined and enterprising woman.  Through her own initiative, she started a clothes business two years ago.  She started out selling just a few items of clothes but she has increased her inventory thanks to loans.

Ms C. is very grateful to ADIM for the benefits that they have provided her with both in terms of loans and also training which has allowed her to improve her self-esteem, invest and manage her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothes)

loans.name: Karla Sugey

texts.es: Karla Sugey tiene 22 años. Tiene 3 hijos pero solamente 1 está a su cargo. La actividad económica es la compra y venta de cerdos, hace más de 6 años que posee este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, por lo que sus inicios surgen con muy poco capital, pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Por lo que tenía que pagar las cuentas de su vivienda y además proporcionarles a sus hijos estudios y alimentación. El financiamiento que solicita es para comprar de 2 cerdos grandes y también para comprarle alimento. Su mayor sueño es seguir incrementando su negocio.
texts.en:
Karla Sugey is 22 years old.  She has three children but only one is in her care.  Karla's business is buying and selling pigs.  She has been in this business for more than 6 years and the business is located on her property.  She started out with very little capital but a great desire to get ahead in life as she had to pay her household bills and provide her children with food and an education.

The loan that Karla is requesting will be used to buy two big pigs and also some animal feed.  Her biggest dream is to continue increasing her business.

loans.use: to buy two big pigs

loans.name: Construyendo Sueños Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama CONSTRUYENDO SUEÑOS porque para el grupo, recibir un prestamo, es comenzar a construir sueños en sus negocios, el cual atraiga mejoras y se vea reflejado economicamente en las vidas de cada una de las integrantes del grupo. Esta ubicado en Hidalgo, México. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes. La señora Yaneth P. H. es integrante del grupo tiene 27 años, estudio hasta la preparatoria, es comerciante y tiene 1 hijo varon. Ella se dedica ala venta de pollo, chiles y especies como actividad principal desde hace 2 años, asi como a la venta de dulces como actividad adicional. Solicita el prestamo para invertir en mercancia para sus negocios, y de esta forma hacerlos crecer. Al solicitar el prestamo ella se siente entusiasmada ya que en base al prestamo piensa hacer mayor inversion en sus negocios y de esta forma comenzar a tener más ganancias que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia, debido a la gran demanda que tiene, piensa ampliar el local donde esta establecido su negocio, ya que el espacio empieza a ser cada vez mas pequeño por la variedad de productos que ofrece y que piensa ofrecer con el paso del tiempo.
texts.en:
This group is called 'CONSTRUYENDO SUEÑOS' (Building Dreams) because, for the group, receiving a loan is the first step in building dreams in their businesses.  This brings improvements and is reflected financially in the lives of each of the group's members.  The group is located in Hidalgo, in Mexico.  It has 10 members.

Yaneth P. Hernández is a member of this group.  She is 27 years old and studied up to elementary school level.  She is a saleswoman and has one child (a son).  Her business is selling chicken, chilis and spices.  This is her main business and has been for two years.  She also sells sweet treats as an additional activity.

Yaneth is requesting this loan to invest in merchandise for her businesses to make them grow.  As she requested the loan, Yaneth felt enthusiastic because, on the basis of the loan, she is planning to make a bigger investment in her businesses and, in this way, start to make more profits which will allow her to provide her family with a better quality of life.  Owing to the great demand that she has, she is planning to expand her business premises since the space is starting to become too small for the variety of products that she currently sells and which she is planning to sell over time.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise such as chicken, chilis and spices for her business

loans.name: Sartasiñani Kullacas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SARTASIÑANI KULLACANACAS” iniciará su ciclo veinte y siete en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Está compuesta por once  integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Janneth.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: fabricación de cotillones, cerrajería, venta de trabas, venta de lentes, venta de coca, ropa para niños.
 
La señora Janneth, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que es su segundo ciclo que trabaja con  Pro Mujer y que ingreso por la invitación.

En la actualidad la señora Janneth tiene un negocio de venta de coca, con el que trabaja hace siete años; nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá, porque ella le ayudaba hace años. El crédito que sacará ahora es para la compra de mercadería (coca), la que compra generalmente de Villa Fátima (en la ciudad de La Paz). Comenta que esta coca la vende todos los días de forma ambulante, porque ella no cuenta con un puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella esta casada y tiene tres hijos

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la salud.

Las persona que no aprarese en la fotografia la señora Elsa, quien posó pero estuvo un poco distraida.
texts.en:
The “SARTASIÑANI KULLACANACAS” community bank is about to start its 27th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II regional office.  The group has eleven members and its president is Janneth.  The businesses that the group members are engaged in are varied and include: making party supplies, providing locksmith services, selling hair clips, selling lenses, selling coca leaf and selling children's clothes.

Janneth is the president of the community bank.  She informs us that this is her second loan cycle with Pro Mujer and that she was invited to join.

Janneth has a business selling coca leaf.  She has been in this business for seven years.  She tells us that she learned the business from her mom because she used to help her years ago.  Janneth will use her loan to buy merchandise (coca) which she generally buys in Villa Fátima (in the city of La Paz).  She says that she sells coca every day as an itinerant street vendor because she doesn't have a fixed sales location.  This work allows her to make money to support her family.  She is married and has three children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health services.

The person who does not appear in the photo is Elsa. She posed but was a little distracted.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (coca leaf)

loans.name: La Divinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Divinas lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras ellas son Maribel del Socorro P., Yeni del Carmen Torres Cerrato y Daniel Iván B. Cerrato.
La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Maribel del Socorro P. de 31 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa interior desde hace 4 años. Este negocio lo inicio con su liquidación en la zona Franca. 
Ella tiene dos hijos de 15 y 13 años respectivamente por los cuales trabaja arduamente e invertirá el crédito en mercadería para surtir su venta.
Los otros integrantes Yeni de 33 años es propietaria de una pulpería y Daniel Iván B. vende ropa de todo tipo.
texts.en:
The 'Las Divinas' group is made up of three hard-working, determined and enterprising people: Maribel del Socorro P., Yeni del Carmen Torres Cerrato and Daniel Iván B. Cerrato.

The group's coordinator is Maribel del Socorro P..  She is 31 years old and has been selling underwear for 4 years.  She started her business with her severance pay from a job in the duty-free zone.  Maribel has two children, aged 15 and 13, for whom she works very hard.  She will invest her loan in buying merchandise to stock her business.

The other members of this group are 33 year-old Yeni who owns a small grocery store and Daniel Iván Bejerrano who sells all kinds of clothes.

loans.use: to buy underwear

loans.name: Merced

texts.en:
Merced T. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old. Merced is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Merced owns & operates a motorela or habal-habal services business. Her husband is the driver and provides services to local community members. Merced also buys and sells fruits like lanzones, durian & rambutan. Merced has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 13000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Merced joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Merced has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase tools needed to provide service. Merced is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools & utilities needed to provide service. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Merced from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools & utilities needed to provide service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy treatments, shampoo, perfume, creams, eyeshadows and other products

loans.name: Anita Group

texts.es:
El grupo Anita lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras, una de ellas es Anita Pavón de 60 años quien tiene una pulpería. El negocio lo inicio con la venta de chiverías hace 3 años.
Ella tiene tres hijos menores de 15, 12 y 8 años por los que trabaja arduamente y su meta es tener una miscelánea.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Yahaira Raquel Abellán Pavón de 25 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 5 años y Amparo Pavón Jarquín de 49 años propietaria de una pequeña pulpería desde hace 6 año.
texts.en:
The Anita group is made up of three hard-working, determined and enterprising women.  One of them is 60 year-old Anita Pavón who owns a grocery store.  She started her business selling yoghurt products three years ago.

Anita has three children, aged 15, 12 and 8, for whom she works hard.  Her goal is to own a general store.

The other members of this group are 25 year-old Yahaira Raquel Abellán Pavón who has been selling clothes for 5 years and 49 year-old Amparo Pavón Jarquín who has owned a small grocery store for 6 years.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, cheese, eggs, yoghurt, etc.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: El sr. Ángel es transportista, vive en la zona de pacata baja vive en domicilio propio tiene tres hijos que se encuentra en edad escolar, el solicito el crédito para comprar repuestos para su movilidad, ya que la movilidad necesita arreglos y esto le perjudica en trabajo ya que no puede brindar un buen servicio al pasajero,  el transporte es su principal fuente de ingreso para la subsistencia de su familia, se dedica al transporte desde hace veinte años, el es una persona muy trabajadora que se encuentra agradecido con la institución por el apoyo bridado.
texts.en:
Ángel is a taxi driver.  He lives in his own home, in Pacata Baja neighborhood, and has three school-age children.  He is requesting this loan to buy spare parts for his vehicle since it needs some repairs.  This is having a negative impact on his work because he can't provide a good service to his passengers.

Ángel's taxi service is the main source of income for his family.  He has been in the business for twenty years.  He is a very hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support they have given him.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Cherry Lymer

texts.en:
Cherry Lymer T. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Cherry Lymer is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cherry Lymer owns & operates a computer games & videoke services business to local community members. Cherry Lymer has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cherry Lymer joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cherry Lymer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. 

Cherry Lymer is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools & utilities needed to provide service. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Cherry Lymer from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools & utilities needed to provide service.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane F. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 29 years old. Mary Jane is widowed and has one child, who is still an infant. 

To make a living, Mary Jane owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for her business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap and beverages. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over  two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2011, Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods and snack foods. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products, like canned goods and snack foods, to sell.

loans.name: Antofagasta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANTOFAGASTA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Elena.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de frutas, abarrotes, venta de comida, venta de cosméticos, venta de libros y revistas, venta de ropa.

La señora Elena, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que participa hace diez años en Pro Mujer. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida y atención de baño público, el que ha trabajado hace siete años por iniciativa propia.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para la compra mercadería (para cocinar), el que venderá de lunes a sábado en Villa Dolores (ciudad de El Alto) de 12:00 a 14:00.
Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse, pues ella es soltera. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y salud.
texts.en:
The “ANTOFAGASTA” community bank is about to start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Juan Pablo II regional office.  The group has eight members and its president is Elena.  The businesses that the members of the group carry out are varied and include: selling fruit, groceries, meals, cosmetics, books and magazines, and clothes.

Elena, the bank's president, tells us that she has been with Pro Mujer for ten years.  She currently has a business selling meals and working in a public bathroom.  She has been doing this work for seven years and started on her own initiative.

Elena will use this loan to buy supplies (for cooking her meals).  She makes her sales from Monday to Saturday, from 12.00pm to 2.00pm, in Villa Dolores, in the city of El Alto.  This work allows her to make money with which to support herself.  She is single.

When we asked Elena what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the training and the health services.

loans.use: to buy supplies (for making meals)

loans.name: La Iglesia Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Iglesia lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Sadia de 28 años quien se dedica a la venta de frutas. Este negocio lo inicio hace 2 años junto con su hermana. 

Las otras integrantes Gilma de 52 años se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 5 años y Juana de 32 años vende helados, confites y fresco.
texts.en:
The La Iglesia [The Church] group is made up of three hardworking, dedicated and enterprising women. One of them is Mrs. Sadia. She is 28 years old and sells fruit. She started this business 2 years ago with her sister. 

The other members are Gilma, who is 52 years old ans has sold food for 5 years, and Juana, who is 32 years old and sells ice cream, confit and fresh food.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit in season such as mangos, jocotes, watermelons, tangerines, oranges, granadilla, etc.

loans.name: Marenco Group

texts.es:
El grupo Marenco lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Marbell del Socorro Téllez Dávila de 25 años quien se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace 3 años inicio con la venta de chinelas luego invirtió en zapatos.
Ella con el crédito comprar mercadería en calzado en especial de temporada.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Patricia Lucia A. E. de 26 años tiene un taller de costura desde hace 4 años y Josefa Leonarda E. de 55 años tiene un taller de costura.
texts.en:
The Marenco group is made up of three hard-working, determined and enterprising people.  One of the group's members is 25 year-old Marbell del Socorro Téllez Dávila who has been selling shoes for three years.  She started out selling thongs (flip flops) and then invested in shoes.  She will use her loan to buy footwear, especially seasonal footwear.

The other members of this group are 26 year-old Patricia Lucia A. E. who has had a sewing workshop for four years and 55 year-old Josefa Leonarda E. who also has a sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy footwear

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La señora Teresa es una persona joven y muy trabajadora, Vive en la zona de Pampahasi bajo que esta ubicada a veinticinco minutos del centro de la ciudad. La Sra. Teresa es costurera en una pequeña empresa de su cuñada donde realizan vestidos de niña y sacos de tela polar. Ella trabaja en este lugar desde las 8:30 de la mañana hasta las 16:30 por la tarde. Luego de terminar su trabajo de costura ella sale a realizar sus cobros diarios ya que aparte de la costura se dedica también a la venta de joyas a crédito. Tiene varias clientes en la zona de Pampahasi, quienes le piden distintos tipos de joyas como ser aretes, topos (que son prendedores para cholitas) y adornos para sombreros. Uno de los mayores anhelos de teresa es poder comprar una casa propia ya que ella y toda su familia tuvieron que desocupar su anterior casa debido a hubo deslizamientos de tierra en esa zona y se quedaron sin casa, ahora ya se están reponiendo de  ese hecho doloroso y están saliendo adelante, ella esta muy agradecida con la institución por el poyo brindado.
texts.en: Teresa is a young and hardworking person. She lives in the area of Pampahasi Bajo, which is located twenty-five minutes from the center of town. Teresa is a seamstress at her sister in law's small business where they make girls' dresses and fleece jackets. She works in this place from 8:30 in the morning until 4:30 in the afternoon. After finishing her job as a seamstress she goes out to make her daily collections, since in addition to sewing, she also sells jewelry on credit. She has several customers in the Pampahasi area who order different types of jewelry from her, such as earrings, topos (broochs worn by Indigenous women) and hat ornaments. One of Teresa's greatest wishes is to be able to buy her own house since she and her whole family had to leave their previous house due to the landslides in the area and their house was lost. Now they are facing this painful fact and are getting ahead. She is very grateful to the institution for the support it has offered.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Maria Irma De La Paz

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 46 años D. edad, resiD. en Corinto departamento D. Morazán, se dedica a la crianza D. cerdos, vive con su esposo don Mártir Hernández; Ella inicio el oficio desD. que tenía los 20 años D. edad, como herencia D. sus padres, todos los días atienD. los quehaceres que demanda la granja.
Ella solicita un préstamo para compra D. cerdos y alimentación para los mismos, ya que su mayor deseo es tener una granja amplia, con muchos cerdos que cuidar.
Este préstamo le ayudara a realizar lo deseado y a tener más oportunidad D. comercializar en el mercado.  Su objetivo es continuar en su trabajo, fortalecer la granja y prosperar económicamente junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Maria is 46 years old and lives with her husband, Martir, in the Corinto department of Morazán.  She raises hogs and started doing so when she was 20 years old, having learned from her parents.  She tends to her farm chores daily.

She is asking for this loan so she can buy hogs and feed.  She wants to expand her farm.  This loan will help her reach her goal and will allow her the opportunity to sell more in the market.  She wants to keep working, improve the farm, and prosper financially with her husband.

loans.use: to buy hogs and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, lipsticks, powders, etc.

loans.name: Estacion De Amor Group

texts.es: En esta fotografia se muestra al grupo llamado “ESTACION DE AMOR” el cual esta ubicado en el estado de Puebla, México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes. La señora Maria Teresa P. es una de las integrantes del grupo y se dedica  a la elaboración de bordados como sueters, bufandas, bolsas entre otras,  esta activiadad la realiza desde hace 4 años, las clientas comentan que el trato es muy bueno y los pagos son razonables. Ella es conocida por mucha gente que le compra. Este credito lo destinara para el pago de los pedidos que le solicitan para realizar sus entregos y las ganancias que obtenga las inverte en hilos y estambres para sus bordados, ella quiere posteriormente agrandar su negocio y comprar una maquina de bordar. En un futuro la señora Teresa tiene el firme proposito de construir un establo para sus animales pues tiene vacas las cuales estan en su patio amarradas. Ella tiene 42 años y estudio hasta el sexto grado de primaria, es divorciada, tiene 3 hijos,  1 hombre y 2 mujeres.
texts.en: In this photograph the group called “ESTACION DE AMOR” [Love Station] can be seen. It is located in the state of Puebla, México. The group is made up of 9 members. Mrs. Maria Teresa P. is one of the members of the group and she does embroidery on things such as sweaters, scarves, and bags, among others. She has done this activity for 4 years. The customers remark that the service is very good and the payments are reasonable. She is known to many people who buy from her. This loan will be used to pay for the orders she has so that she can make her deliveries. She will use her earnings to invest in thread and worsted yarn for her embroidery. In the future, she wants to enlarge her business and buy a sewing machine. Teresa also has a frim plan to build a stable for her animals. She has cows, which are tied up in her patio. She is 42 years old and finished sixth grade. She is divorced and has 3 children, 1 boy and 2 girls.

loans.use: to invest in thread and worsted yanr for embroidery

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase seafood for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items of clothing like pants, blouses, and children's clothing

loans.name: Rosa Yanira

texts.es:
Rosa, resiD. en la ciudad D. San Miguel, se dedica a la venta D. frutas, verduras y ropa, tiene 32 años D. edad, actualmente vive con su hijo.
El negocio D. la fruta y verdura lo venD. en un vehículo, D. lunes a viernes, los fines D. semana los dedica a vender ropa, por las tardes venD. papas fritas, ella es muy trabajadora, su dificultad es no tener lo suficiente para invertir en el negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería, ayudando así a aumentar el negocio, que sus ventas sean mejores y que continúe trabajando por su familia.
Su aspiración es poseer varias rutas D. atención, con otros vehículos llenos D. mercadería.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in the city of San Miguel.  Her business is selling fruit, vegetables and clothes.  She is 32 years old and currently lives with her son.

Rosa makes her fruit and vegetable sales from a vehicle, from Monday to Friday.  On weekends, she sells clothes.  In the afternoons, she sells French fries.  Rosa is very hard working.  Her difficulty is that she doesn't have enough money to invest in her business.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan with which she can buy merchandise.  This will help her to increase her business, will improve her sales and will allow her to keep working for her family.

Rosa's aspiration is to work several routes with other vehicles full of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Rosas De Alto Lima Group

texts.es:
L. A.C. “ROSAS D. ALTO LIMA” iniciará su vigésimo sexto  ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal D. Alto Lima.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y tiene como presidenta a L. señora Elena.   Los negocios que las integrantes D. L. asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta D. ropa D. bebe, costura D. chamarras, venta D. articulo D. peluquería, venta D. comida, venta D. mochilas, venta D. calzados.

L. señora Elena, presidenta D. L. asociación comunal, indica que es su cuarto ciclo con  Pro Mujer y que ingreso por que le trajeron sus amigas

En L. actualidad L. señora Elena tiene un negocio D. venta D. calzados que trabaja hace 23 años, nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió D. su esposo, porque él fabrica zapatos para cholitas. El crédito que sacará ahora es para aumentar su capital (compra D. mas calzados). Su mercadería L. compra en su puesto mismo, ya que muchos le viene a ofrecer, y alguna vez L. compra en L. calle Huyustus (zona comercial D. L. paz); luego los venD. en L. avenida Panorámica, en su puesto fijo, todos los días. Esta forma D. trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues elL. vive en concubinato y tiene seis hijos

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta D. Pro Mujer, elL. responD. que le gusta el ahorro obligatorio.

En L. foto aprarese solamente el perfil D. las señoras Frecia y Gladys, ya que ellas estaban al bordes del cuadro
texts.en:
The “ROSAS D. ALTO LIMA” community bank is about to start its 26th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Alto Lima regional office.  This group has eight members and its president is Elena.  The businesses that the members carry out are varied and incluD.: selling baby clothes, sewing jackets, selling hairdressing products, selling meals, selling backpacks and selling footwear.

Elena, the bank's president, tells us that this is her fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer and she joined because some friends brought her along.

Elena has a business selling footwear which she has owned for 23 years.  She tells us that she learned the business from her husband because he makes shoes for 'cholitas' (ladies who dress in traditional clothing).  Elena will use this loan to increase her capital (buying more shoes).  She actually buys her merchandise from her sales location because many people come to sell their products to her.  Sometimes she also buys her products in Huyustus Street (a commercial area of L. Paz).  She then sells them in Panorámica Avenue, from her fixed sales location.  She makes her sales every day.  This work allows her to make money to support her family.  She lives with her partner and has six children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the mandatory savings.

In the photo you can only make out the profile of Frecia and Gladys since they were on the edge of the picture.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags, sandals and shoes

loans.name: Señor De La Caña - Chupuro Group

texts.es:
Raymunda participa como socia de la alcancia comunal: Señor de la Caña - Chupuro.
Raymunda vive con su esposo y 2 hijos menores de edad. Ella se dedica desde hace 13 años al bordado manual de trajes tìpicos de la zona.
En el futuro Raymunda desea tener un taller de costura.
El prèstamo requerido lo invertirà en la compra de una màquina de coser para poder ayudarse con los bordados.
(En la fotografìa Raymunda esta vestida con chompa color verde y un manto color marròn; es la tercera de la derecha y esta acompañada de uno de sus menores hijos)
(*) Hayde Conde socia retirada, participò en la fotografìa y en la reuniòn de desembolso para la juramentaciòn de cargo; ya que fue presidenta en el ciclo anterior.(Hayde esta vestida de color color verde claro y lleva puesto un sombrero negro, es la cuarta de la derecha)
texts.en:
Raymunda participates as a member in the community bank called Señor de la Caña [Lord of the Reeds] - Chupuro. Raymunda lives with her husband and 2 minor children. She has done hand embroidery of traditional dress in the area for 13 years.  

In the future, Raymunda wants to have a sewing workshop. The loan she needs will be invested in a sewing machine to help her with the embroidery.  (In the photograph Raymunda is wearing a green sweater and a purple shawl. She is the third from the right and is accompanied by one of her young children). 

(*) Hayde Conde, a retired member, participated in the photograph and in the disbursement meeting for the oath of office, since she was the president in the previous cycle (Hayde is dressed in green and has on a black hat. She is the fourth from the right).

loans.use: to buy sewing machines

loans.name: Lucha

texts.es: Lucha tiene 32 años, vive en una casa alquilada al lado de sus 2 hijos. Ella vende dulces y lo realiza de manera ambulante, ya sea en los parques o en los centros de esparcimiento sobre todo en eventos deportivos que se dan en su zona. Su trabajo lo hace de manera ínter diaria, pero en ocasiones la ayudan sus hijos pequeños. Para ella uno de los mejores días es cuando tiene vende casi toda la mercadería que posee y eso asegura sus ganancias, para ella es muy importante para que pueda darle manutención a sus hijos. Su mayor anhelo de tener un negocio más establecido, por ello trata en lo posible ahorrar su capital. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta entusiasmada de trabajar de manera grupal en su banco comunal que aunque es un grupo reducido  tiene la seguridad de que es de confianza y por su parte se compromete a ser puntual. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería en dulces al por mayor ya que en la actualidad compra por docenas.
texts.en:
Lucha is 32 years old and lives in a rental house together with her two children.  She sells candies as an itinerant sales vendor.  Lucha makes her sales either in parks or in recreation areas and above all at sporting events that take place in her area.  She carries out her work every other day but sometimes her young children help her.  One of Lucha's best days would be when she manages to sell nearly all her merchandise.  This ensures her profits which is very important as it enables her to provide for her children.

Lucha's greatest wish is to have a more established business.  For this reason, she makes every possible attempt to save money.  This is her first loan from MFP.  She is excited to be working as part of a group, in her community bank.  Although hers is a small group, she has the security of knowing that it is a trustworthy one and, for her part, she pledges to be punctual in making her repayments.  Lucha will invest the loan she has requested in buying candies wholesale since she currently buys her merchandise by the dozen.

loans.use: to buy candies wholesale

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is 49 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and has 9 children between the ages of 11 and 36. Only four of her children live at home with her, the older ones are independent and the younger ones are still attending school. 

For 11 years Helena has been selling oil and coal. She sells to some of her customers on credit and sometimes it's difficult for her to collect payments. She started the business with money from her husband. She was not able to attend school but thanks to her business her children have gone to school and some are still attending; in addition it has also help build her family's home. 

Helena has requested a loan to purchase more coal and oil. In the future Helena hopes to be doing business internationally and wants to send her children to university.

loans.use: to buy oil and coal

loans.name: Leyla Vanessa

texts.es: La señora Leyla Vanessa, tiene 32 años ella es casada  y tiene tres hijos de 14, 12 y 10 años respectivamente. La señora tiene su negocio que es brindar el servicio de belleza el cual está localizado en su casa de habitación,  empezó con este negocio desde hace trece años, ahora posee buena clientela establecida. La necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra para su familia, fue lo que más motivo a Leyla a establecer este negocio pues desde la edad de 15 años ella sabía muy bien cortar cabello, fue con el paso del tiempo que logro profesionalizarse. El objetivo del crédito es invertirlo en la compra de tijeras, peines, cepillos, aceites, tratamientos, shampoo, cremas, pintura de uñas, pintura de labios y talcos. Su sueño es suplir las necesidades de su hogar y aumentar su inventario.
texts.en:
Leyla Vanessa, 32, is married and has three children who are 14, 12 and 10 years of age respectively.  She has a beauty salon installed in her home.  She started the business three years ago and now has a well-established base of regular customers.  The need to have an extra source of income for her family was what motivated her to establish the business because she’s known how to cut hair very well since the age of 15 and as time went by she managed to become professional.

The loan will be used to buy scissors, combs, brushes, oils, hair treatments, shampoo, creams, nail polish, lipsticks and talc.  Her dream is to meet her household needs and to increase inventory.

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment for her beauty salon.

loans.name: La Fe Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Fe lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Meyling Alelis G. de 20 años quien se dedica al comercio de cosméticos desde hace tres años. El negocio lo inicio con los productos Avon, luego invirtió en otras marcas y su negocio fue creciendo poco a poco. 
Las otras integrantes son Francisca Flores C. de 31 años quien vende productos Avon y Martha Argentina Vásquez quien comercializa ropa desde hace 2 años.
texts.en: The Faith Group is composed of three hard-working and enterprising women. One of the members is Meyling Alelis G., 20, who has been selling cosmetics for the past three years. She started the business with Avon products, then invested in other brands as her business grew bit by bit. The other members of the group are Francisca Flores Calera, 31, who sells Avon products, and Martha Argentina Vásquez who has been selling clothing for two years.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza forma parte del banco comunal “Barrio Alto”, perteneciente a la ciudad de San Fernando. Ella se dedica a la venta de periódicos, revistas, cuentos, libros, CDs, DVD, confites y bebidas. Desde hace 5 años. En un local que está ubicado al interior de un supermercado, por lo tanto sus horarios se rigen por la disponibilidad horaria de éste, principalmente durante toda la semana de 9ºº  de la mañana hasta las 21ºº horas. En ésta temporada de comienzo de año, sus ventas han sido bajas, sin embargo igual ha obtenido ganancias, que le han permitido organizar sus gastos. Maritza compra su mercadería  usualmente en una distribuidora de confites.
Con el préstamo comprará mercadería para su local y un vidrio para arreglar la vitrina de su negocio que se encontraba en mal estado. 
Maritza vive junto a su esposo, su hija de 4 años y su suegra. Su esposo es quien le brinda ayuda en la atención y venta de productos de su local.
