Sus metas son poder abrir otra sucursal, que le brinde más ganancias. Para poder brindarle a su familia un mejor bienestar. Sus sueños a nivel personal es optar al subsidio habitacional, para obtener su casa propia. 
Maritza está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo esperanza, ya que le brindan apoyo y ayuda a personas emprendedoras como ella. Respecto a las reuniones del grupo de socios (as), Maritza se siente a gusto, ya que existe unión y una buena convivencia entre ellos. Los talleres de contabilidad le han sido de gran ayuda para organizar los ingresos y gastos de su negocio. 
San Fernando es una ciudad ubicada en la región del Libertador General Bernardo O’higgins , zona centro de Chile. La actividad económica de la ciudad se basa principalmente en la agricultura (viñedos, cultivo de remolacha, frutales, tabaco, trigo y cultivo tradicional), la agroindustria (empresas exportadoras de frutas, conserveras, de lácteos, etc.) y el comercio.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the "Barrio Alto" community bank which is located in the city of San Francisco.  Her business is selling newspapers, magazines, books, CDs, DVDs, candy and soft drinks.  She has been in this business for five years.  Maritza has premises which are located inside a supermarket so her working hours are dictated by those of the supermarket.  She mainly works throughout the week, from 9.00am to 9.00pm.  During this season, at the beginning of the year, her sales have been low.  However, she has still made profits which have enabled her to organize her expenses.  She usually buys her merchandise at a candy wholesalers.

Maritza will use this loan to buy merchandise for her business and a pane of glass to fix her store window as it is in a bad state of repair.  Maritza lives with her husband, her 4 year-old daughter and her mother-in-law.  Her husband helps her to serve and sell products in her business.  Maritza's goal is to open another branch which would make her more profits and enable her family to live more comfortably.  Her dream on a personal level is to apply for a housing subsidy so that she can obtain her own home.

Maritza is very happy and grateful for the loan she has been granted by Fondo Esperanza as they provide support and help to enterprising people such as herself.  As regards the group meetings of her community bank, Maritza feels very much at ease because there is unity and the members all get on well together.  The accounting workshops have been very useful to her in organizing her business incomings and outgoings.

San Fernando is a city which is located in Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins region, in the central area of Chile.  The city's economic activity is based mainly on agriculture (vineyards; beet, fruit, tobacco and wheat growing; and traditional agriculture), agroindustry (fruit exporting companies, canning companies, dairy companies, etc.) and trade.

loans.use: to buy newspapers, magazines, books, CDs, DVDs, candies, soft drinks and a pane of glass to fix her store window

loans.name: Garmai

texts.en:
Garmai is 48 years old and lives in the town of Paynesville. She is married, her husband is a farmer and they have children between the ages of 18 and 25. Only her youngest is still living with her and going to school while the other ones are working. 

She has been selling pepper, bitter ball (a vegetable) and oil. To keep her customers sometimes she has to sell on credit. She started 30 years ago with money from her mother who showed her how to sell.  About her business she mentioned: it makes me proud because I built a house, send my children to school and some went to university. 

Garmai has requested a loan to purchase more peppers, bitter balls and oil.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers, bitter balls and oil

loans.name: Chicas Mañaneras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHICAS MAÑANERAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Exalta.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de carne de res, venta de carne de cerdo, venta de pescado y venta de comida.

La señora Exalta, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que es la primera vez que participa en Pro Mujer. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne de cerdo, el que ha trabajado hace diez años, nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su hermana que estaba en este rubro. El crédito que sacará ahora es para la compra de un toro y ganado, el cual hará reproducir; luego que ya estén crecidos los venderá en la feria de Viacha (municipio del departamento de La Paz)

Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse, pues ella es soltera. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta todo.
texts.en:
The “CHICAS MAÑANERAS” community association is in its first cycle with Pro Mujer (Professional Woman), as part of the Andes Central Office.  It’s made up of eight members and Exalta is the group’s president.  The member are involved in a variety of businesses, such as beef sales, fish sales, and prepared food sales.

Exalta tells us that this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer.  She sells pork and has been doing so for 10 years, having learned this business from her sister.  She will use the money from this loan to buy bulls and livestock to breed and sell at the Viancha fair in La Paz.

This work allows her to earn a living.  She is single.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujes, she replied, “Everything.”

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Aurelia Esperanza

texts.es: Aurelia Esperanza se dedica a la venta de calzado y ropa. Tiene más 7 años con este negocio. Su mercadería la compra en Managua en donde le resulta mucho más favorable ya que los productos están a precios más accesibles. Las motivaciones de Aurelia son de seguir en el negocio, está muy agradecida ya que podrá invertir y aumentar su productividad. El financiamiento es destinado para la compra de sandalias, zapatillas, zapatos deportivos, camisetas, pantalones, faldas y trajes. Los sueños de Aurelia son de seguir adelante cada día más con su actividad y brindarle a su familia el sustento diario.
texts.en: Aurelia Esperanza sells clothing and shoes and has been doing so for seven years.  She buys her merchandise in Managua, where she can get it at better prices.  Her motivations are to continue with her business and she is very grateful to be able to invest into her business and improve her productivity.  She will use the money from this loan to buy sandals, slippers, shoes, sneakers, polo shirts, pants, skirts, and suits.  She wants to continue moving forward each day and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her clothing business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 34 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and has three children between the ages of 9 months and 18 years. All three of them live at home with her and are presently in school. 

For the past 9 years Martha has been selling vegetables, oil, rice, soap, pepper, salt, chicken stock, onions and drinks. She says she buys on credit from other businesses and sells so that she can maintain her business. Martha started this business from her susu money, a group of people saving together. She is proud of this business because has built a house from the business and is sending her children to school, and sometimes has helped other family members. 

Martha requested this loan to purchase rice, soap, oil, salt, drinks and other products for her shop. In the future Martha wants to do business internationally.

loans.use: to purchase rice, soap, oil, salt, drinks and other products

loans.name: Jardin Group

texts.es:
Betzy Paola J. O., es casada tiene 22 años D. edad, cursos el segundo año D. educación basica,  tiene 1 hijo que esta estudiando, se dedica a la venta D. artículos D. consumo diario, tiene 5 años D. experiencia con este negocio, a principio solo vendía objetos D. recuerdo y actualmente venD. diferentes clases D. artículos, en el futuro quiere tener varios puntos D. venta. 

DeciD. entonces, organizar un grupo, para solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para comprar artículos varios para tienda y asi incrementar su capital y su negocio, las integrantes D. este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades como: Venta D. ropa, venta D. pollo frito, y la venta D. tortillas. Esperan con el prestamo cumplir su objetivo D. mejorar su negocio y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Betzy Paola J. O. is 22 years old, is married, and has a son in school.   She sells consumable items and has been doing so for 5 years.  She began by selling souvenirs and now she sells different types of articles.  In the future she would like to have a number of outlets.

She organized a group so that she could request a loan, which she will use to buy various items for her store and increase her capital and business.  The members of this group are involved in different businesses, such as clothing sales, fried chicken sales, and tortilla sales.  They hope to improve their businesses and incomes through the help of this loan.

loans.use: to increase her store's inventory

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 27 years old and lives in Paynesville. Victoria is a high school graduate who lives by herself and is single. For the past 3 years Victoria has been selling charcoal. Her main challenge of the business is that sometimes she sells on credit and can face problems with the creditor when it comes to repayment. 

Victoria started this business after she received money from her father. She is proud of this business because it helps her to go to school and also take care of herself. Victoria requested this loan to purchase more charcoal. In the future Victoria hopes to send herself to university and extend her business to the international level.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Chantale

texts.fr:
Cliente de 43 ans, très entreprenante ,ayant deja bénéficié de deux cycle de prêts  , elle a rembourse avec succès  ses deux premières cycles de prêts , elle a eu a faire des épargnes considérables et aujourd'hui  elle vient de bénéficier de son troisième cycle prêt.
Avec ce nouveau prêt , elle compte acheter 40 cartons de poissons sales, tel que 10 cartons de morues, 10 cartons  de capitaines et 20 cartons de soles,l'une de ses stratégies c'est  faire la vente en gros, demi gros et détail du poisson sale.
Elle tient a atteindre son objectif,continuer a épargner et pour le futur être une  importatrice de poissons sales .
Fier d'elle , elle promet de travailler encore plus dur pour atteindre son but.
texts.en:
This client, 43 years old, has an entrepreneurial spirit. She has already had 2 loans, both of which were properly repaid. She has been able to save a considerable amount and now is requesting a 3rd loan. With this loan, she plans to buy 40 boxes of salted fish: 10 boxes of of cod,  10 boxes of threadfin and 20 boxes of sole. One of her strategies is to sell the salted fish at wholesale, partial wholesale and retail.

She is determined to reach her goal of continuing to save for the future and and to become an importer of salted fish. With great pride, she promises to continue to work even harder in order to reach her goal.

loans.use: to buy 40 boxes of different types of salted fish, such as cod, sole and threadfin

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 32 años vive en compañía de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez aprendió todo lo necesario para desarrollar la agricultura, los años transcurrieron y con los terrenos que heredó de sus padres puede sembrar papa, maíz, olluco, habas, trigo entre otros.  Estos productos tienen mucha demanda en el mercado, por eso cuando lo cosecha lo lleva directo al mercado mas cercano de su comunidad, de esa manera pueda ofrecer una estabilidad económica a su familia. En ocasiones la inestabilidad de los precios suelen perjudicarle en las ventas, sin embargo ha ido superando esta dificultad buscando otras opciones para vender. Tiene planes a futuro, como el de desempeñar otra actividad comercial  para crecer más su economía. Es su primera vez que solicita un crédito con MFP,  esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un respaldo económico y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, le servirá para mejorar su actividad agrícola con la compra de más sacos de abono.
texts.en: Luz is 32 years old and lives in her own home with her three children.  Since she was a little girl, she learned everything she needed to know about agriculture.  In time she began planting potatoes, corn, beans, ulluco, wheat, and other things on the land she inherited from her parents.  These products are in great demand in the marketplace, so she harvests them and takes them directly to the market near her home.  In this way she can provide financial stability to her family.  Sometimes the varying prices hurt her sales, but she has managed to overcome these difficulties by finding other ways to sell.  She plans to start another venture in the future in order to grow more financially.  This will be her first loan through MFP and she is very happy to have financial backing.  She is committed to making her payments on time.  She will use the money from this loan to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Las Solidarias I Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama SOLIDARIAS porque es un grupo de mujeres que siempre se han apoyado entre si, ayudandose en situaciones adversas y riendose juntas en momentos felices. El grupo se encuentra ubicado en el estado de Hidalgo en México. El grupo está conformado por nueve integrantes, cada una siendo mujeres de trabajo arduo. La señora Zoila R. H. es la tesorera y lider del grupo, ella es casada y tiene  tres hijos de 18, 9 y 5  años, estudio hasta la secundaria y, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de comal, ella comenzo con un pequeño comal en el patio de su casa y ahora ya cuenta con un pequeñito local y una empleada. La señora Zoilita como la llaman de cariño, necesita el crédito para la compra de maiz, comenta que para ella lo más importante es su familia y sacar a sus hijos adelante, apoyando a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, le gustaria tener una grande tortilleria con varios empleados.
texts.en:
This group is called SOLIDARIAS because it’s a group of women who constantly support one another, helping one another during adverse situations and laughing together during happy moments.  This group is in the state of Mexico and is made up of nine hard working women.  Mrs. Zoila R. H. is the treasurer and group leader.  She is married and has three children, ages 18, 9, and 5.  She has a junior high school education.

Zoila makes and sells tortillas and started with a small hotplate on her patio.  Now she has a small point of sale and one employee.  Zoilita, as she is affectionately referred to, needs this loan to buy dried corn.  She tells us that there is nothing more important to her than helping her children to get ahead and helping her husband with the household expenses.  One day she would like to have a large tortilla factory with many employees.

loans.use: to buy dried corn.

loans.name: Luzminia Maria

texts.es: La señora Luzminia es de un municipio de achuapa, su negocio es una abarrotería. Tiene más de 5 años con esta actividad, inicio con una mini pulpería pues ella no tenía mucho capital para invertir en su negocio y fue con la compra de ciertos productos que logro obtener lo que actualmente tiene hasta los momentos. Luzminia solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de maíz, frijoles, arroz, aceite, sopas, golosinas, papel higiénico, jabón detergente. Ella deicidio poner esta actividad para así lograr solventar su ingresos que se generan en su hogar a un que su familia es pequeña quiere darle lo más necesario y así animar a sus hijos a seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Luzminia is from the town of Achuapa and runs a small convenience store.  She’s been doing this for five years, having started with a small store out of her home because she didn’t have very much working capital to invest.  By buying certain items, it allowed her to grow her business into what she has today.

Luzminia is asking for this loan in order to buy corn, beans, rice, cooking oil, soups, snacks, bathroom tissue, and detergent soap.  She decided to start this business so that she could solidify her income, be able to provide for her family, and motivate her children to stay in school.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Apec Al Ouma Dieupeul 4 Groupe 5

texts.fr:
Le groupe 5 est un autre démembrement de la cellule Apec Al Ouma Dieupeul 4. C’est un groupe mixte de 06 personnes qui constituent une même Famille. Ils habitent ensemble aussi. Ils sont représentés par monsieur Mamadou D. B.  qui capitalise une expérience de 10 ans dans le secteur du commerce d’arachide, de poissons secs et d’huile de palme. Le groupe est sociétaire du guichet de Liberté 6 depuis février 2011. Ils sollicitent un crédit de 1 000 000 frs dans le but de s’approvisionner à Vélingara en poissons secs, arachide et huile de palme. Leur intention est de pouvoir mieux diversifier les produits qu’ils souhaitent vendre. Avec l’augmentation de leur capital de commerce ils ont pour objectif de renforcer leur activité et satisfaire leurs clients.
Al Ouma is a Senegalese nonprofit whose full name is The Association for Koranic Education and Teaching. 
 
Originally founded to work with at-risk children, especially talibés (young boys from poor families who beg in Senegalese metropolitan areas), Al Ouma has evolved its mission to work with adults as well as children. They currently have over 10,000 members, and are actively engaged in supporting the economic development of their members in the hopes of improving their quality of life, and that of their at-risk children.
 
Al Ouma's members are currently organized into smaller associations which meet each week to contribute to a group fund that helps finance small loans for members.  Members typically put in $2 USD per week. Because UIMCEC and Al Ouma both share the mission of fighting poverty through economic empowerment, they have formed a partnership to provide loans to Al Ouma associations at a lower interest rate than UIMCEC usually offers its clients
texts.en:
Group 5 is another division of the Apec Al Ouma Dieupeul 4 unit. It's a mixed group of 6 persons from the same family. They also live together. They are represented by Mr. Mamadou  Djita B. who capitalizes on 10 years' experience in the sale of groundnuts, dried fish and palm oil. The group has been a member of the Liberté 6 branch since February, 2011. They are requesting a loan of 1,000,000  francs in order to stock up in Vélingara with dried fish, groundnuts and palm oil. Their intention is to able to better diversify the products they want to sell. Their goal is to expand their business and satisfy their customers with the increase in their business capital.

Al Ouma is a Senegalese nonprofit whose full name is The Association for Koranic Education and Teaching. 
 
Originally founded to work with at-risk children, especially talibés (young boys from poor families who beg in Senegalese metropolitan areas), Al Ouma has evolved its mission to work with adults as well as children. They currently have over 10,000 members, and are actively engaged in supporting the economic development of their members in the hopes of improving their quality of life, and that of their at-risk children.
 
Al Ouma's members are currently organized into smaller associations which meet each week to contribute to a group fund that helps finance small loans for members.  Members typically put in $2 USD per week. Because UIMCEC and Al Ouma both share the mission of fighting poverty through economic empowerment, they have formed a partnership to provide loans to Al Ouma associations at a lower interest rate than UIMCEC usually offers its clients

loans.use: To buy dried fish, groundnuts and palm oil.

loans.name: Fantasia De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama  FANTASIA D. SAN PEDRO, las integrantes eligieron el nombe porque añoran el éxito cotidiano en su negocios, buscando  una oportunidad  D. tener más ventas y crecer. Están ubicadas en el Estado D. México. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un crédito. Esperanza A. R. es integrante del grupo tiene 34 años, tiene esdudios D. tecnico iundustrial, es ama D. casa  y no tiene hijos. Ella se dedica a la producción y venta D. totillas hechas a mano que inició hace 2 años. Solicita el prestamo para adquirir más materia prima como maiz. Sus clientes son personas D. la misma localidad, prefieren comprar los productos con ella , por la calidad y buen servicio que ofrece así como la atención muy amable D. la señora, eso ayuda  a incrementar su mercado y siga creciendo en clientes y ganancias. Al monento  D. solicitar este  préstamo se siente con mucha alegria D. tener la oportunidad D. invertir  nuevamente y poder distribuir más producto en movimiento. Su negocio es tan importante  ya que con ello pueD. salir adelante con los gastos D. su familia y asi tener una mejor calidad D. vida tanto D. ella como la D. su familia.
texts.en: This group is called “FANTASIA D. SAN PEDRO.”  Its members selected that name because they yearn for success in their businesses.  The group is located in the state of Mexico and is maD. up of 10 members and this will be their first loan.  Esperanza A. R. is 34 years old and a member of the group.  She is a housekeeper and doesn’t have any children.  She makes and sells tortillas by hand and has been doing so for two years.  She is asking for this loan to buy ingredients like dried corn.  Her customers are local people who buy from her because of the quality of service she provides.  She is very friendly and this helps her to increase her market share, customer base, and earnings.  She is very happy for this opportunity to once again invest in her business and be able to distribute more of her product.  Her business is so important because it allows her to get ahead with her family expenses and be able to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her tortila business.

loans.name: Juliana Antonia

texts.es: Juliana Antonia se dedica a la venta de refrescos y gaseosas. Tiene más de 4 años con su actividad. Es una persona muy trabajadora y disfruta mucho de su hablar con sus clientes, pues sabe que tiene un ingreso que le genera el pan de cada día. Inicio con esfuerzo propio, ya que ella solo tenía el apoyo de 3 de sus hijos mayores, que le ayudaron a establecer este negocio. Todos los días e levanta temprano para empezar con la preparación de sus refrescos como limonada, naranja, melón, mandarina, cacao entre otros productos. El financiamiento es para la compra de frutas para la elaboración de sus refrescos y la compra de gaseosas.  Ella sueña con proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda y brindar a su familia una mejor estabilidad.
texts.en: Juliana Antonia sells carbonated and non-carbonated soft drinks and has been doing this for four years.  She is a hard working woman who enjoys talking to her customers and knows that her business helps her earn her daily bread.  She began on her own because she only had the support of her three young children who helped her start her business.  She rises early each day to prepare her drinks of different flavors, like lemon, orange, cantaloupe, mandarin orange, chocolate, and others.  She will use the money for this loan to buy fruit and carbonated drinks.  She wants to make improvements to her home and provide better stability to her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits to make drinks

loans.name: Mile

texts.es: Mile tiene 25  años, vive con sus padres en su casa propia. Hace más de 10 años se dedica a la agricultura de manera independiente ya que desde su niñez le han enseñado a ejecutar esta actividad. Hoy se ha convertido en su fuente principal de ingresos, es así que cultiva papa, maíz, que son productos que mayor demanda tiene en el mercado, ahí es donde le compran por lote cultivado, lo cual le favorece en las ganancias. Disfruta mucho de esta actividad, le agrada trabajar en las tareas del campo aunque muchas veces suele ser muy sacrificada, tiene muchos ánimos de continuar en esta actividad ya que le permite tener cubrir las necesidades de su familia. En adelante desea mejorar sus cultivos como  en su  productividad. Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, a esta muy contenta de  ser parte de su banco comunal de lo que  se siente segura de que va a funcionar bien porque  conoce bien a cada uno de sus integrantes. Con el crédito que solicita,  lo utilizará en la compra de sacos de abono, para fertilizar la tierra para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Mile is 25 years old and lives with her parents in her own home.  She has been a farmer for ten years and learned this trade when she was a little girl.  This is her source of income and she raises potatoes and corn which are in high demand in the market, which is where she sells her harvest at good prices.  She enjoys this activity and likes to work in the fields, even though she must often make many sacrifices.  She is motivated to continue this activity because it allows her to cover the necessary family expenses.  She hopes to improve her productivity in the future.  This will be her first loan through MFP and she is glad to be part of her communal bank, which she believes will function well because she knows all of the members.  She will use the money from this loan to buy sacks of fertilizer for next planting.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Cristoalina Bernard

texts.es:
Doña Cristobalina T. S. es una señora con 72 años de edad, viuda, humilde y muy trabajadora. Vive con una nieta la cual ve como una hija. Hace cinco años falleció su esposo. Desde ese momento vio la necesidad de trabajar como microempresaria en su casa, para poder generar ingresos y mantenerse. Inició una pulpería y hasta el momento le ha ido muy bien. También tiene otras actividades que desarrolla como es la cria de pollos y cerdos, hace pan y empanadas caseras para la venta en su misma pulpería, además de sembrar ñame junto con un yerno. Su nieta le ayuda en los oficios domésticos y en su negocio.
Éste es el segundo préstamo que solicita y lo va invertir en comprar abarrotes y otros para su pulpería.
texts.en:
Cristobalina T. S. is 72 years old.  She is a widow and a hard working humble woman.  Her husband passed away five years ago and she lives with her granddaughter who she has raised like a daughter.  Since her husband passed away she has seen the need to work as a small businesswoman out of her home in order to generate income and support herself.  She started a small store and things have gone well for her.  She also raises chickens and hogs, bakes bread and homemade empanadas to sell in her store.  She also raises yams with her son in law.  Her granddaughter helps her in the home and in her business.

This will be her second loan and she will use the money to buy groceries and other things for her store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Sheila Viviana

texts.es: Doña Sheila A. C. es una señora joven con 34 años de edad, madre de cuatro niños y separada de su esposo. Ella vive con sus hijos en una casa de dos plantas en donde sus padres habitan en la planta de arriba y ella en la de abajo en el centro de Limón. Cuenta con el apoyo de ellos para tomar cualquier decisión para bien. Ella se dedica al comercio ambulante sin descuidar a su familia. Primero hace los oficios domésticos, ve sus hijos y luego sale a vender su mercadería. Es el primer préstamo que solicita y lo va invertir en comprar ropa y también oro y plata laminada.
texts.en: Sheila A. C. is a 34 year old young woman and the mother of four.  She is separated from her husband and lives with her children in a two story home in the center of Limón.  Her parents live on the second floor and she on the first.  She has their full support.  She makes her sales on foot without missing her family obligations.  First she does her housework, sees her children, and then goes out to sell merchandise.  This will be her first loan and she will use the money to buy clothing and gold and silver jewelry.

loans.use: to buy clothing and jewelry for resale

loans.name: Munah

texts.en:
Munah is 22 years old and lives in Paynesville. Munah is a high school graduate and is single. She has a child aged 4 that lives with her at home who is presently in school. 

For the past 3 years Munah has been selling used clothes. She says that her main challenge with the business is that sometimes she sells on credit. Munah started this business by the help of friends who gave her money as a help to do something for herself. What she loves about being in this business is that it helps her to go to school and send her daughter to school. 

Munah requested this loan to purchase more used clothes. In the future Munah wants to be an international businesswoman and advance herself to university.

loans.use: to purchase bags of used clothes

loans.name: Crucero De San Vicente 1 Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Crucero D. San Vicente, porque esta ubicado exactamente en un cruce carretero D. L. comunidad D. San vicente en el estado D. México, en México. El grupo esta conformado por nueve integrantes y es L. segunda vez que solicita un prestamo. L. señora Eleuteria H. H. es L. tesorera del grupo. Tiene 44 años y solo termino L. primaria. ElL. se dedica al comercio D. estambres para costuras que inicio ase 8 años. Tiene dos hijos en total (una mujer y un varon). Solicita el prestamo para surtir su negocio y cubrir los pedidos que tiene por cumplir. Al momento D. solicitar este prestamo se siente a gusto con el grupo ya que planea a corto plazo el crcimiento D. su negocio y posteriormente emprender otro negocio D. papeleria con el fin D. mejorar L. calidad D. vida D. sus hijos y continuar dandoles educación para que logren una carrera profesional.
texts.en: This group is called “Crucero D. San Vicente” because it’s located on the crossroads of San Vincente in the state of Mexico.  The group is maD. up of nine members and this will be their second loan.  Eleuteria H. H is the treasurer.  She is 44 years old and only completed elementary school.  She sells fine wool articles and has been doing so for eight years.  She has two children (a son and daughter).  She is asking for this loan in order to stock her business and fill some orders that she has received.  She is happy with the group and plans to grow her business in the short term and eventually open a store to improve the quality of life for her children.  She wants to give them an education so that they can attain professional careers.

loans.use: to buy supplies to stock her business

loans.name: Senovia

texts.es:
Senovia es socia del banco Comunal La Kantuta, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos de 18, 14 y 13 años
Senovia se dedica a la venta de zapatos. Antes se dedicaba a la preparación de jugos pero era muy cansado y ajetreado, por ello decidió cambiar de negocio y se dedicó a la venta de zapatos, ahora tiene un puesto en el Mercado Chorro y le va bien. 
Senovia solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio para la compra de zapatos de variados modelos para surtir su mercadería.
Senovia está en Finca Perú desde hace tres años, ingreso por la invitación de un amiga, le gusta porque le prestan capital para que trabaje y sobre todo puede ahorrar ya que en casa no se puede.
Ahora está ahorrando para mejorar su casa. Su sueño es poder abrir una fabrica de zapatos y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Senovia is a member of the La Kantuta communal bank.  She is 35 years old and has three children, ages 18, 14, and 13.  Senovia sells shoes.  Before that she used to make juices, but that was very hard and tiring work so she decided to change her business.  She has a stall in the Chorro market and things are going well for her.  Senovia is asking for this loan in order to invest in various types of shoes so that she can carry a wider assortment in her business.

She has been with Finca Perú for three years and joined after being invited by a friend.  She enjoys it because she is able to get working capital so that she can continue to work and also save some money.

She is saving up to make improvements to her home.  She hopes to be able to open a shoe factory and have a house built.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es socia del Banco Comunal La Kantuta, tiene 41 años y 3 hijos de 22, 17 y 10 años de edad.
Alejandra se dedica a la comercialización de cereales. Alejandra viaja a las feria de Chontaca, Seccelambras, Chiara, donde hacia antes trueques, ahora compra cereales y los vende entre sus caseras del mercado Nery García.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cereales.
Alejandra está en Finca hace 5 años, le gusta porque le apoyan en los préstamos, puede ahorrar, con sus ahorros compró cosas para implementar su casa.
Su sueño es poder ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos y que sean profesionales, tener un negocio.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a member of the La Kantuta communal bank.  She is 41 years old and has three children, ages 22, 17, and 10.  Alejandra sells cereals.  And travels to the Chontaca, Seccelambras, Chiara fair where she used to make exchanges, but now she buys cereals and sells them among homes and at the Nery Garcia market.  She is asking for this loan to buy cereals.  

She has been with Finca Perú for five years.  She enjoys it because she gets support and can get loans.  She is also able to save some money.  She used some of her savings to equip her home.

She wants to save for her children's education so that they can develop professional careers.

loans.use: to buys cereals for resale

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel M. es un microempresario de la zona de Turrialba, el se dedica a la lechería.
Su negocio ha tenido éxito, pero ya la demanda cada vez es mayor y necesita agrandar su lechería, es por eso que necesita un préstamo de 500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de zing, cemento, arena y demás materiales de construcción que necesita para mejorar las condiciones de su establecimiento. El desea  que gracias su micro empresa pueda brindarle una mejor calidad a su familia.
El es socio de la Empresa de crédito La Fuente Agrícola Empresarial, una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en  Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Daniel M. is a small businessman in the Turrialba zone.  He is a successful dairy farmer, but is unable to keep up with the demand.  He needs to expand his dairy and needs a loan of 500,000 Colones ($1,025) to buy zinc metal sheeting, cement, sand and other building materials to improve his establishment.  He wants to provide a better quality of life to his family through his business.

He is part of the "La Fuente Agrícola Empresarial" loan company.  One of the 110 associated with EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Sembradoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEMBRADORAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Marina.   Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: venta de plástico, viaje a Villazon con ropa, venta de manzanas, elaboración de muebles, venta de chamarras, venta de coca, venta de verduras.

La señora Marina, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que hace un año y medio que participa en Pro Mujer. En la actualidad la vende muebles, negocio que le enseñaron sus familiares hace un año atrás.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para la compra muebles, para aumento de capital. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos
texts.en:
The “SEMBRADORAS" community group is made up of eight women and will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer (Professional Woman) as part of the Senkata office.  Marina is the group's president and each of the women are involved in different businesses, including plastic goods sales, apple sales, furniture making, jacket sales, cacao sales, and vegetable sales.

Mariana says that she's been participating with Pro Mujer for a year and a half.  She sells furniture and learned the business from her family years ago.

She will use the money from this loan to buy furniture to increase her inventory.  This business allows her to earn an income.  She is married and has six children.

loans.use: to buy furniture for resale

loans.name: 19 De Marzo Group

texts.es: El banco D. Emprendimiento "19 D. MARZO " es uno grupo  nuevo D. la agencia, se encuentra en su primer ciclo,  el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco esta representadas por las siguientes socias: Presidenta la señora NayD. quien es la líder del grupo, tiene como negocio la venta D. lencería D. forma ambulante visitando oficinas y domicilios ofreciendo sus productos, tiene ya muchos clientes que compran su mercadería, con el dinero del crédito comprar mercadería por docenas ya que es mas barato y después venderla a un precio mas alto e incrementar su utilidad. Como Tesorera esta la Sra. Deysi quien es separada con 6 hijos que se encuentra estudiando  y tiene el como actividad un taller D. reparación D. motos que lo atienD. uno D. sus familiares que esta ubicado en la una  avenida muy concurrida, con el dinero del crédito hará algunas reparaciones al taller, todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The entrepreneur bank "19 D. MARZO "is a new group, maD. up of responsible, hard working people, and is in its first cycle.  The bank is represented by the following members:

NayD. is the president and leads the group.  She has a linen sales business and sells on foot, visiting offices and homes and offering her services.  She has many steady customers.  She will use the money from this loan to buy items by the dozen because she can get them for better prices this way.  This way she can increase her profits.

Deysi is the treasurer.  She is separated and has six children who attend school.  She has a motorcycle repair shop, run by one of her relatives.  It's located on a busy street.  She will use the money from this loan to make some repairs to the shop.

All of the members are hard working, responsible ladies who are grateful to the institution for their support.

loans.use: to increase inventory and make some repairs

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo tiene 43 años, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era un niño se ha dedicado a la agricultura, con el tiempo logró heredar terrenos de cultivo por parte de sus padres, desde entonces siembra maíz y papa, para él esta actividad le llena de satisfacción y más cuando su familia participa también de esta actividad. Es así que cada mañana muy temprano, se dirige para cuidar de sus plantaciones y procurar que tengan un buen desarrollo. Al ser cosechado estos productos son llevados al mercado central que se encuentra en la ciudad. Hoy el trabajo es de mayor esfuerzo, por ello debe contratar personal para que le ayuden en la siembra en todo el perímetro posible que tiene por cultivar.  Es su primer crédito con MFP,  esta muy entusiasmada en saber que tiene una oportunidad  buena para mejorar su actividad económica, a su vez se compromete en ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo utilizará en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar.
texts.en:
Pablo is 43 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a home of his own.  He's been farming since he was a boy.  He eventually inherited the land from his parents and has been raising corn and potatoes ever since.  This activity fills him with satisfaction.  Every morning he rises early and goes out to care for his crops and eventually takes his harvests to the central market.

There is a lot of work to do now, so he must hire farm hands to help with the planting.  This will be his first loan through MFP and he is very excited to know that he has an opportunity to improve his financial status.  He is committed to making his payments on time.  He will use the money from this loan to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Nancy Prudencia

texts.es: La Sra. Nancy es cliente antigua, anteriormente se le atendió como cliente kiva, ella con su esposo lograron comprarse un terreno donde construyeron su casita, la señora vende fruta de temporada por mayor en la zona de el tejar y su esposo trabaja en el transporte como taxi publico por la zona central, ellos tienen dos hijos en edad escolar, y otros dos hijos mayores quienes formaron su propio hogar, la Sra. Nancy es una cliente responsable quien trabaja con nosotros desde hace diez años, los créditos que saca son para aumento de capital, ya que las frutas de temporada algunas son muy caras, por otra parte también destinan una parte para el mantenimiento de su transporte, que es la otra fuente de sus ingresos, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado. en la foto la Sra. Nancy se encuentra en compañia de su esposo.
texts.en: Nancy is a previous Kiva client and she and her husband managed to buy a piece of land where they built their little house.  Nancy sells seasonal fruits in quantity within the El Tejar zone, and her husband drives a taxi in the central zone.  They have two school-aged children and two other older children on their own.  Nancy is a responsible client who has worked with us for ten years.  She will use some of the money from this loan to increase her working capital and buy seasonal fruit, some of which is expensive.  She will use another part of the money to maintain her transportation, which is her other source of income.  She is grateful to the institution for the backing.  She appears with her husband in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy frut for resale and perform maintenance on her transportation

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora es socia del Banco Comunal Socos, tiene 63 años, es viuda y tiene 5 hijos.
Flora, vive en el distrito D. Socos, se dedica a la venta D. quesos,  carne, que los compra en las ferias D. Alpachaca y Rosas Pata, tambien realiza la venta D. mantas que los compra en el penal D. Yanamilla, panes wawa que los compra en el mercado D. Huamanga. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra, D. quesos, carne, mantas, pan wawa, estos los venderá en la ciudad D. Lima.
Está en Finca Perú desD. hace 3 ciclos, ingreso por la invitación D. su hija le gusta porque le dan créditos para trabajar y pueD. ahorrar, su sueño es que su capital crezca para poder trabajar.
texts.en:
Flora is 63 years old and is a member of the Socos communal bank.  She is a widow with five children.

Flora lives in the Socos district and sells cheese and meat that she buys at the Alpachaca and Rosas Pata fairs.  She also sells blankets that she buys at the Yanamilla prison, and wawa breads that she buys in the Huamanga market.  She will use the money from this loan to buy cheeses, meat, and wawa bread that she will sell in Lima.

She has been with Finca Perú for three cycles and she joined after her daughter invited her.  She enjoys it because she is able to get loans and it allows her to save.  She wants to grow her capital so that she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy inventory for resale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 57 años, vive con uno de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 8 años expende comida que ella misma prepara en su casa, por las mañana comprar los ingredientes que utilizará y procura que sean alimentos perecibles frescos, ya luego en la tarde los vende y al termino del día ofrece también alimentos rápidos como sándwich acompañados de bebida calientes, como café, té o mates de acuerdo a la preferencia de sus clientes. Tiene mucha afluencia de gente, logrando captar clientes, entre ellos los comerciantes de un centro comercial de su  localidad, la ventaja de su negocio radica en que la venta la realiza al contado y sus ganancias se ven reflejadas al terminar el día. Asimismo durante el fin de semana  prepara platos típicos de su región y los vende en su carpa que instala en la puerta de su casa. Le agrada realizar el negocio que tiene porque le permite tener mejores ganancias a comparación de otros negocios que ha intentado anteriormente de las cuales fracasó, sin embargo sus ánimos y sus deseos de ser mejorar hacen que continúe en este trabajo. Sus planes para el futuro es conseguir un local o cafetín en una escuela para preparar comida para los docentes y alumnos. Es su crédito número 19 con MFP, se siente muy feliz de ser parte de su banco comunal ya que aprendió el valor del ahorro de la solidaridad de la cual esta agradecida y continuará siendo responsable y comprometida en su trabajo. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de envases descartables y también de algunos ingredientes perecibles y no perecibles.
texts.en:
Gloria, 57, lives with one of her three children in her own hose.  For over 8 years she’s been selling home-made food.  She buys the ingredients she’ll need in the morning and makes sure they are fresh perishables because she then sells in the afternoons.  At the end of the day she also sells fast-food items, like sandwiches, accompanied by hot beverages, like coffee, tea or herbal teas, according to the wishes of her customers. A lot of people come by and she’s managed to secure customers among which are merchants from a local shopping center.  The advantage of her business is that sales are cash and profits are reflected at the end of each day.  In addition, on weekends she makes typical regional dishes that she sells in a tent erected on her doorstep.  She enjoys the work she does because it allows for better profits compared to other businesses she’s tried in the past which failed.  Notwithstanding, her enthusiasm and desire to improve keep her in business.  Her future plans are to get a locale or snack bar in a school to prepare food for students and teachers.

This is her 19th loan with MFP and she is very happy to be part of her communal bank because she learned the value of savings and unity for which she is grateful and she will continue to be responsible and committed to her work.

She will use the requested loan to buy disposable containers and also some perishable and non-perishable ingredients.

loans.use: to buy perishables and non-perishables.

loans.name: Nueva Ilución Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA ILUCIÓN” iniciará su ciclo decimo tercero en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Está compuesta por trece  integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Maria.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comida, venta de vidrios, punto Entel, venta de papa, venta de chicharrón, tejidos, venta de peluches y juguetes, artesanías, venta de ropa, comida, venta de cortes de manta, venta de batidos, joyería.
 
La señora María, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que hace un año y medio que participa en Pro Mujer y que ingreso por invitación.

En la actualidad la señora María tiene un negocio de venta de comida con el que trabaja hace doce años; nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá, porque le ayudaba hace años atras. El crédito que sacará ahora es para la compra de verduras, la que compra generalmente de la ceja y la vende en Nuevos Horizontes todos los días. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella esta casada y tiene dos hijos

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta todo
texts.en:
The “NUEVA ILUCIÓN” ["New Hope"] communal association is starting its thirteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II regional center. It is composed of 13 members, and its president is Maria. The businesses operated by the members of the communal association are diverse, including food services, glass sales, Entel [telecommunications] service point, potato sales, chicharrón [cooked pork] sales, weaving, toy and stuffed animal sales, handicrafts, clothing sales, blanket sales, milkshake sales, and jewelry. 
 
María, the president of the communal association, reports that she has participated in Pro Mujer for a year and a half, and she joined by invitation. 

Currently, María has a business selling food, which she has operated for twelve years. She reports that she learned this business from her mother, because she had helped her with it in previous years. The loan that she will receive now is to buy vegetables, which she generally buys in La Ceja and sells in Nuevos Horizontes every day. This type of work allows her to generate resources to contribute to her family, since she is married and has two children. 

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes everything.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es:
El señor Marvin es un hombre trabajador, esforzado y emprendedor de 36 años. Él tiene una pulpería y una agencia de lotería. El inicio con la venta de loterías hace 7 años y luego con las ganancias puso una pequeña venta.
Él tiene tres hijos los cuales  son su inspiración para seguir adelante y el invertirá el crédito en mercadería para la pulpería.
texts.en:
Marvin is a 36-year-old hard-working, striving, enterprising man. He has a general store and a lottery agency.  Marvin began selling lottery tickets some 7 years ago, and with the earnings, he set up a small booth.

Marvin has 3 children who are his inspiration to forge ahead. He will invest the loan in merchandise for his general store.

loans.use: TO BUY BASIC GRAINS, MEAT, DRINKS, ETC., TO SELL

loans.name: Como Las Aguilas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Como las Águilas está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras esforzadas y emprendedoras; una de ellas es la señora Mariela de 33 años se dedica a la venta de enchiladas, ropa y carne desde hace 8 años. 
Inicio su negocio con la venta de carne y enchiladas luego ahorro y empezó a vender ropa. Ella tiene tres hijos de 18, 14 y 12 años respectivamente.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Iliana de los Ángeles de 32 años se dedica a la fabricación de dulces tradicionales (cajetas, piñonates, ayote en miel…etc.) negocio que ha venido de generación en generación, y Mercedes vende nacatamales y venden carne.
texts.en:
The Like an Eagle group is made up of three hard working and entrepreneurial women; one of whom is 33-year old Mrs. Mariela who works selling enchiladas, meat, and clothing for more than eight years. She started her business selling enchiladas and meat and later used her savings to begin selling clothing as well. She has three children 18, 14, and 12 years old respectively.

The other members of the group are Iliana de los Angeles, 32 years old, works make traditional sweets (caramels, pine nut sweets, squash with honey) a business that has been passed down from generation to generation. Mercedes sells tamales and meat.

loans.use: purchase clothing

loans.name: Ruth Mery

texts.es: La Sra. Ruth Vive en la localidad D. la Guardia, su esposo se dedica a la construcción civil, ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa ambulante, y trabaja medio tiempo como domestica, hace unos dos años que se dedica a esta actividad, el destino del crédito es para comprar herramientas D. albañil para su esposo, vive en casa que la esta terminando D. pagar, tiene dos hijo a su cargo por lo que se le hace difícil el mantenimiento D. su colegiatura, es nacida en el departamento D. Beni considerada capital ganadera, se vino a vivir  su corta edad en busca D. nuevas oportunidades; es cliente antiguo D. la institución por lo que se siente satisfecha y agradecida con la institucion.
texts.en: Mrs. Ruth lives in the town of Guardia. Her husband works in construction, and she works part-time as a cleaning women and sells clothing door-to-door too. She has been selling clothes for two years. The loan will be used to buy mason's tools for her husband. They live in a house that they have almost paid off. They have two children, and it is difficult to pay for their school fees. She was born in the department of Beni, a cattle region, and she came to live in Guardia at a young age in search of more opportunity. She is an old client of the institution, and she feels satisfied and thankful for the support.

loans.use: Purchase of masonry tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas 4 Group

texts.en:
Leandra runs a small business of selling clothes and shoes. She has operated her walking store for over 2 years and her loans have allowed her to increase her business. She plans to use this loan to improve her inventory, by buying 12 pairs of shoes, 6 blouses and some pants. 

She has successfully repaid her first loans and this will be her second one with Esperanza. Leandra has two grown children and they live together with their father, Leandra's long-term partner. She wants to continue to increase her business to help her children to become professionals.

Leandra is the group coordinator of her group Mujeres Activas (Active Women) 4. Her story is representative of both her group and of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients (many of whom have recently immigrated to the DR). The group is based in Puerto Plata, in a community that has unreliable access to running water and electricity and lacks trash service.

loans.use: to buy 12 pairs of shoes, 6 blouses and pants.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo Ramón S. Ruiz es un hombre trabajador, esforzado y emprendedor. Él se dedica a la agricultura, actividad que realiza hace más de 15 años que aprendió de sus padres, siembra maíz, frijoles y yuca. 
Además vende leña inició con 5 fletes de leña actualmente trabaja hasta con 20 fletes de leña. Sequira lleva 26 ciclos con Adim e invertirá el crédito en la siembra de dos manzanas de tierra.
texts.en:
Gerardo is a hard-working, striving, and enterprising man. He is dedicated to agriculture, an activity he has been involved in for more than 15 years. Gerardo learned from his parents. He sows corn, beans, and manioc.

In addition, he sells firewood. Gerardo began with 5 loads of firewood at a time. At present, he works with as much as 20 loads of firewood at a time.

Gerardo has worked with ADIM through 26 loan cycles. He will invest the loan in sowing 3.5 acres of land.

loans.use: TO SOW 3.5 ACRES OF FARM LAND

loans.name: Paulita

texts.es: La Sra. Paulita vive en la localidad de la Guardia, su esposo se dedica al transporte de personas(taxi) desde la localidad a la ciudad de Santa Cruz, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, en su propio domicilio, hace unos dos años, tiene tres hijos, es nacida en el departamento de santa cruz, el destino del crédito es para comprar una heladera para su negocio, sus deseos es poder terminar de pagar su casa, ya que la esta pagando en cuotas, es cliente antigua de la institución por lo que se siente agradecida por el apoyo económico.
texts.en: Paulita lives in the town of Guardia. Her husband is a taxi driver, driving people from their town to the city of Santa Cruz. Paulita has been selling food from her home for the past two years. She has three children. She was born in the region of Santa Cruz. The loan she requests will be used to buy a refrigerator for her business. She wants to be able to finish paying off her house. Paulita is a long-time client of her community bank and she very grateful for its financial support.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy string and materials for production.

loans.name: La Pasadita De $ Group

texts.es: El Grupo se llama La Pasadita de $ , porque a ese lugar todos lo conocen como la pasadita, se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de Mexico,la señora Cecilia Villegas es integrante del grupo compuesto por 14 señoras. Ella tiene 29 años y tiene 3 hijos un hombre y 2 mujeres, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas negocio en el cual lleva 5 años, solicito su presatmo para invertir en maiz ya que su meta es poder ayudar a sus hijos y abrir un nuevo local donde tenga mejores ventas, en este momento se siente muy contenta por la oportunidad que le dan y segura de poderlo pagar.
texts.en:
The group is called “La Pasadita de $” because this place is known by everyone as La Pasadita.  It’s located in the state of México.
Mrs. Cecilia Villegas is a member of the group which has 14 members.  She is 29 years old and has three children: one boy and two girls.  She sells tortillas, a business she’s had for 5 years.

She requested her loan to buy corn because her goal is to help her children ant to open a new locale where sales will be better. 

She is happy for the opportunity she’s been given and sure that she will be able to repay.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina tiene  62 años, vive  con su esposo en su casa propia. Hace más D. 30 años ha practicado la agricultura, actividad que le ha dado ingresos económicos, asimismo se dedica en la venta D. queso, carne y miel D. abeja que compra al por mayor D. los mismo productores que se encuentran en su zona Es así que en cada viaje que realiza, reparte a  sus clientes fijos, asícomo los ofrece D. manera ambulante a las ciudades a donD. va. Para ella es importante este negocio ya que es una entrada más hasta que le toque el momento D. cosechar papa y maíz, y lograr vender todo lo producido. Su tiempo D. trabajo lo distribuye entre el comercio y agrícola para garantizarse los ingresos que necesita su familia, sin embargo debe afrontar los problemas del clima que azotan sus plantaciones y perjudican su producción. Actualmente su objetivo es abastecerse D. mercadería para vender. Es su crédito número 11 con MFP y durante este tiempo D. pertenecer a su banco comunal  considera que fueron  muy gratificantes sobre todo en su aprendizaje sobre asuntos financieros y la importancia en su economía, uno D. los hábitos que mas aprendió fue la del ahorro D. la cual esta agradecida además  D. que se compromete a seguir siendo puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. mercadería y D. sacos D. abono para su próxima campaña D. siembra.
texts.en:
Paulina, 62, lives with her husband in her own house.  For over 30 years she’s been a farmer, an activity that has produced income for her.  She also sells cheese, meat and honey that she buys wholesale from producers in her area.  On every trip she makes, then, she sells to her regular customers as well as selling in an itinerant manner in the cities she visits. This business is important to her because it’s an additional source of income while she’s waiting to harvest potatoes and corn and to sell her entire crop yield.  She divides her time between the commercial work and the agricultural work to insure income her family needs.  Nevertheless, she still has to withstand problems caused by the weather that batter her plants and affect production.  Her current goal is to stock up on merchandise to sell.

This is her 11th loan with MFP.  She considers that the time she’s spent as a member of a communal bank has been very gratifying, above all with respect to her learning about financial affairs and the importance they have in her economy.  One of the habits she learned best was savings for which she is most grateful.  She commits to continue being punctual with her payments.

She plans to use the requested loan to buy merchandise and sacks of manure for her next planting cycle.

loans.use: to buy products like cheese, honey and meat and to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for his repair shop.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth M. es una joven de 28 años que vive en el municipio de Arjona en el departamento de Bolívar, allí tiene una tienda llamada La Nina Danna, que le genera sus principales  ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus  2 hijos en las edades de 4 y 6 anos . Su negocio inicio hace menos de dos años con un capital de trabajo pequeño,  con sus propios esfuerzos gradualmente fue agregándole un enfriador que  compro a crédito y que ya termino de pagar, así como también mercancías, lo que ha mostrado  el crecimiento gradual de sus ventas hasta lograr capitalizarlo. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para surtirlo, por eso con su credikiva  comprara víveres, abarrotes y un congelador, inversión que proyecta ser exitosa  pues venderá en un mayor volumen, al tener donde conservar alimentos cárnicos como la carne y también el pollo  y pescado,  que le ayudan en una oferta más diversificada y sobre todo en el mantenimiento de estos productos para ser guardado con las medidas higiénicas y de calidad que se requiere. Más adelante Ruth proyecta adicionarle artículos de papelería y miscelánea porque persiste en el sueño de ampliarlo para tener más utilidades y comprar su casa propia, así como ofrecerle oportunidades educativas de mayor calidad  a sus hijos, pero mientras tanto trabaja con un margen de rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor de un 25% .
texts.en:
Ruth M. is a young, 28-year-old woman living in the town of Arjona, Bolívar Department.  She has a store called “La Nina Danna” that is her main source of income to support her two children who are 4 and 6 years old.  

She started the business less than two years ago with a small amount of working capital.  With her efforts she gradually was able to add a cooler, that she bought on credit and has since paid off, as well as merchandise.  Her sales have increased gradually until they were sufficient to capitalize it.

She is currently applying for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to stock it.  She will, therefore, use her Kiva loan to buy foodstuffs, groceries and a freezer.  She expects this investment will be successful because it will bring a larger volume since she will have some place to keep meat, chicken and fish that will make it possible for her to offer more variety but, above all, be able to keep these items following the required hygienic and quality control conditions they require.

Later on, she plans to add stationery items and notions to her stock because she persists in the desire to expand it still more to earn higher profits and someday buy a house of her own as well as offer her children educational opportunities of higher quality.  Meanwhile, she works producing a profit margin of no less than 25%.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, groceries and a freezer.

loans.name: Union Con Esperanza  1 Group

texts.en:
Eusebia is the coordinator of her group Union con Esperanza 1 (Union with Esperanza). Her story is not unlike others in her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican community, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. 

Eusebia's group is located in Puerto Plata, a city on the north coast where the economy is based around tourism and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple setting, with her three children. She is a widowed woman.

Eusebia is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling accessories at her beauty salon. She will be buying hair and beauty products and some accessories like jewellery. She will use the profits to save. Her most difficult challenges are to overcome from her husband's death and to raise her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy hair and beauty products, and Accessories.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila tiene 62 años, vive con su esposo y el menor de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Teofila tiene gran trayectoria en la agricultura pues son más de 50 años de haberse dedicado al cultivo y a la crianza de animales, pues ambas le han proporcionado estabilidad económica para ella y su esposo, ya que tienen 3 hijos a los que cuidaba, hoy son ya independientes. Se siente contenta de haber educado a sus hijos y solo le queda vida para continuar en el cultivo, y sólo trabaja para ella y su pareja. Hasta el momento ha sembrado maíz y papa, que son los principales productos que su tierra le brinda una buena producción. Entre los animales que cría son la vaca y el toro, que cuando es necesario los vende en las ferias ganaderas o algún vecino que requiere de estos animales. Es su crédito número 4 que tiene con MFP, le agrada compartir experiencias de trabajo con los demás integrantes de su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita,  lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y semilla de alfalfa ya que lo necesita como forraje para sus vacas.
texts.en:
Teófila, 62, lives with her husband and the youngest of her three children in her own house.  Teófila has a long career in farming because she’s been farming and raising livestock for over 50 years.  Both these activities have provided economic stability for herself and her husband for they had three children to care for who are now independent.  She feels happy to have educated her children and now her remaining life is to continue farming and now she works just for herself and her husband.  To date, she’s grown corn and potatoes which are the main crops her soil produces in good yields.  Among the animals she raises are cows and bulls.  When necessary, she sells them at the livestock fairs or to some neighbor who requires these animals.

This is her 4th loan with MFP.  She enjoys sharing her work experiences with the other group members.  She will use the requested loan to buy sacks of manure and alfalfa seed that she needs as forage for her cows.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and alfalfa seed.

loans.name: Lindo Amanecer Group

texts.en:
The communal bank "Lindo Amanecer" (Beautiful Sunrise) is in its second loan cycle at FINCA Peru. Its 17 members, who are taking out a group loan of 10,200 PEN, are involved in various businesses such as making artisanal goods, selling groceries, and selling prepared food at markets and fairs in the region. 

CarL. is the President of the bank. She has been a member of FINCA Peru, on and off, for 10 years now. She is 29 years old, married, and has two children. Her children, aged 10 and 6, are both studying. CarL. has a locksmith business, which she started ten years ago. She will be using her loan of 600 PEN to purchase materials for her business. She enjoys working with FINCA Peru and saving money. Right now she is saving to purchase materials to fix up her house. She would also like to expand her locksmith workshop one day.

loans.use: To purchase materials for a locksmith business.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza Isabel Palacios vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y es una mujer imparable, se dedica a muchas actividades: confecciona ropa, ofrece el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras  y también  vende mercancías a crédito,  como cosméticos, interiores femeninos,  ropa informal;  Su hogar lo conforma su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 23 a 40 años y que aun son su gran inspiración para el trabajo intenso que Lorenza realiza.  Este es su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y considera que su vida ha tenido un cambio del 50% con su crédito, porque ha conocido que puede moverse aun más en el mercado, cumplir sus obligaciones y ganar dinero.  Su sueño es tener un almacén de variedades y ayudar en aumentar el bienestar familiar cada día más.
Por eso con su credikiva se propone fortalecer su mercado de mercancías variadas y comprar perfumes, cosméticos, ropa interior y blusas que tiene encargadas por sus clientes, así con la venta de estas mercancías  aumentara sus ingresos y también su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Lorenza Isabel Palacios lives in the city of Cartagena.  She is an unstoppable woman.  She is involved in lots of activities:  she makes clothes, she leases washing machines and she also sells items on credit like cosmetics, women’s underwear and casual clothes. Her home consists of her spouse and four children whose ages range from 23 to 40 and who are still a great inspiration for the work Lorenza does.

This is her second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She considers her life has changed 50% with the loan because she’s realized that she can move even more in the marketplace, can meet her obligations and earn money.  Her dream is to have a variety store and to help her family’s wellbeing more each day.

She plans to use her Kiva loan to strengthen her assorted merchandise market and to buy perfume, cosmetics, underwear and blouses that her customers have ordered.  The sale of this merchandise will increase her income as well as her working capital.

loans.use: to buy fabric and merchandise like perfume, cosmetics, underwear and blouses.

loans.name: Luis Albert

texts.es: El Sr. Luis y su esposa Ana, Ambos se   dedican  a la atención de una Licorería,   viven en  casa familiar, Ubicadas en la av. tres pasos al frente, tienen una hija de nueve añitos. También percibe renta de su vehículo ya que un chofer lo trabaja de lunes a jueves, el  Viernes, Sábados y Domingos el Sr: Luis lo trabaja el vehículo por que existe mayor movimiento de pasajeros y le genera mayor ingresos, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo. Es cliente antiguo de la institución el cual ya demostró buena secuencia de pago, Actualizan su mercadería cada fin de semana realizan sus compras en diferentes mercados y agencias  buscando siempre de menos precios El Sr. Luis, es una persona  que trabaja mucho junto con su esposa, se esfuerzan para salir adelante por el bienestar de su hija y así darles un futuro en condiciones mejores.
texts.en:
Luis and his wife, Ana, work in a liquor store.  They live in the family house on Avenida Tres Pasos Al Frente.  They have a nine year old daughter.  They also receive rent from a vehicle that a driver uses to work on Mondays through Fridays.  Luis uses the vehicle to work on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays because there are more passengers on those days, and it generates greater income.  

He will use the money from the loan for repairs and maintenance on his vehicle.  He has been a long time client of the institution, and he has demonstrated a good course of payment.  He updates his merchandise every week-end.  He makes his purchases at different markets and agencies.  He is always looking for the lowest prices.

Luis is a person who works a lot along with his wife.  They put forth great effort to get ahead and for the well-being of their daughter.  This way they will have a future with better conditions.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es: Giovanna Sánchez S.  tiene una heladería ubicada en la ciudad de Cartagena  donde vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 11 años.  Giovanna inicio su actividad comercial vendiendo frutas de manera ambulante,  luego  se dedico a vender mercancías y actualmente vende refrescos como cervezas  al por mayor  y al detal; este ultimo negocio está ubicado en un local de propiedad de su hermano que se lo cedió ya que carecía de tiempo suficiente para atender esta actividad y por eso  negoció con ella asignarle  una cuota fija, en calidad de arriendo. El negocio de Giovanna cuenta con toda la infraestructura necesaria para brindar a sus clientes un excelente servicio, pero requiere tener la suficiente cantidad de canastas de cervezas, para rotar mas rápido su capital de trabajo y esto es justamente lo que planea con su credikiva, comprar canastas de cervezas y refrescos logrando inventarios que canalicen a sus clientes hacia el punto de venta de Giovanna. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el espera lograr aumentar su capital de trabajo y responder oportunamente a sus clientes y lograr poco a poco su sueño de apoyar a su hijo hasta convertirlo en lo que a el le gusta: ser un basquetbolista de talla internacional,
texts.en:
Giovanna Sánchez S. has a soda fountain in the city of Cartagena, where she lives with her husband and eleven year old son. She started her business selling fruit as a street vendor. Later she sold merchandise and now sells beverages, such as beer, in bulk and by the unit. This latest business is located on a piece of property owned by her brother. He left this business to her because he did not have enough time to manage it and they have negotiated a fee for her to pay as rent. Giovanna’s business has the necessary infrastructure to provide her customers with excellent service, but she needs to have sufficient quantities of beer because of quick turnover. For this reason, she will use her Kiva loan as operating capital. She plans to buy cases of beer and soft drinks so that she can attract more customers to her establishment.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She hopes to increase her operating capital, respond quickly to her customers, and support her son’s dream of becoming an international basketball player.

loans.use: To purchase cases of beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
El grupo Sonia del Carmen R. R. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 47 años. Ella inicio su negocio hace 14 años vendiendo paca (ropa usada) y desde hace un año puso una pequeña venta la cual poco a poco fue surtiendo.
Ella tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo la menor es depende de ella que es una niña de 6 años.
texts.en: Sonia del Carmen R. R. is a hardworking, determined, and enterprising woman who is 47 years of age.  She started a business fourteen years ago selling bales of used clothing.  Within the past year, she also opened a small store that she is gradually stocking with merchandise.  Sonia has five children, but only one is a dependent, a six year old daughter.

loans.use: To purchase bales of used clothing and dry goods for her store.

loans.name: Jesús Es Mi Confianza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jesús es mi confianza está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Ruth Pavón de 24 años tiene una tienda de ropa la cual puso hace 5 años. Ella inicio vendiendo por encargo y luego con su arduo trabajo puso su pequeña tienda.
Ella invertirá el crédito en mercadería en especial cosméticos y su sueño es tener un tramo en el mercado.
Las otras integrantes son Blanca Rosa M. de 30 años quien vende ropa desde hace 4 años y Rosa T. de 24 años comercializa cosméticos y ropa desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
The group “Jesús es Mi Confianza” (Jesus is My Confidant) consists of three hardworking, determined, and enterprising women. One of them is Sra. Ruth Pavón. She is 24 years old and has managed a clothing store for five years. Ruth started her business by accepting orders and later she worked hard to open a small store. She will invest her loan in merchandise, especially cosmetics. Her dream is to have a booth at the market.

The other members are Blanca Rosa M., who is 30 years old and has been selling clothes for four years, and Rosa T., who is 24 years old and has been selling cosmetics and clothing for three years.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Cándida

texts.es:
La señora Cándida Rosa R. Castillo es una fémina trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 40 años. Ella es propietaria de un pequeño salón de belleza desde hace 8 años. 
 Ramírez inicio trabajando en los salones y poco a poco adquirió conocimiento y empezó a ahorra para poner su propio negocio el cual ha ido creciendo. Ella invertirá el crédito en mercadería como tintes, cremas para alizar, exfoliantes, cremas, pinturas, uñas acrílicas, cremas para planchar, tratamientos… etc.
texts.en:
Sra. Cándida Rosa R. Castillo is a hardworking, determined, and enterprising woman who is 40 years of age. She has owned a small beauty salon for eight years.

Cándida started working in salons and gradually acquired knowledge. She started saving so that she could start her own business, which has been growing. Cándida will invest this loan in products such as dyes, straightening creams, exfoliants, lotions, nail polish, acrylic nails, heat-activated creams, treatments, and other items.

loans.use: To purchase beauty and styling products for her salon.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 46 años, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 4  hijos en su casa propia. Elena tiene más de 20 años dedicándose a la agricultura, actividad que le ha aportado económicamente y con ello ha logrado mantener a su familia, convirtiéndola en el pilar de su hogar. Ella y su esposo han luchado mucho para sobresalir, ya que esta actividad requiere de esfuerzo y dedicación.  Año tras año supo que hacer, sin descuidar de su hogar, es así que se ganó el respeto de sus hijos a quienes ahora les enseña con ejemplo. Actualmente se dedica al cultivo de la papa y maíz, pero en tiempos de escasez cría cerdos, para cuando tenga alguna dificultad con su producción, vende estos animales para obtener ganancias. Ahora continua trabajando muy duro para seguir adelante buscando el desarrollo de su trabajo y el de su familia. Es su crédito número 8 con MFP, considera que tuvo una buena experiencia de trabajo grupal en su banco comunal porque aprendió a invertir sus ingresos económicos, motivo por el cual agradece y afirma que seguirá trabajando de esa misma manera. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de semillas mejoradas y abono para su campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Elena is 46 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and four children. She has been farming for more than 20 years and has relied on this activity to support her family financially. As a result, she has become the pillar of her home. Elena and her husband have fought hard to succeed since farming requires effort and dedication. Year after year, she continues to work without neglecting her household. Elena has earned the respect of her children and now teaches them by example. At the moment, she is growing potatoes and corn. During scarce periods, she raises pigs that she can sell for when she has trouble with production. She is now working hard so that she can continue developing in her job and with her family.

This is her eighth loan with MFP. Elena considers working with her Communal Bank to be a good experience because she has learned how to invest her income. For this reason, she is grateful and says that she will continue working in the same manner. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of improved seeds and compost for the planting season.

loans.use: To purchase potato seedlings and sacks of compost.

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Alfa y Omega 2 está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras; una de ellas es la joven Judith Isabel C. López de 20 años quien tiene una fritanga de platanitos, enchiladas y yucas.
