C. desde la edad de 8 años empezó a trabajar junto con sus hermanas y madre, ellas iniciaron con la venta de tortilla, luego vendieron elotes, yoltamal, tamal, atol etc. y después empezaron a realizar platanitos primeramente los vendían en la calle en la actualidad reparten en los colegio.
Ella con el crédito invertirá en plátano, aceite, repollo, yuca, queso… etc.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son María Soledad L. de 28 años se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras y Johanna C. de 34 años tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que se basa en comida frita.
texts.en:
The group “Alfa y Omega 2” (Alpha and Omega 2) consists of three hardworking, determined, and enterprising individuals. One of them is a young woman named Judith Isabel C. López. She is 20 years old and manages a “fritanga” (an establishment that sells fried foods) where she serves plantain chips, enchiladas, and cassava.

Judith began working at the age of 8 with her sisters and her mother. They started selling tortillas and later sold corn on the cob, dessert tamales, tamales, “atol" (a corn beverage), and other food products. Afterwards, they began making plantain chips to sell on the street. Their business is currently located across from a school. Judith will use her loan to invest in plantains, oil, cabbage, cassava, cheese, and other products.

The other members of the group are María Soledad L., a 28 year old fruit and vegetable vendor, and Johanna C., who is 34 years old and also manages a “fritanga” that sells popular fried foods.

loans.use: To purchase plantains, oil, cabbage, cassava, cheese, and other products.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
La señora Luz, es socia del banco comunal Manos Unidas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos.
Lleva 11 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, todos estos años ha estado trabajando para implementar su negocio de venta de productos comestibles, pero hace algunos días toda su casa se inundó de agua y tuvieron que guardar toda la mercadería para poder limpiar, hecho que ha ocasionado una baja en sus ingresos..
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles, comprará: 1 caja de café en sobre, 1 caja de té, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz, 1 caja de mayonesa,1 caja de vela, 1 paquete de sal, 1 caja de aceite, 5 paquetes de papel higiénico, ½ caja de conservas.
Espera que en algunas semanas pueda volver a su casa para abrir nuevamente su pequeño negocio.  Luz está muy agradecida  con Manuela Ramos por todos los años en que la viene apoyando.
texts.en:
Sra. Luz is a member of the Communal Bank “Manos Unidas” (United Hands) which is in the District of Calleria in the Department of Ucayali. She is 49 years old, married, and has five children.

Luz has worked with the loans from Manuela Ramos for eleven years. Through all these years, she has worked in her business selling food products. A few days ago, her entire house was flooded so she had to store all of her merchandise during the cleanup process. As a result of this event, her income has decreased.

With this new loan of 2500 PEN, she will buy one case of coffee, one case of tea, one sack of sugar, one sack of rice, one case of mayonnaise, one box of candles, one packet of salt, one case of oil, five boxes of toilet paper, and a half case of preserves. Luz hopes that she will be able to return home in a few weeks and reopen her small business. She is extremely grateful to Manuela Ramos for all the years in which she has received assistance.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Sr De Qoyllorty Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR.DE QOYLLORTY”; Este banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Muñapata, provincia de Quispicanchis, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Gladys;  La socia tiene 34 años de edad; La socia es casada;  La socia  tiene 3 hijos y se dedica principalmente a la ganadería, la socia compra y vende ganados vacunos, ella a su vez vende pasto y en dependiendo a  la producción de sus vacas vende leche; la socia alterna estas actividades junto a su esposo, ella en esta oportunidad solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de un par de vacas y pasto para la venta y consumo de sus animales. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de ganados y pasto.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladys is a member of the Communal Bank “Sr. De Qoyllorty” which is located in the community of Muñapata, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 34 years old, married, and has three children. Gladys engages primarily in livestock breeding. She buys and sells cattle, but she also sells grasses on occasion based on how much milk her dairy cows produce. Gladys and her husband divide the chores. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to invest in the purchase of a pair of cows and grasses to sell and for consumption by her animals. The funds will be used to buy cows and grasses.

Gladys is pleased with the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase cows and grasses.

loans.name: Nonoy

texts.es:
La señora Nonoy, es socia del banco comunal Manos Unidas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos.
La socia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo (Natura), ya tiene varios años trabajando con estos productos, Manuela Ramos ha estado contribuyendo con su negocio al brindarle los préstamos para  tener un capital que le permita comprar productos y mantener su stock.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/.1,700.00 nuevos soles  comprará: 5 perfumes para mujer, 3 talcos para bebe, 5 cremas para manos, 3 paquetes de jaboncillos, 3 champú, 2 jabones liquido, 3 perfumes para hombres.
Tiene un buen stock de mercadería para poder ofrecer a sus clientes cuando se lo soliciten, todo lo que tiene le ha costado mucho trabajo, su esposo  es ejecutivo de una empresa y la suma de ambos ingresos le alcanza para poder mantener a su familia sin ningún problema.
texts.en:
Sra. Nonoy is a member of the Communal Bank “Manos Unidas” (United Hands) which is in the District of Calleria in the Department of Ucayali. She is 29 years old, married, and has five children.

Nonoy has been selling Natura beauty products from a catalog for several years. Manuela Ramos has contributed to her business by providing loans to use as capital, which has helped her buy products and maintain her inventory. With this new loan of 1700 PEN, she will buy five perfumes for women, three talcum powders for babies, five hand creams, three packets of miniature soaps, three shampoos, two liquid soaps, and three colognes for men.

Having a good stock of merchandise will allow her to provide these products to her customers whenever they ask for them. Everything she has requires a great deal of work. Her husband is a business executive and both of their incomes enable them to maintain their family without any problems.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, talcum powders, hand creams, soaps, shampoos, and colognes.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 27 años, vive en compañía de sus padres en la propiedad de sus progenitores. Hace más de 2 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, mercadería que es ofrecida a personas conocidas y familiares, dejando a crédito, así asegura el pago total de las prendas que vende. Por otro lado también se dedica a la agricultura, ya que posee terrenos que sus padres le heredaron, de esta manera logra obtener ingresos extras para su familia. Pero el negocio que más le agrada es la venta de ropa, permitiéndole tener ingresos mas frecuentes a comparación de la agricultura que tiene que esperar tiempo para ver las ganancias, además necesita de capital para invertir en insumos para fertilizar los terrenos. Seguirá continuando en estas actividades ya que se ha propuesto mejorar en ambas tanto en las ventas como en la producción. Es su crédito número 2  con MFP, para ella significa mucho pertenecer en su banco comunal porque le permite  estar con personas que considera de su plena confianza. Con el crédito que solicita, será invertida en mercadería como prendas de vestir y la otra parte en la compra de sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Luz is 27 years old and lives with her parents on property that they own. She has been selling clothes for more than two years and offers her merchandise to acquaintances and relatives. Luz offers her products on credit and is assured of full payment for the garments that she sells. She also engages in farming and has land that her parents inherited. This enables her family to generate extra income. However, she enjoys managing her clothing business more because farming requires that one must wait some time before seeing any profit. In addition, farming requires capital to invest in supplies for fertilizing the land. Luz will continue in both business activities in hopes of improving her sales and her farm production.

This is her second loan with MFP. Being part of a Communal Bank has significant meaning to Luz because she has a group of people who have complete trust in her. The loan she is requesting will be invested in merchandise for her clothing business, but some of the money will also be used to purchase sacks of compost.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her clothing business and sacks of compost for her crops.

loans.name: Margolita Damaris

texts.es:
La señora Margolita es socia del banco comunal  Manos Unidas del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.
Lleva 2 años perteneciendo a la familia de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de lubricantes y su negocio es muy formal y funciona en su misma casa, sus hijos le ayudan en la venta mientras se encuentra ocupada con los que aceres de su hogar.
Con su nuevo préstamo de s/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 cajas de aceite móvil, 1 caja de cera, 5 juegos de sistema de arrastre, 1 caja de grasa.
Espera más adelante que le otorguen un crédito con un monto mayor para poder invertirlo en su negocio, desea tener una tienda muy bien surtida, su esposo es trabajador independiente, y es el que mantiene el hogar, y con el dinero del negocio se pagan las letras de Manuela Ramos y sus ahorros.
Está muy contenta porque espera que se cumplan sus sueños de poder ampliar su negocio y más adelante les ayude en la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Margolita is a member of the Manos Unidas (United Hands) Communal Bank in the Calleria district in the Ucayali department.  She is 35 years old, married, and has three children.  She has belonged to the Manuela Ramos family for two years.  

She has a business selling lubricants.  Her business, which is in her own house, is very reliable.  Her children help her when she is busy with the household chores.

With her new loan for 1,000 soles she will buy two boxes of motor oil, one box of wax, five sets of hauling systems, and one box of grease.

She hopes that later she will be granted a loan for a large amount to be able to invest it in her business.  She wants to have a very well stocked store.  Her husband is an independent worker, and he supports the household.  With the money from the business her Manuela Ramos payments are made and her savings.

She is very happy because she hopes to have her dreams come true and be able to expand her business.  She also hopes to help educate her children in the future.

loans.use: buy two boxes of motor oil, one box of wax, five sets of hauling systems, and one box of grease

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella D. C. is from the village of Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 41 years old. Stella is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Stella owns & operates a general retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Stella has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Stella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Stella has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC.  Stella is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase sugar, canned goods, noodles and soft drinks for sale. This will be the second loan taken out by Stella from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, canned goods, noodles and soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene E. is from the village of Tagudalo, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 26 years old. Mylene is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Mylene owns & operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle (three-wheeled vehicle) transport services. Mylene is just starting this business.

In 2011, Mylene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mylene is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the first loan taken out by Mylene from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.name: Segundo Asuncion

texts.es:
Segundo es soltero, tiene 29 años y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de San José, ubicado  a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Segundo se dedica a la fabricación de adobes (material usado para la construcción de viviendas, hecho a base de barro, arcilla y paja), los mismos que vende para obtener ingresos y poder sostener a su familia.

Segundo quisiera fabricar más adobes, por lo que necesita adquirir más insumos para la elaboración de los mismos.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Segundo, 29, is single and lives with his family in the San José district, 20 minutes from Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque department.

Segundo makes adobe bricks (mud blocks that are the material used to build houses, made of mud, clay, and straw) and he sells them to make money to support his family.

He would like to make more bricks but he needs more materials and that is why he is asking for a loan of 1500 new sols.

loans.use: To buy materials to make bricks

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales menores. Con estos negocios él se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia y de solventar su economía diaria.

Edgar desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la producción de sus animales y percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Edgar is 33 years old, single, and lives with his family in the Olmos district.  Olmos is an agricultural area of considerable commercial activity that is located in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Edgar works in raising and selling small animals.  With this business he is responsible for providing for his family's daily expenses.  Edgar would like to purchase nutritious food for the animals to improve their health and breeding, and thus increase his profits.  He has requested a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase nutritious food for his livestock.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es:
Adán tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Adán se dedica  a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo. Cría animales menores, especialmente ovejas, en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio. El los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. 

Adán desea comprar útiles escolares para sus hijos, de esta manera apoyarlos en su educación.  Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Adán is 41 years old, married, and lives with his family in the Olmos district.  Olmos is an agricultural area of considerable commercial activity that is located in the province of Lambayeque, more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Adán has been working in agriculture for a long time.  He breeds and raises small animals, especially sheep, in some pens located near his home.  He feeds them grain and natural grasses.  After the animls have reached a good level of development, they are offered for sale to dealers who frequently visit the area where he resides.

Adán wants to buy school supplies for his children to support their education.  To achieve this objective, he has decided to obtain a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for his children.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero y con su familia en el distrito de Saqa, un distrito conocido a nivel regional por sus tradiciones. Se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado. El cría sus animales en un terreno situado cerca a la zona en donde vive y se vale de el para agenciarse de ingresos diarios con los cuales sustenta la economía de su familia.

Marco desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la producción de sus animales y percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Con los ingresos que perciba de esta actividad el espera aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, el es una persona tranquila, responsable y emprendedora.
texts.en:
Marco is 32 years old, single, and lives with his family in the district of Saqa.  Saqa is a regional district renowned for its traditions and is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Marco raises livestock.  He breeds the animals in an area located near where he lives and he uses his daily earnings to support his family.  Marco wants to buy nutritious food to improve the health and breeding of his animals, thus increasing his profits.  He is requesting a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

With the funds received, he expects to increase his income and improve the quality of life for his family.  Marco is a quiet, responsible, and hardworking person.

loans.use: To buy nutritious food for his livestock.

loans.name: Cristobal Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene de 41 años de edad, es soltero y con su familia en el distrito de Saqa, un distrito conocido a nivel regional por sus tradiciones. Se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Se dedica a la venta de alimentos, actividad que realiza  con la finalidad de apoyar en su familia en la economía.  La venta la realiza de forma ambulatoria, por las calles de su comunidad.  Cuenta ya con clientela fidelizada que lo apoya y lo elige por la calidad de los alimentos que vende y por el buen trato que da.

Manuel desea adquirir alimento más insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos y percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Manuel is 41 years old.  He is single and lives with his family in Saqa district.  This is a district which is well known at a regional level for its traditions.  It is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Manuel's business is selling food.  He carries out this business with the goal of financially supporting his family.  He makes his sales as an itinerant  vendor in the streets of his community.  He already has loyal customers who support him and choose to buy from him because of the quality of the food that he sells and the good customer service that he provides.

Manuel would like to acquire supplies with which to prepare his food and he would like to make more profits.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase nutritious feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Celina

texts.es:
Celina tiene 55 años de edad,  vive con su esposo y sus hijos en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, en Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.

Se  dedica a la crianza y comercialización de cuyes de raza PERU, hace más de tres años consecutivos, teniendo así una buena experiencia.  Con los ingresos que percibe apoya a solventar los gastos de su familia, a quienes apoya desde siempre.

Celina desea arreglar su corral artesanal, comprar alimento balanceado y gastos personales. Asimismo  para que la clienta incremente su el número de cuyes que tiene, los venda y así aumente sus ingresos.  Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Celina is 55 years old and lives with her husband and children in the District of José Leonardo Ortiz, in Chiclayo, the capital of the Department of Lambayeque.

She has been raising and selling Peruvian guinea pigs for more than three years, thus is very experienced.  With her earnings, she is able to cover the expenses of her family, who have always supported her.

Celina is requesting a loan to fix her pens, buy nutritious feed, and for personal expenses.  She would also like to increase the number of guinea pigs that she has to increase her income.  To achieve these objectives, Celina decided to request a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy more animals.

loans.name: Marelly Cristina

texts.es:
Marelly  tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene dos 2 hijos (esposo trabaja para La Junta de Usuarios Chancay Lambayeque). Vive en casa Propia  en el distrito de Picsi ciudad pequeña en vías de crecimiento.  Distrito ubicado en la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

La actividad que desarrolla el titular es la venta de ropa y calzado en la modalidad reparto a pedidos, desde hace mas de 5 años, el préstamo lo solicita para aumentar su capital de trabajo, específicamente para comprar vestimenta de campaña escolar. Esta actividad es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia y gracias a ella ayuda a su esposo con el mantenimiento de la economía diaria.

Marelly desea adquirir más mercadería para ampliar su negocio y aumentar su nivel de ventas y ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en: Marelly is 28 years old, married, with two children. Her husband works for the “The Chancay Lambayeque User’s Board”. She lives in her own house in the Picsi District, a small city that is growing. The district is located in the in the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque Department. For the past five years Marelly has been selling clothes and shoes that are pre-ordered by her customers. She is asking for this loan in order to increase her working capital, specifically to buy school clothing. This business is very helpful to the finances of her family, as it helps her husband pay their bills. Marelly would like to buy more merchandise in order to expand her business and increase her level of sales and earnings. With this in mind, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 new soles, which will help Marelly reach her objectives.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Chean

texts.en: Chean O. is a 38-year-old married woman who resides in the province of Siem Reap. To earn a living, she and her husband often take her boat to the middle part of Tunle Sap River in order to catch fish, spending at least eight hours per day. After fishing, they take all the fresh fish to sell at retail to people who come to buy anything in the market. From this business, they can earn around $7 a day to use for the family’s expenses. Currently, her boat is so small and is getting so old that it is an obstacle that affects their fishing activity. In order to make more revenue, Chean O. is seeking a loan to buy a new big boat for fishing.

loans.use: To buy a new big boat for fishing.

loans.name: Marcia Jacqueline

texts.es:
Marcia tiene 26 años de edad, conviviente, vive con sus suegros, su esposo  se encuentra de viaje por cuestiones de trabajo, vive con ellos ya hace mas de 5 años, la comunidad donde vive es pequeña donde la gente se dedica a la crianza de animales y la agricultura y labores del campo.  Reside en el distrito de Tumán, ubicado a treinta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Marcia se dedica a la crianza de animales con una antigüedad de 15  años en el negocio, en su propio domicilio.  Cría cuyes especialmente, los cuales engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realizan desde hace más de 5 años en la parte posterior de su casa. 

Marcia desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la producción de sus animales y percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1300 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Marcia is 26 years old.  She has a common-law marriage and lives in her in-laws' home.  Her partner is currently traveling for work reasons and she has lived with her in-laws for more than 5 years.  Marcia's community is small and its inhabitants work raising animals and farming the land.  She lives in Tumán district which is located thirty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Marcia raises animals.  She has been engaged in this activity for 15 years and she raises them in her own home.  In particular, she raises guinea pigs which she fattens and then sells in her local market.  They have been carrying out this business in an area behind their home for more than 5 years.

Marcia would like to acquire balanced animal feed in order to improve her production and make more profits.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,300 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia es una cliente de 55 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en una zona urbano marginal del distrito de Santa Rosa, una zona bastante comercial que se encuentra ubicado en Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.

Aurelia cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por un familiar. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, adicionalmente se dedica a la venta ambulante de helados en un carrito. Con estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

La creciente demanda que la bodega de Aurelia ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a 55-year-old customer that lives with her family in the suburbs of the Santa Rosa District. This is a commercial zone that is located in Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque Department. Aurelia has a small grocery store that is located in her home, which is staffed by a relative. They sell to their neighbors and customers. They sell products that provide for the basic daily needs of their customers such as groceries. The business does well. She also sells ice cream from a traveling ice cream cart. In this way she helps her husband with the economic support of their family.
With the growing demand of her customers, she would like to expand her business by buying more products. She is requesting a loan of 1500 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to meet her goal.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 68 years old and married with 7 children.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Merlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.  She has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, bread, softdrinks etc. 

In the future Merlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marisol Maribel

texts.es:
Marisol tiene 31 años de edad que reside junto a su conviviente y a sus hijos en Pacanguilla, en Chepén, en el departamento de la Libertad.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales, las cuales comercializa entre los negociantes de la zona. Con este negocio se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia y de solventar su economía diaria.

Marisol desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la producción de sus animales y percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Marisol is 31 years old and lives with her partner and their children in Pacanguilla, Chepén, in the department of La Libertad. 
For the past five years she has been raising and selling animals that she sells to the buyers in the zone. With this business she helps her family progress and pay their daily bills. 
Marisol would like to buy balanced food in order to increase her production of animals and thereby increase her earnings. This is why she finds it convenient to request a loan of 1500 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy balanced food for her animals.

loans.name: Segundo Faustino

texts.es:
Segundo  tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su esposa y  tiene tres hijos a su cargo. Residen en el distrito de Motupe, localidad que se caracterizada por su fe y su gente emprendedora.  Se ubica a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la  cría de ganado vacuno lechero y además obtiene otros ingresos por el servicio de transporte (mototaxi) ; esta actividad la realiza desde hace 05 años, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuentan con clientela ya establecida en la zona. 

Segundo desea realizar algunas mejoras a su mototaxi que es su herramienta de trabajo. Asimismo desea comprar algunos accesorios que necesita para mantener su moto en buenas condiciones y seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos y hacer algunos arreglos en su domicilio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Segundo is 33 years old and lives with his wife and three children who are his dependents. He lives in the Motupe District, a place that is known for its faith and enterprising people. It is located an hour and a half from Chiclayo, the capital of the department of Lambayeque. 
He raises deer, vacuña, milk cows and he also has a transportation service (a motortaxi). He has been doing this activity for the past five years, so he knows his business well. He has established customers from his area. Segundo would like to make some improvements to his motortaxi, which is the tool for his work. Also he would like to buy some tools that he will use to keep his motortaxi in good condition and thereby continue to offer good service to his customers. With the help of his loan, he will increase his earnings and make some improvements to his house. This is why he finds himself asking for this loan of 2,000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to maintain his mototaxi.

loans.name: Santos Emilio

texts.es:
Santos tiene 37 años de edad y es casado con 2 hijos. Vive en casa de familiares en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz en la provincia de Chiclayo, en el norte de Perú. Su comunidad es urbana y en vías de crecimiento. Cuenta con servicios básicos como agua potable y servicio de electricidad. 

Desde hace más de 5 años, Santos se dedica a la preparación de desayunos. Realiza esta actividad en venta ambulante en las calles cerca del Mercado Moshoqueque, un mercado grande y con mucho movimiento. Con su préstamo, Santos comprará otro puesto para así tener dos puntos de venta: uno administrado por él y el otro por su esposa. Esto ayudará a incrementar sus ventas y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 

También desea usar parte de su crédito para invertir en la educación de sus hijos y pagar sus gastos escolares ahora que la temporada escolar ha comenzado en Perú. Desea mejorar el nivel de educación que sus hijos reciben para que puedan obtener mejores oportunidades en el futuro. Para lograr sus metas, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Santos es un cliente recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado otros préstamos que lo ayudaron mejorar su nivel de vida y educar a sus hijos. Es muy responsable y canceló sus préstamos de manera puntual. Su mayor anhelo es seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para generar mayores ingresos y continuar a sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos, 37, is married and has two children.  He lives in relatives’ house in José Leonardo Ortiz District, Chiclayo Province, in northern Peru.  His community is urban and growing.  He has basic utilities like potable water and electricity.

Santos has been preparing breakfasts for over five years.  He does this activity in an itinerant manner along streets near the Moshoqueque Market, a large, very busy market.  Santos will use the loan to buy another stand so that he can have two sales points, one run by him and the other by his wife.  This will help increase sales and provide better customer service. He’d also like to use part of his loan to invest in his children’s education and pay school fees now that the school term has begun in Peru.  He wants to improve the level of education his children receive so that they will be able to obtain better future opportunities.

To reach his goal he’s thought it convenient to turn to Edpyme Alternativa to request a 2000 new sol loan.  Santos is a recurrent client of Edpyme Alternativa.  He has managed his other loans which helped him improve his standard of living and educate his children.   He is very responsible and repaid his loans punctually.  His greatest desire is to continue investing in his business to generate higher income and continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy another food vending stand and to pay for his children's school expenses.

loans.name: Morita

texts.en:
Morita is 50 years old and married with 8 children.  She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Morita is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell.

Morita has been raising livestock for 30 years and also earns additional income from food vending.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 40 years old and married.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Margie is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Margie has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 42 years old and married with 3 children.  With those 3 children in school, Amelita works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 49,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Amelita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, oil, vinegar and other groceries. 

In the future, Amelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en:
Nergui is 57 years old and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 
They live in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband helps in her business. She rents a container (a stall) at a wholesale center and conducts business selling flour and rice. Over the years she has gained a lot of experience. She was selling her goods wholesale to citizens and individuals on “Khar Khorin” market. Her daily earnings are 500,000 MNT. Nergui is very a hardworking and persistent person. 
Her future plan is to improve her family’s living condition by buying a family house. She is asking for a loan to increase her working capital by buying some flour and rice.

loans.use: to buy flour and rice to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dry goods business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her dry goods business.

Marissa has been in this business for 9 years. She earns more income from cosmetics sales.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 42 years old and has one child who is in school. She has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years.

Marietta requested a 14,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more products to sell in her general store.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in her general store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 51 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a cosmetics sales business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

Remedios requested a 23,500 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy cosmetics and beauty supplies to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and beauty supplies to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es: Yeny tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 8 años. Vive junto a su familia en casa de su madre en José Leonardo Ortiz, un distrito urbano, relativamente grande y pacífico en la provincia de Chiclayo, ubicado en el norte de Perú.  Gana la vida vendiendo ropa en el Mercado Carolina. Tiene más de 6 meses de experiencia con y maneja su negocio muy bien. Desea ampliar su negocio y surtir su puesto con ropa colegial. La demanda para estos productos ha aumentado ahora que la temporada escolar ha comenzado en Perú. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles. Con esta inversión, Yeny podrá aumentar sus ventas y generar mayores ingresos.  De esta manera, ella puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.
texts.en: Yeny is 30 years old, married and has an 8-year-old child. She lives with her family in her mother’s house in José Leonardo Ortiz, a somewhat large and peaceful urban area in the Chiclayo province in northern Perú. She makes a living selling clothes in the Carolina Market. She has been doing this business for more than six months and she runs her business well. She would like to grow her business by providing school clothing. The demand for this product is growing now as the school year is beginning in Perú. With this goal in mind, she is asking for a loan of 500 new soles. With this loan she will be able to increase her sales and earnings. Thereby she will be able to help her husband with the family’s expenses.

loans.use: to provide an assortment of school clothing for her booth.

loans.name: Jose Jacinto

texts.es:
José tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres en el caserío Chachupe Bajo afuera del distrito de La Victoria, a unos veinte minutos de Chiclayo, el capital de la región de Lambayeque. La zona en donde vive es rural y no cuenta con luz ni agua potable.

Gana la vida criando y vendiendo animales menores como patos, pavos, pollos y cabrero. Cuando sus animales ya han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso, los vende al público y a los comerciantes que suelen visitar la zona. Cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia en este rubro. Además José trabaja como ayudante de una fundición de ollas del cual recibe un sueldo semanalmente. José desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado. También desea arreglar sus corrales para mejor proteger sus animales de las lluvias y presentarles sus animales a sus clientes en una manera más profesional. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 700 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Jose, 19, is single and has no children.  He lives in his parents’ house in Chachupe Bajo settlement outside La Victoria District about 20 minutes from Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region’s capital; the area where he lives is rural and has neither electricity nor potable water.

He earns his living raising small farm animals, like ducks, turkeys, chickens and goats, to sell.  When his animals reach a good size and weight he sells them to the general public and to merchants that tend to visit his area.  He’s been in this line of work for over 3 years.  In addition, Jose works as an Assistant at a pot foundry earning a weekly salary.

Jose wants to repair his corrals to better protect his animals from the rain and to exhibit them to his customers in a more professional manner.  To do so, he’s thought it convenient to request a 700 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to repair his corrals and to buy more animals and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Vinh

texts.en:
Vinh T. T. N. is 30 years old, has 2 children, and lives in Dai Bi village. She manages a clothing store at Dong Anh market. All of the products in her shop are new designs imported from China at a good price, so they create a good profit for her.  The profit enables her to improve her family's life significantly.

The business has experienced strong development since Vinh T. T. N. first secured a loan from SEDA's (Small Enterprise Development Assistance) credit program in 2005. During her time in the program, she has been good with loan repayments. She is currently requesting a loan of 8,502,000 Vietnamese dongs (VND) to buy more clothes to sell this summer.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell this summer

loans.name: Amado

texts.es:
Amado tiene 30 años de edad. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y 3 menores hijos en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Vive en la  parte rural del distrito y no cuenta con servicios de agua y luz.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como ganado ovino y caprino. Tiene una experiencia de 5 años en esta actividad. Amado recorre anexos de su caserío comprando ganado para engordar. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo, los vende en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Acepta ventas al crédito y al contado. Su esposa también se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores como ovejos, cabros y chanchos. Amado desea utilizar su préstamo para ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado. Con esta inversión, podrá aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos. Su mayor anhelo es seguir generando buenos ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares y mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
Amado, 30, lives in his own house with his wife and three minor children in Olmos District, an agricultural zone with quite a bit of commercial activity that’s located in Lambayeque Province over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo; he lives in the rural part of the district and lacks both electricity and running water.

He raises small farm animals, like sheep and goats, to sell.  He’s been in this line of work for five years.  Amado visits hamlets adjacent to his settlement buying livestock to fatten up.  When they reach a good level of development he sells them in the city of Chiclayo.  He accepts both credit and cash.  His wife also raises small farm animals, like sheep, goats and pigs, to sell.

Amado wants to use his loan to expand the business buying more animals and nutritionally balanced feed.  With this investment he will be able to increase sales and income.  His greatest wish is to continue generating good income to cover family expenses and improve his wife’s and children’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 55 años de edad y es casada con 3 hijos adultos. Vive en casa  propia en la entrada al distrito de Monsefú, una zona conocida por sus festividades turísticas y religiosas. Las principales actividades que se realizan en este caserío son la producción de flores, la artesanía y la crianza de ganado vacuno. La zona está llena de vegetación y la comunidad es muy pequeña. La zona cuenta con servicios básicos de luz y agua. Tiene un alcantarillado en proyecto.

Desde hace más de 8 años, Mercedes cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su negocio. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece y a la buena atención que brinda. Su bodega cuenta con clientela ya establecida siendo una de las pocas de la zona. Adicionalmente, se dedica a la  confección y venta de artesanía en variedad, por lo que es bastante conocida en el sector. Desea invertir su crédito en su bodega con la compra de útiles escolares, lo que la permitirá responder a la demanda para estos productos ahora que la temporada escolar ha comenzado en Perú. Mercedes es muy trabajadora. Cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 55, is married and has three adult children.  She lives in her own house at the entrance to Monsefú District, an area known for its tourist and religious festivities.  The main activities that take place in this settlement are:  flower growing, crafts and cattle raising.  The area is rich in vegetation and the community is very small.  The area has basic utilities like electricity and running water and has a drainage system in the planning stages.

For over 8 years Mercedes has had a small grocery store.  She sells her customers and neighbors various daily use products of first need and groceries.  The business is well received due to the good quality of the products she stocks and the good customer service she provides.  Her store has a well established customer base since it’s one of the few in the area.  In addition, she also makes various crafts to sell so she is quite well known in the area.

She wants to use the loan to buy school supplies to stock in her store which will allow her to respond to demand because the new school term has begun in Peru. 

Mercedes is very hard working.  She has good personal and work-related references.  People who know her hold her in high esteem and affection.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Gnim

texts.en:
Gnim H. has been in the farming business in the province of Kampong Cham for a long time. She has always cultivated rice on farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She has a life partner in her husband, who is a recycling buyer.  He buys all kinds of old things in and around his village and sells them to wholesalers.

Gnim H. and her husband have three unmarried children, all of whom still live with them. Gnim H. and her family face a problem in their living conditions, so she is now in the process of building a new house, but her cash reserves are insufficient. To solve this problem, Gnim H. is asking for a Kiva loan to help build her house.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van T. T. L. is 30 years old. She lives with her family in Dai Bi village, where business activity is well developed. Seeing that a breakfast service would be successful, Ms. Van decided to open a small restaurant in which she serves fast food such as noodles, bread, and a few kinds of cake. Her restaurant attracts the most residents in the village and provides her with a profit of 120,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). The income helps her pay for her family's daily spending.

Ms Van became a client of SEDA (Small Enterprise Development Assistance) in 2004 and has used loans effectively in expanding her business. She is requesting a new loan of 9,810,000 Vietnamese dongs (VND) in this loan cycL. to buy more sets of tables and chairs to create more seating for customers.

loans.use: to buy more tables and chairs for restaurant

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is from the village of Labo, Aloran, in the province of Misamis Occidental. She is a 35-year-old widow with four very young children and one school-aged child. To make a living, Mary Ann runs a business venture in the services sector specializing in auto repair in the local community.

Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for more than 1 year and earns approximately 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from the business. She joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC.

Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase spare parts for her auto repair business. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for its field partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for an auto repair business

loans.name: Milagros Del  Pilar

texts.es:
Milagros tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos dependientes. Vive junto a su familia en casa propia en la parte rural del caserío Pueblo Nuevo en el distrito de Mochumi, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Gana la vida criando ganado ovino, patos y cerdos en corrales ubicados en un pequeño terreno cerca de su casa. Ella compra los animales menores de sus vecinos, los engorda y los vende en el mercado del Distrito de Mochumi. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales menores y alimento balanceado. También pretende aumentar y arreglar sus corrales para mejor proteger sus animales de las lluvias. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Milagros, 28, is married and has two dependent children.  She lives with her family in her own house in the rural part of Pueblo Nuevo settlement in Mochumi District, an agricultural zone with quite a bit of commercial activity located over half an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

She earns her livelihood raising sheep, ducks and pigs in corrals located in a small plot of land near her house.  She buys the animals from her neighbors, fattens them up and then sells them in the Mochumi District market.  

She wants to enlarge her business buying additional small farm animals and nutritionally balanced feed.  She also intends to expand and repair her corrals to better protect her animals from the rain.  Because of this she’s thought it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: to repair her corrals and to buy more animals and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai T. N. is 35 years old. She lives with her family in Dai Bi commune. She is a tailor who focuses on making traditional dress. There are a lot of different designs in her shop, so she is always busy with customers' orders. She earns 4,500,000 Vietnamese dongs (VND) per month, which improves her family’s living conditions greatly. 

Since joining SEDA (Small Enterprise Development Assistance) in 2004, Mai T. N. has invested effectively in her shop. She is requesting a loan of 9,810,000 VND in this loan cycle to buy more cloth.

loans.use: to buy more cloth

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buying and selling of bamboo business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now, and also earns additional income from her sari-sari store. 

Myrna requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy bamboo to sell. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase some bamboo to resell

loans.name: Baigal

texts.en: Baigal is 25 years old. She lives with her husband and a son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her son Zayategsh, 5, attends a local kindergarten, and her husband Demberelsuren 25, helps her business every day. She is running a business selling pants from a rented container stall at the Khar Khorin market, the most crowded market in the city. Normally she buys her product from Ereen, the border city of China. Baigal is a very hardworking person who has good communication skills. Next year, Baigal is planning to build a small house on her land. Also she wants to buy the container that she rents. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to increase her working capital by buying more products.

loans.use: to increase her working capital by buying more pants from China

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo tiene 64 años de edad. Vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en casa propia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Por la mayoría de su vida, trabajó para la marina de Perú. En su jubilación, Ricardo comenzó un negocio alquilando cuartos en las casas de las cuales el es dueño. Alquila a los estudiantes, los viajantes y los empresarios que pasan por su comunidad por un breve período de tiempo. Desea hacer unos arreglos en algunos de sus cuatros para poder brindar un mejor servicio a los pensionistas. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar 500 nuevos soles. Con los ingresos de su negocio, puede continuar a sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Ricardo, 64, lives with his wife and children in his own house in Olmos District, an agricultural zone with quite a bit of commercial activity located in Lambayeque Province over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

For most of his life he worked for Peru’s Navy.  Once retired, Ricardo started a business renting out rooms in houses he owns.  He rents to students, travelers and businessmen who pass through his community for short periods of time.

He’d like to do some repairs to some of his rooms to provide better service to his tenants.  Because of this he thought it convenient to request a 500 new sol loan.  He can continue to support his family with income from his business.

loans.use: to repair his rental units.

loans.name: Serena

texts.en:
Serena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years. She earns more income from raising pigs. Serena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store business. She hopes to send her children to college and to renovate her house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Huong T. T. is 32 years old with one child. She is living with her family in Hoi phu village.  She was a tailor for a big fashion-design shop in Dong anh town for five years. In 2006, she opened her own shop. Because of her creativeness in working, she makes new designs that suit young styles. Therefore, her shop is always busy with orders from customers. 

She can make 4,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) per month. It helps her a lot in managing family life. With the hope to have more money to buy clothes to meet the demand of customers, she wants to have a loan of 5,014,000 VND.
 
Nguyet T. C. is 45 years old with two children who are at secondary school. Her main activity to earn money is making brooms to sell. She wants to have a loan of 5,014,000 to buy bamboo as material.
 
Hoa T. N. is 40 years old with two children. She is a farmer and in her free time, she makes brooms to sell to get more income. She needs to borrow  5,014,000 VND to buy material.

Ha T. N. is 37 years old with one child. She has a small restaurant to serve breakfast right in her flat. She needs to have a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy a fridge.

Yen T. V. is  42 years old with two children. She is growing rice, and raising pigs for meat. She wants to borrow money to buy food for the pigs.

loans.use: to buy clothes to meet the demand of customers

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 2 menores hijos. Vive en casa propia en el caserío Laguna Larga, en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Vive en la  parte rural del distrito y no cuenta con servicios de agua y luz.

Maruja cuenta con una pequeña bodega ubicada en su domicilio desde hace 3 años. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Realiza ventas al crédito y al contado. Compra su mercadería en la ciudad de Olmos para luego llevarla a su caserío. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles. Con los ingresos de su bodega, Maruja puede ayudar a su esposo, quien se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, en el sostenimiento económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Maruja, 38, is married and has two minor children.  She lives in her own house located in Laguna Larga, Olmos District, an agricultural zone with quite a bit of commercial activity located in Lambayeque Province over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.  She lives in the rural part of the district and does not have running water or electricity.

Maruja has had a small, home-based grocery store for three years.  She sells basic need items of daily use and groceries to her neighbors and customers.  She sells both for cash and on credit.  She buys her merchandise in the city of Olmos and takes it to her hamlet.

She wants to expand her business buying more merchandise.  To do so, she’s thought it advisable to request a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  With income from her store, Maruja is able to help her husband, who raises small farm animals, to support the family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Tep N. now resides in Siem Reap province. He is a 27-year-old single man who earns a daily income as a repairer of the machine that is used to link boats for local fishermen, and he also sells and rents the boat machine for additional profit. He currently lives with his father who has the same occupation. 

Tep N. is going to use his loan funds as capital in order to buy more additional machinery tools for resale.

loans.use: To buy additional machinery tools for resale

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is married with two children. He is a very hardworking entrepreneur. He is 42 years old and has one child who is in school. He has a fruits and vegetables vending business in the Philippines and has been 25 years in this business.

Rolando requested a 29,500 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in his food stall. In the future, he would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for his family.

*This picture of Rolando and his wife was taken during tabu (or market) day.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in his food stall

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marceliana is 57 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and has been doing so for 15 years. She earns additional income from her sari-sari store.

Marceliana is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Oanh Thi Kim Hoang's Group

texts.en:
Oanh T. K. H. is 22 years old, has 1 child, and lives in Hoi Phu village. Having been a farmer for two years, she saw that the income from agriculture was not sufficient to cover her family's expenses. Therefore, she opened a small shop that sells ready-made shirts and trousers. Her business generates a profit of 100,000 Vietnamese dongs (VND) per day, helping to improve her family's standard of living. As a client of the SEDA (Small Enterprise Development Assistance) credit program, she is requesting a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy new designs to attract more customers.

Thuong T. H. is 45 years old and has 2 children. She is making brooms to sell wholesale. She needs 6,322,000 VND to buy broom-making materials.

Dung T. N. is 49 years old and has 2 children. She is raising 50 chickens for meat. She needs 2,398,000 VND to buy food for them.

Anh T. N. is 30 years old and has 1 child. She is making brooms to sell in the local market. She needs 5,014,000 VND to buy broom-making materials.

Luong T. V. is 29 years old and has 1 child. She is growing vegetables to sell to small restaurants. She is requesting a loan of 5,104,000 VND to buy fertilizer.

Huong T. D. is 37 years old and has 2 children. She is making brooms to sell wholesale to some merchants. She needs a loan of 5,104,000 VND to buy broom-making materials.

loans.use: to buy new designs to attract more customers

loans.name: Elver

texts.es:
Elver tiene 29 años de edad. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 menores hijos en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Vive en la  parte rural del distrito y no cuenta con servicios de agua y luz.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercio de animales menores como ovejas chivos, chanchos y aves de corral. Realiza esta actividad en el terreno cerca de su casa. Compra los animales en los alrededores de su comunidad para luego engordarlos y venderlos en la ciudad de Olmos o enviarlos a la ciudad de Chiclayo. Cuenta con una experiencia de 4 años en este rubro. Su esposa lo apoya en esta actividad. Desea invertir su préstamo en la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado. Con esta inversión, podrá aumentar sus ventas e ingresos para seguir cuidando a su familia y brindándoles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elver, 29, lives in his own house with his wife and two minor children in Olmos District, an agricultural zone with quite a bit of commercial activity located in Lambayeque Province over and hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.  He lives in the rural part of the district and does not have running water or electricity.

He raises small farm animals, like sheep, goats, pigs and barnyard fowl, to sell.  He does this on a piece of property near his house.  He buys the animals in communities adjacent to his community to fatten them up and later sell them in the city of Olmos or send them to the city of Chiclayo.  He’s been in this line of work for 4 years.  His wife helps him.

He wants to invest the loan in the purchase of more animals and nutritionally balanced feed.  With this investment he will be able to increase sales and income to continue caring for his family and providing them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente tiene 52  años de edad, es casado y tiene 1  hijo aun dependiente. Vive en casa propia en la zona rural del distrito de Morrope, un distrito poblado por gente humilde y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura. Se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Su comunidad es pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias. Cuenta con servicios de  luz y agua. 

Desde hace más de 20 años, gana la vida criando y comercializando animales menores. El los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. Realiza esta actividad en el terreno cerca de su domicilio. Aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.  Adicionalmente, cuenta con ingresos adicionales brindando servicios de transporte de pasajeros en una mototaxi que es su propia. Actualmente, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Por ello, desea invertir su crédito en el arreglo en el interior de su domicilio.  Con esta inversión, podrá hacer arreglos a su casa lo que mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles. Vicente ha manejado préstamos de Edpyme Alternativa y tiene un buen record de pagos.
texts.en:
Vicente, 52, is married and has one dependent child.  He lives in his own house in the rural part of Morrope District, a district populated by humble, hard working people dedicated to farming.  It’s located in Lambayeque Province over forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  His community is small; it has approximately 100 families.  It has both electricity and running water.

For over 20 years he has earned his living raising small farm animals to sell.  He feeds them grains and natural grasses and when they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants that visit his area frequently.  He carries out these activities on a piece of property near his house.  He learned this line of work from his parents which is to say, he knows it to perfection. In addition, he earns extra income providing public transportation services with a mototaxi that he owns. 

His house is currently in a deteriorated state.  Because of this he wants to use the loan to do some interior repairs.  With this investment he will be able to do some home repairs that will improve his family’s quality of life.  He has, therefore, thought it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan.  Vicente has had previous loans with Edpyme Alternativa and he has established a good repayment record.

loans.use: to do some home repairs.

loans.name: Duong

texts.en: Duong V. has been a high-skill construction foreman for over five years and lives with other family members in a small house located in the rural area of Siem Reap, a province of Cambodia. His wife sells a few types of dessert from home to earn an income. They have six children, four of whom are married.  Two of their children own a boat that they use to provide a taxi service along the river to help support the family. Duong V. will use his loan to buy wooden poles for building a house.

loans.use: to buy wooden poles for building a house.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 37 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en la parte rural del distrito de Pacanga en Chepen, una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el norte de Perú. Desde hace 5 años, se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno lechero. Realiza esta actividad en un terreno cerca de su casa. Actualmente cuenta con 4 cabezas de ganado. Desea usar su préstamo para la compra de más alimento balanceado para sus animales. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para solventar sus gastos y ayudar al sostenimiento económico de su familia. Es un padre bastante entregado a su familia y siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Juan ha manejado otros préstamos de Edpyme Alternativa y los canceló de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Juan is 37 years old, is married, and has three children. He lives in a rural part of the Pacanga district, in Chepen, one hour from the city of Chiclayo in the north of Peru. 

For five years he has worked raising and selling dairy cattle. He undertakes this activity on land near his house. Currently he works with four head of cattle. He wants to use his loan to buy more balanced food for his animals. For this he has decided to request a loan of 1000 new soles. The income he expects from this work will serve to meet his expenses and help with the economic maintenance of his family. 

He is father who is very dedicated to his family and is always concerned with their well being and development. Juan has managed other loans from Edpyme Alternativa and has repaid them in a punctual manner.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy tiene 28 años de edad. Vive con su esposa e hijo menor en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Gana la vida criando ganado ovino y caprino en los terrenos cerca de su domicilio. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 05 años, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuando su ganado ya ha alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso, lo vende a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Cuentan con clientela ya establecida. Desea usar su crédito para ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado. Con esta inversión, podrá generar más ingresos para usar en el sostenimiento económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Fredy is 28 years old and lives with his wife and young son in the Olmos district, an agricultural zone with lots of commercial activity, located in the Lambayeque province, more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.  He earns his living raising sheep and goats on land near his home.  He's been doing this for five years and he knows the business.  When his livestock reaches a good size and weight, he sells it to merchants who visit the zone and he has steady customers.

He wants to use the money from this zone to buy more animals and balanced feed.  This investment will allow him to increase his income to better support his family.

loans.use: to buy livestock and feed

loans.name: Basheeran's Group

texts.en:
Basheeran belongs to a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, called Borewala, which is known for its shrines. She has a son who is a driver by profession and provides loading services to his clients. He owns a truck that he uses to deliver different items such as construction supplies, fruits and vegetables, etc., to the designated places.
  
She herself is an embroidery expert and does embroidery for her nearby clients. She receives regular orders every month due to her good quality work. 

Her husband is a daily wage laborer. His income is not guaranteed every day because he doesn’t get work regularly.
 
Basheeran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son because he wants to repair his truck. After repairing it, he will be able to do his job better and increase his profits.
 
Basheeran is hopeful that an investment will help her son make his business better and provide better loading services to his clients.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: to repair her son's truck

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees lives in Borewala, which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its shrines. She has been living there with her family in a two-room brick house for the past 30 years. She is the mother of five daughters, but none of them is able to attend school due to financial constraints. 
 
She is a talented lady who operates a clothes sewing business at her home for her neighboring clients to earn income for her family. She is an expert in her work and receives regular orders every month. She also performs her duties as a housewife very well.
  
Her husband’s name is M. A., and he operates a wheat and rice selling business. He operates his shop in the market and buys wheat and rice from farmers and sells at a profit.
 
Bilqees has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband in his business. He will use the loan money to buy wheat and rice in bulk quantity to fulfill larger orders on time and to make more profits.
 
He has been doing this business for some time now, and Bilqees is confident that the business will improve after the loan investment. 

Bilqees is hopeful that if her husband's business improves, she will be able to send her younger children to school.

loans.use: to buy wheat and rice for selling

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
T. T. P. is 30 years old with two children who are at  high school and secondary school. 

She has run a tailoring shop for four years and it strongL. developed when she was abL. to invest in one more sewing machine in 2010. CurrentL., she can make 3,500,000 VND profit per month. 

Joining with  our program in 2009, she has been a good group leader. For this new cycL. loan, she wants to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy clothes to sew.

Hang T. N. is 47 years old with two children. She  is running a small grocery shop right in her house. She needs to have 7,194,000 VND to buy more products to sell. 

Ngan T. P. is 31 years old with two children. She is running a shop that sells soup for babies. She wants to have 654,000 VND to buy ingredients.

Lam T. L. is 47 years old. Being a farmer, she breeds three cows for milk. She needs to have a loan of 6,322,000 to improve the house for them.

La T. L. is 43 years old. She is raising seven pigs for meat. She wants to have a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy food for them.

He T. N. is 45 years old. She has a small shop that sells fresh vegetables in the local market. She needs to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND to invest in this shop.

Duong T. T.  D. is 42 years old with two children. She is raising 200 chickens for eggs. She needs to have a loan to buy food for them.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Chonn

texts.en:
Chonn P. is a 28-year-old fish vendor who lives with her parents in the Siem Reap province. 

Every day in early morning, Chonn P. always goes to buy fish from the fishermen and then hurries to bring her fish by motorbike to the market for resale. 

Chonn P. is working hard at her business. She has a lot of regular customers who buy and eat her fish. She hopes to be able to find extra income by using a Kiva loan to purchase a larger quantity of fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of fish to sell

loans.name: Nhan's Group

texts.en:
Nhan T. N. is 50 years old and has two children who are married. 

She is managing a small grocery shop at her house. She sells many kinds of products such as wine, rice and beer. Her business has developed well since she got a loan from our credit program in 2005. Everyday she gets 100,000 VND profit from this shop and it helps her cover her family's expenses. 

Besides, she also is growing flowers and raising four pigs for meat.  

Currently, she wants to have a loan of 4,142,000 VND to buy fertilizer for the flowers and food  for the pigs.

Lai T. N. is 36 years old with two children. She is a builder. After 6 years of  working very hard, she can rebuild her own house. Now, she needs to have a loan of 8,066,000 to buy some construction supplies.

Hong T. N. is 34 years old with two children. She is a tailor and has been managing a shop that makes dresses for three years. She needs to have a loan of 8,502,000 VND.
