Ha T. D. is 40 years old. She is raising a cow and 200 chickens for eggs. She needs to have a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy food for them.

loans.use: to  buy  fertilizer for her flower crop and food  for her pigs

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran belongs to a city of Punjab, Pakistan, called Borewala, which is famous for its shrines. Manzooran has been living there with her family for the past 10 years. 

She supports her family by doing sewing work. She has obtained good recognition in her community for her good quality work and receives regular orders every month.
 
She has applied for a loan to financially assist her husband in buying construction supplies for his construction supply business. An improved business condition will help him fulfill the orders on time and make more profits.
 
He has been operating this business for the past three years and Manzooran is hopeful that an investment will be a profitable one for him and will bring positive changes to her family life.
 
She is the mother of four sons. Two of them are involved in the construction supplies business while the others stay at home. Manzooran couldn’t provide them education due to poor financial conditions. 

This is the second time Manzooran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. She is hopeful that through the loan assistance, her family will be able to enjoy better facilities of life and she will be able to repay the loan without any problem.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for construction supplies selling business

loans.name: Erkinbek

texts.en:
Erkinbek S. is 48, married and has five children. He has been engaged in cattle breeding since 1985 and has managed to develop a farm with calves and milk cows. Also, he cultivates land with perennial herbs, clover and barley which serve as forage for his cattle. He sells part of the harvest to local customers.  

Erkinbek has applied for a loan of 65,000 KGS to purchase three bull calves, which will allow him to broaden his business. With the revenues, he plans to reconstruct his barn in order to provide good conditions for breeding animals. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase three bull calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay rent for kiosk and purchase 70 jackets and 50 bathrobes

loans.name: Vinh's Group

texts.en:
Vinh T. D. is 50 years old with five children. Three of them are married and she is providing education for the other two. She has done farming since her children were young and mostly focused on growing rice and vegetables and raising chickens for meat. Some of these agricultural products are used to support her family and the rest are sold to get money for other spending. 

Since becoming a client of our credit program in 2007, she has used loans effectively in expanding her farming. Because of this, her loan size is higher year after year. Now, she needs to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy fertilizer for the next crop.

Anh T. D. is 35 years old. She sells flowers in the local market. She needs to have 4,142,000 VND to buy more kinds of flowers to meet  her customers' demand.
  
Hang T. H. is 30 years old. She is raising 10 pigs for meat. She needs to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND to improve a house for them.
 
Lan T. H. is 35 years old. She is raising 200 chickens for meat. She needs to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy food for them.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizer for the next crop

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma belongs to Borewala. which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in a two-room house for the past 20 years.

Najma is a seamstress and sews clothes for her nearby clients to earn an income for her family. She also performs her duties as a housewife very well and makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

She has given birth to a son and two daughters. She is unable to provide education to her children due to poor financial conditions.
  
Her husband’s name is T. and he sells herbal medicines. He has a good knowledge of herbal products and experience to diagnose diseases and to cure of his patients very well.
 
Najma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who will buy herbs to make herbal medicines in bulk for selling through his shop. 

Najma is hopeful that with the growth of her husband’s business, her family’s living standard will improve. He has been operating this business for past 10 years.

loans.use: To buy herbs for herbal medicines business

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz lives in Mian Channu, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in a single-room brick house for the past nine years.

She is the mother of six children. Only two of them are able to attend school and get their education. Shahnaz is an embroidery expert and earns a reasonable amount of income every month from her community clients.  
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business of agriculture. He started this business six years ago. He grows different seasonal crops such as wheat and cotton.  

Through the loan, he will buy supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for getting maximum output from his work and to earn better profits. 

Shahnaz is very hopeful about the future growth of her husband’s business and about the better financial future of her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, from the village of Dullan, Aloran, is 53 years old, married, and has three grown children. To make a living, Josephine runs a business venture selling dried fish in the local community. Engaged in her business for 20 years, she earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC, she is requesting her sixth loan of 50000 PHP with which to purchase dried fish to sell. Josephine plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Cheryl Marie

texts.en:
Cheryl Marie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a Videoke Bar business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from pig fattening. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to stock drinks and other supplies for her Videoke Bar/videoke rental business. She dreams of expanding the business for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy a supply of beverages for her videoke business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley works hard to support her four children. She is married and has a frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Shirley requested a 3,800 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.  She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have an emergency light source that is waterproof in case of heavy rains and floods. She is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Luzvisminda

texts.en:
Luzvisminda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 3,800 PHP through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a safe light source at night and also be able to charge the cellphone that she uses. Luzvisminda is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a Solar Lamp

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos N. S., a 29-year-old farmer for the past nine years, is the father of three children and is married to Rose. His monthly income is Ksh.8,000.

Amos learned about KADET LTD through an advertisement and is applying for his first loan of KES.40,000 to buy farm supplies. He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to reinvest into his farming activities. Amos is an honest man who is working hard to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Urfa's Group

texts.en:
For the past 13 years, Urfa has resided in a single-room brick house with her family in Mian Channu, a small city in Punjab Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. A 38-year-old housewife, Urfa stays at home and discharges her household responsibilities. She is the mother of two children, both enrolled in a local school.

Urfa is married to Y. M., who rents out bicycles on an hourly basis, a business he has operated for the past six years. He also offers clients bicycle-repair services to earn extra income. Hopeful that an investment will bring better profits to her husband's business, Urfa has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to enable him to buy more bicycles to rent out.

This will be Urfa's second loan from Asasah. She established a good credit record in the previous loan year and attended all meetings.

loans.use: to buy bicycles to rent out

loans.name: Javzmaa

texts.en:
Javzmaa is a 33-year-old woman who lives with her daughter and younger brother in their own house in Songino-hairhan district, Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Her younger brother is a welder in a private company and her only daughter, who is age 10, attends secondary school. 

She manages a grocery shop near to her home. She started her business in 2007. With four years in business, she has gained much experience and wants to expand her business in the future. She is an honest woman who says, "By depositing my earnings, I want to pay the college tuition fees for my daughter." 

She is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 MNT to purchase meat and meat products in order to sell them in the coming spring period when meat sales are higher compared with other seasons.

loans.use: to purchase meat and meat products

loans.name: Munhtsog

texts.en:
Munhtsog, 38, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent. Her two children both attend local secondary school. 

She operates a good trading business with the help of her husband. She started her business in 2007 out of a stall in a local market. Since then she managed to expand her business and built a good relationship both with her partners and with her customers. Now her working capital exceeds 600,000 MNT. 

She is a hardworking lady who possesses good communication skills. She says, "All I want is bright future for my children. For that reason, I am doing my best in order to provide good education for my children." She is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase socks, lingerie and kid toys for her business.

loans.use: to purchase socks, lingerie and kid toys

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in Mian Channu, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a single-room brick house with her family for past 12 years. She is 36 years old, married to S. M. and has four children. 

Razia couldn’t educate her children due to poor financial conditions. Her eldest son works in a motor workshop while the second one is a tailor master. Her remaining two children stay at home. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who is professionally a painter and paints on walls and houses. With the loan, he will buy paint boxes of different colors and paint brushes that will help him do his work better and earn better profits.  

Razia is hopeful that the investment will be productive for her husband and make him more profitable in the future. He has been operating his business for the past six years.

loans.use: to buy paint boxes and brushes for painting business

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem S. is 41 years old and has been selling a few fresh fish and vegetables in the Phsar Leur market for more than four years. She sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing or buys them from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen. She is married to Duch Saroun, 43, who works at fishing in and around the lakes of his community. 

Currently, this family's life has been disrupted because their house is broken. Because of this reason, Sem S. has requested a loan in order to buy planks and zinc to cover the roof of her house.

loans.use: to buy planks and zinc to cover the roof of her house

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Elsie works hard to support her family. She has a native delicacies business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF.

Elsie is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her native delicacies business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food products business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia, a 62-year-old widowed mother of nine children, works hard to provide for her family. For 20 years she has run a general store in the Philippines, and also earns an income from used clothing sales.

Having received and repaid 18 loans from NWTF, Lilia is now requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to buy more stocks to sell in her general store. She aspires to be able to complete the education of her youngest child.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie A., 40, is married with one child who is in school. She is a very  hard working entrepreneur. 

Elvie has a business of buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Elvie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall.

Elvie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Elvie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Tsogtbaatar

texts.en:
Tsogtbaatar, 45, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own. They have an average standard of living. His wife is self-employed and his two children attend local secondary school.

He used to work as a driver for a company between 1996 and 2004. Then he started operating his own business. He rents a stall at a local market and operates it as a clothing making and repairing service. He wants to have his own workshop in the future. 

He is a hardworking and honest person who says, "I am planning to carry on this business and save money for my children's college studies." He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase textiles and materials for his business.

loans.use: to purchase textiles and materials

loans.name: Ulziisaihan

texts.en:
Ulziisaihan is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a house in the Narantuul area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. She manages a saddle-making business with the help of her husband, and both enjoy very good reputations amongst their customers for their skills. She started the business in 1997.

Ulziisaihan, who travels in the countryside to purchase raw materials for her saddle-making business, attributes her success to her accounting skills and is planning a future expansion of the enterprise. Now requesting a loan of 2,200,000 MNT to purchase more materials used in making horse saddles, Ulziisaihan says, "I want to fix my house with the business earnings."

loans.use: to purchase materials to make horse saddles

loans.name: Razia Nadeem Masih's Group

texts.en:
Razia is 23 years old and married to N. M.. The couple has two daughters. Razia lives in Mian channu, a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, that is known for its agriculture industry. For the past twelve years, she has been living in a two-room brick house with her family. Both of her daughters are enrolled in a local school to get an education.

Razia is a housewife who fulfills her responsibilities and takes care of her family. Razia’s husband is a street hawker who sells items such as toffees and candies from a cart. Most of his clients are children and he visits different areas of the city to sell his goods. Razia is applying for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah so that her husband can buy a new cart, as his current cart is worn and needs to be replaced.

Razia is hopeful that this investment will be productive for her husband and will help him to do his work better.

loans.use: to buy a new cart

loans.name: Hajra Nazir Ahmed's Group

texts.en:
Hajra is 45 years old. She is married to N. A. and they have three sons and four daughters. Hajra lives in Kasur, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, that is famous for its leather industry. She lives with her family in a small two-room home in the neighborhood of Jamatpura. Hajra’s husband has a business selling construction supplies to companies and to individuals. His customers come buy supplies from him and this generates income for the family. Hajra shares the financial burden with her husband by selling shawls. She receives orders from neighborhood clients and provides her customers with shawls of different qualities. Hajra purchases her shawls from Lahore where she visits once a month. 

Hajra’s eldest son makes leather shoes and her two elder daughters help their mother operate her shawl-selling business. Her other children are enrolled in a local school. Hajra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her son’s business. With the loan, her son will buy leather, nails and shoe polish in greater quantities to make higher quality shoes to sell. Hajra is very confident that her son’s five years of business experience will help him earn better profits with her loan investment.

Hajra is a new loan applicant and hopes that this experience will be profitable for her. She hopes to save the profits from her loan to provide for her daughter’s marriage in the near future.

loans.use: to buy materials for shoe-making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 30 years old and married. He lives with his wife and two kids in Bint Jbeil. Ali owns two businesses to provide for his family. He owns a generator which he uses to supply the people in his village with electricity when there is no government-supplied electricity which is a major problem in Lebanon. Ali also owns a barber shop. 

Ali has 16 years of experience in both business ventures. He is well-known in the region and loved by his friends and neighbors. Ali is requesting his third loan from Al Majmoua to buy a car (Renault Rapid) that is necessary for his business. He will use his car to transport cables and generator parts to maintain his generator. He may also use his car to transport products for his barber shop such as shampoo, hair gel, or chairs. 

Ali’s previous loans have helped to improve his family’s situation and he hopes to provide his kids with the best education ever.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S. lives with her husband and three children in the province of Kompong Chhnang. Her children do not yet study in the local school. Since 2000, Sok has been selling different types of pots in her province and she earns a daily income of 2 USD. Her husband is a farmer who helps provide for the family and Sok also helps her husband with their farm.

Sok is requesting a loan to buy a cow to help her farming business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Hajra Muhammad Ahmad's Group

texts.en:
Hajra is married and the mother of seven children. She lives in Chichawatni, a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, that is known for its agriculture industry. For the past 20 years, Hajra has lived in the Al-Fateh neighborhood in a three-room brick house with her family. Hajra is a seamstress who sews clothes for neighborhood clients to share the financial burden with her husband. She is very experienced in her work and is able to make beautiful clothes that satisfy her clients. Hajra’s eldest son works at a grocery store for a low income while another son is a shoe-polisher. Her other children stay at home as Hajra is not financially able to provide for their education.

Hajra’s husband operates a clothes-selling business. He purchases clothing from Multan, which is famous for its clothes and embroidery industry, and sells his inventory to local clients and shopkeepers for a profit. Hajra is applying for her second loan from the Kiva partner Asasah so that her husband can expand his business. He will buy bulk clothing of different varieties to improve his inventory and reduce his travel costs. 

Hajra is a responsible Asasah client who has repaid her previous loans efficiently. In this photo, Hajra is shown holding her Asasah Passbook.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en:
In the rural areas of Kompong Chhnang province, fishing is the most popular career. Roeun R. and his wife have spent most of their lives catching fresh fish in local lakes and rivers using a variety of fishing equipment. This work generates an average daily income of 3.75 USD that the couple uses to support the whole family.

Roeum is requesting a loan to buy fish traps and purchase a used motorbike to transport his catch to the local market as his current motorcycle is broken.

loans.use: to purchase fish traps and a motorcyle for transport

loans.name: Davaasambuu

texts.en:
Davaasambuu is 49 years old and the father of three children. He lives with his two daughters and wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia.  They live together in a small house on their land. Davaasambuu’s oldest son lives separately from the family and the youngest two daughters attend a university.  

For many years, Davaasambuu worked at a contract company as a sanitation truck driver. However, since 2001, he has been running a furniture-making business. His wife works with him.  They refurbish old wooden furniture and sell it at Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. Over the years, Davaasambuu has gained a great deal of experience and has been able to purchase a house, land, and a small family car. 

Davaasambuu is requesting a loan to purchase a 40-ton container to keep his furniture protected from rain and dust. This will be his third loan though Credit Mongol and he is one of their most reliable customers.  Davaasambuu is a very hardworking person with a strong will. He is planning to build a wooden house for his daughters.

loans.use: to purchase a storage container

loans.name: Vestiline Group

texts.en:
Kenedy G. is single and in his early thirties. For the past year, he has run a general store. Every day, he works from 7:30 in the morning to 9:00 at night and is able to make a small monthly profit. Kenedy is a member of the group “Vestiline,” which is comprised of 15 members. The group members hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In this picture, Kenedy is in the front row wearing a yellow and black t-shirt.

This will be Kenedy’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He successfully repaid his first loan which he used to increase his shop’s inventory. Kenedy is requesting a loan to buy a second-hand refrigerator. His dream is to have a big store one day, earn enough money, and get married.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand refrigerator

loans.name: Musu's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the teachers of the MCA Primary School in Portee, Freetown. This group of teachers has come to SMT/Kiva lenders for a loan of 5,000,000 SLL to solve their financial problems or invest in a business. At the end of each month, the school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting member repayments and paying SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf. 

Musu J. is the leader of this teacher’s group. She is 36 years old and married with three children. Musu was born in northern Sierra Leone and has been a teacher for more than five years. To supplement her meager monthly salary, Musu is runs a small business. She has applied for this loan to buy wholesale gara lappers (locally dyed cloths) to resell.

loans.use: to buy locally dyed cloth to resell

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: From the province of Kampong Chhnang, Chum B., 45, earns a living by making bricks in a local kiln. Her husband also works in the same job as her. On average, the couple can make a daily profit of around $7.50 to cover the family’s needs. They are blessed with four single children, two of whom are working different jobs and always contribute their salary with them. She would like to apply for a loan in order to purchase a machine for providing electricity to her house.

loans.use: to purchase a machine for providing electricity to her house

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 45-year-old married man, living in Tyre with his wife and four kids. Mouhamad works in whole sale trade. He has been selling candies, biscuits and chocolate for 15 years. He works out of his small van, which he uses to travel among villages in order to promote and sell his goods. 

Mouhamad is an Al Majmoua borrower for the third time and all of his previous loans were used to increase his business capital. This time Mouhamad states that he's happy and satisfied with his present capital, but would like to exchange his van for a bigger one that can fit all his goods. He is intending to sell his present van and add to its price the requested loan amount to pay for the new one he chose. 

Mouhamad is a person who's always grateful for what he gets and who, at the same time, works hard on improving himself. He hopes to expand his business through reaching more targeted clients.

loans.use: To buy  a new van to expand his business.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok V., 41, is married to Sokea, 42, who is a housewife. Sok V. is good at making bamboo baskets to sell at the market place in Kompong Chhnang province. He takes walks sometimes through the village seeking bamboo and takes it home and then puts it into water for almost a week. After that he dries it in the sunshine for three days. Sok V. splits the bamboo into smaller pieces and after that, he starts making it into baskets. 

Sok V. would like to take his loan to buy wooden stairs to replace the broken staircase in his house. He dreams of having a degree for his children.

loans.use: To buy wooden stairs to replace the broken staircase in his house.

loans.name: Sallay A.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you teachers of the Baptist Primary School in Magburaka, a town in  northern Sierra Leone. Baptist Primary School was founded in 1974 by the Nigerian Baptist Conference (NBC) to promote the religion and improve education in the community. Currently, the school is staffed with 21 teachers and has an enrollment of 625 pupils. 

Sallay A. B. is a teacher at the school and leader of this group of borrowers. The 52-year-old Sallay was born in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. She has been in the teaching profession for 37 years now. She is married to a teacher and has four children – three in primary school and one in secondary school. Sallay has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for her children and take better care of her family. 

Staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 46-year-old married woman from Tyre, mother of four children. Samira has owned a clothing shop since 1997. She sells clothes, perfumes, underwear, lingerie and accessories. Samira has been a  borrower with Al Majmoua for 13 years. All her previous loans were very successful. She used to work at home, but with the help of Al Majmoua, Samira was able to develop her business. She opened her own shop, and expanded her product range. 

Samira is a hard-working woman. She helps her husband with their family income and provides her children with the best education. Unlike her previous loans, this time Samira is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to pay her daughter's university fees. Samira is proud of herself and of her small family's achievements. Most of her clients talk about her courage and good ethics. She is loved by all of her neighbors. 

Samira hopes to expand her business range in the future and to attract a bigger number of customers in the future.

loans.use: To pay her daughter's university fees.

loans.name: Mzinga Group

texts.en:
H. A. is in his mid-thirties and is married with two children. He has a general store and also sells CDs and DVDs. He has been in this business for two years and works from 6:00am to 9:00pm daily. He is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be H.'s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his stock for both businesses. He has successfully paid back his loans. He wants this loan to increase his product stock. His dream is to one day start a chicken sales business.

H. will share this loan with his loan group "Mzinga", which has a total of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, H. is in front in a black t-shirt with orange decoration.

loans.use: to increase the product stock

loans.name: Dowoé

texts.fr: Madame Dowoé est âgée de 39ans. Elle est revendeuse des produits de premières nécessités. Elle  est mariée à un agent commercial et à 02 enfants en charge. L’activité a démarré en 1992. Madame s’approvisionne au marché de l’intérieur  et revend dans sa boutique. Elle voulait voir son commerce grandir, contribuer à la charge de la famille et s’épanouir c’est pour cela elle sollicite ce deuxième prêt  pour l’achat de marchandises.
texts.en: Dowoé is 39 years old and a retailer of basic essentials. She is married to a sales representative and has two children in her care. Her business started in 1992. She gets her supplies at the inland market and resells them in her shop. She would like to see her business expand, contribute to the family's outgoings and to fulfil her potential. For these reasons she is requesting a second loan to buy goods.

loans.use: to buy basic essentials

loans.name: Mouniratou

texts.fr: Mouniratou est âgée de 52ans. Elle est veuve et à 03 enfants en charge. Elle revendeuse d’oignons et réside à Hédzranawoé. L’activité a démarré en 2007, elle fait l’approvisionnement au marché d’Anié et revend au marché de Hédzranawoé et au grand marché de Lomé. Bien qu’elle est veuve elle reste dynamique  courageuse et veut assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants c’est pour cela elle sollicite ce premier prêt pour acheter en quantité des marchandises afin  d’accroitre son activité.
texts.en: Mouniratou is a 52 year-old widow with three children in her care. She is retailer of onions and lives in Hédzranawoé. Her business began in 2007. She gets her supplies at the market in Anié and resells them at the market in Hédzranawoé and at the large market in Lomé. Although she is a widow she is still dynamic and energetic, and she would like to ensure a better future for her children. For this reason she is requesting a first loan to buy a large quantity of goods in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy onions

loans.name: Laetitia

texts.fr: Madame A. à 29ans, elle est mariée à un caissier et à 02 enfants en charge. Elle est revendeuse de produits de beauté. Elle a démarré en 2005 son activité, elle achète les produits au grand marché de Lomé et revend au marché de Hédzranawoé. Elle est  à son premier prêt et désire avoir ce montant pour acheter en quantité les produits pour maximiser du profit, assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants, contribuer en partie aux dépenses du foyer, et pour  ajouter d’autres activités à la principale.
texts.en:
Mrs. A. is 29 years old, and married to a cashier. She has two dependent children. She is a reseller of cosmetics, an activity started in 2005. She buys her merchandise at the grand market of Lomé and sells the products at the market of Hédzranawoé. 

She is seeking her first loan to stock up on merchandise and maximize her profits. She wants to ensure a better future for her children, contribute to the household expenses, and add other activities to her business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for resale

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 51-year-old married man, living in Beirut with his wife and 4 children. Mohamad has owned an electronics sales shop since 2005, with 15 years of experience in this domain. He sells electronic games, DVDs and records special song CDs requested by his clients. Mohamad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the second time, in order to buy new products to improve his business, such as updated Playstation, MP4 and DVDs. Mohamad works on staying up-to-date with every new release because all of his clients request new releases and he has to be ready for that at any time.

Mohamad's first loan was very impressive, he stated that it improved his social situation and helped in his children's education. Mohamad's prices are very special, and his customer service is unique. His clients can be anyone in the region, including tourists, since he is in a tourist area in Beirut, visited by almost all tourists visiting Lebanon. Mohamad hopes to expand his business through selling computer accessories and hardware.

loans.use: to add new products to his business, such as Playstation, MP4 and DVDs

loans.name: Naziko

texts.en:
Naziko T. lives in village Merissi, in mountainous Adjara. She is 48 years old and lives with her 22-year-old son. The main source of the family income comes from family agricultural activities. In particular, they have two cows and cheese from their milk is sold on the local market. They also have a plot with an area of 0.8 ha, where vegetables and fruits are grown. Naziko also works as a saleslady in a village grocery shop. Along with the above mentioned, Naziko and her son run a beekeeping business. 

With the requested loan Naziko plans to expand the bee-keeping business. She will purchase additional bee-hives and bee colonies. This will allow them to increase sales of honey and thus, improve the income of the family.

Naziko plans to use the increased income for payment of the study fees of her son, as well as to purchase some household items to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bee-hives and bee colonies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is 46 years old and married with 3 children between the ages of 17 and 21. He runs a store in the town of Grassfield in Sierra Leone.

Ahmed has been in this business for 5 years and sells rice, paint, cement, and mosquito spray at his store. He also earns income from renting a house. He says that the main challenge to his business is price control.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase some more store items. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him expand his business. In the future, he would like to be an importer.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, paint, cement, and mosquito spray

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is 37 years old and married with 2 children, ages 8 and 13. She runs a business in Kissy Sierra Leone.

Aminata has been in this business for 10 years and sells books, pens, paper, and other office supplies at her store. She also earns income from renting a house. She says that her business is doing well.

She requested this loan through BRAC to purchase office supplies. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to be a big supplier to offices.

loans.use: to purchase more books, pens, paper, and office supplies

loans.name: Afiwoa Apetoa

texts.fr: Madame Afiwoa  à 37ans, elle est revendeuse du charbon, de céréales, et de savons et habite Hédzranawoé (un quartier du Togo). Elle achète ses marchandises au marché d’Anié, au grand marché de Lomé et revend au domicile de son papa. Afiwoa est à son premier prêt et sollicite ce montant pour acheter des céréales, du charbon et du savon pour revendre pour pouvoir accroitre son activité, avoir un magasin de vente pour  se prendre en charge.
texts.en: Mrs. Afiwoa, age 37, resells charcoal, cereals and soaps. She lives in Hédzranawoé, a neighborhood in Togo. She gets her supplies at the Anié market and at the Lomé Grand Market, and resells at her father's home. Afiwoa is seeking her first loan in order to buy cereals, charcoal and soaps to resell. This will enable her to bolster her business, and have her own store in order to provide for herself.

loans.use: to buy cereals, charcoal and soaps

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is a 24 years old married man, living with his wife and child in Bint Jbeil. Abass opened his own shop in 2003, with 12 years of experience. He was still a child when he started working, and it all was for the sake of helping his family in their living expenses. Abass works in painting furniture, in addition to houses. He is an expert in his field in his clients opinion. 

Abass is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua in order to start a new business; he wants to open a shop where he can sell all types of painting materials and tools. Abass seeks improvement, he is willing to educate his child with the best education available, and seeks to provide him with the best childhood possible since he didn't live his appropriately. Abass is a person with good manners, he works hard to prove his abilities and he translates his dreams into practical reality.

loans.use: to buy house painting materials and products to open a retail shop

loans.name: Tamba Group

texts.en:
Magret Y. is in her early twenties and is single. She has a food vendor business which she opens from 6:00 am to 1:00 pm daily (seven hours only) and is able to make a reA. small monthly profit.

This will be Magret's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy rice, wheat four, and cooking oil.  She has paid back her loan successfully.  She wants another loan to further increase her food inventory.  Her dream is to one day be able to take care of her parents.

Magret will share this loan with her loan group "Tamba" which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Magret is in front to the far right wearing a pink and white dress.

loans.use: to increase the food stall's inventory

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 26 years old married man, living with his wife in Bint Jbeil. Ibrahim has owned a gym since 2010.  He has 10 years of experience in this field and it's very important when running this type of a business to have a minimum of this range of experience. 

Ibrahim is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time, in order to add walking machines (treadmills), since his customers are increasing and because this is the only gym in the region and most of his residents are requesting such a services. 
Ibrahim is taking this step to satisfy his customers needs and in order to open a new branch in the future. 

In the beginning Ibrahim had financial problems and some obstacles during the start up of his business and so he had few machines. But, through his strong will and hard work, Ibrahim expanded his gym and is willing to do more in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional new walking machines (treadmills)

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en:
Jalal is a 28 year old single man from Chtoura, working in construction since 2003,  He's specializes in cement.  Jalal is a hard worker and he is improving his business year after year. 

He is well known in the region because of his good reputation and honesty.  Jalal is requesting a loan for the fifth time from Al Majmoua, in order to buy Iron Pillars (scaffolding) necessary for his business since he needs them to climb up high places to do his work.  He is a borrower in good standing and he knows how to improve himself by improving his business. 

Jalal is committed to his word and that's what differentiates him from most people working in construction, since most of them give false promises,  Jalal is reliable says most of his clients.  He hopes to expand his business and own his own construction company in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary "Iron Pillar" (scaffolding) tools for his business

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 46-year-old married man, living in Chtoura with his wife and three children. He opened a grocery store a year ago and he's improving it little by little. Jihad is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua, in order to increase his business capital by adding new detergents and perfumes. He is doing his best to improve and he believes that this loan will be his first step towards proving that. 

His clients are his neighbors and relatives. He suffers from competition that's why he wants to add new products and make his prices attractive to new customers. Jihad aims to improve and expand his business in the future and hopes to achieve that soon.

loans.use: To increase his working capital through adding new detergents and perfumes to his inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Tenke Ole

texts.en:
Tenke Ole,  aged 51 years old, is married to Saruni who is a farmer and together they have four children: Joseph aged 29 years and working; Naumi aged 24 years in college; Sophia aged 22 years also in college; and Elijah aged 16 years in form four. They live in Bissil. Tenke is a livestock trader and his business is located at Bissil market which is a busy market. He sells his livestock to customers from Kajiado, Kitengela, and Nairobi. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a client of KADET.

Tenke’s business of 21 years gives him a monthly profit of Ksh.26,000 and this loan of Ksh.80,000 is his second loan from KADET LTD. He intends to use it to purchase more livestock for trading. If the loan boosts his business he plans to establish a dairy farm. 

Tenke’s hope for the future is to be selling milk to Kenya Creameries and factories. He describes himself as hard-working.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock for trading.

loans.name: Peter Macharia

texts.en:
Peter has practised farming in Olkalou town for the last 11 years.  He is 39 years old, married to Mary Njoki, and they have two children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Peter hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Daniel Chege

texts.en:
Daniel has practised farming in Olkalou town for the last 14 years.  He is 34 years old, married to Naomi Wanjiku, and they have three children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his previous loan of Kshs 17,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Daniel hopes to become a leading farmer in Olkalou town.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson B. is a 27-year-old gentleman. He is single. He runs a telephone bureau in Mtwapa, Mombasa.  This being his second loan from KADET, he plans to purchase a computer and a printer for his business.

The anticipated income will be directed into the expansion of his business. Samson’s dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and a printer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell and to renovate his rental house

loans.name: James Mwangi

texts.en:
James has practised farming in Olkalou town for the last six years.  He is 37 years old, married to Lydia Wangari, and they have two children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan.  He repaid his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, James hopes to become a leading farmer in Olkalou town.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Las Daliass Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Las Daliass" y se ubica en el estado de Puebla, México. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes, Agustina G. es la presidenta del grupo. Ella se dedica a la venta de trastes que inicio hace 5 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar ollas y casuelas que ya tiene comprometidas, tiene 29 años, estudio hasta el sexto año de primaria, ella vive en union libre y tiene en total 5 hijos. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente entusiasmada por la oportunidad que le brindan para comprar mercancia  que ya tiene comprometida con varios clientes y con esto tener más ventas y poder satisfacer la necesidad de todos sus clientes y así brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, ofreciendoles educación ya que ella quiere que tengan una carrera universitaria para que salgan adelante.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Daliass” and is located in the state of Puebla, Mexico; it has 10 members and Agustina G. is the group President.

She started selling kitchenware five years ago and is asking for a loan to buy pots and pans that she already has orders for.  She is 29 years old and finished sixth grade.  She’s in a common law relationship and has five children.

At the moment of requesting the loan she feels enthusiastic about the opportunity she’s getting to buy merchandise that several customers have already ordered from her.  This will mean more sales and being able to satisfy more customers thus providing her children with a better quality of life, providing better education for them because she wants them to have a university career so that they can do well in future.

loans.use: to buy pots and pans for her business.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 30 years old, married and has three children.  He has been selling second-hand clothes and has two employees in his business.  He was previously working as a mechanic to earn his living.  He also runs a taxi business for extra income.  

Isaac works hard in his business so that he can provide quality education to his children.  He hopes that one day; he will have a big business.  He has requested 50,000 Kes to buy more used clothes and repair his taxi.

loans.use: To buy clothes and repair his taxi

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 42 years old, married and a father of four.  He does welding so as to earn a living.  He has done the business for two years.  He was previously working as a plumber to earn a living. 

Through Faulu Kenya, Samuel has managed to access business loans which he used to boost his business.  He has requested 40,000 Kes to buy metal bars, plates and rods.

loans.use: To buy metal bars, plates and rods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open another outlet of her business.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: Tom A. N. is 39 years old, married, and has four children.  He is able to take care of his family with the income he earns from running a photocopy business, which he has been doing for 10 ten years.  Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he has managed to boost his business because he can easily access financial resources.  He hopes to own a media company in five years.  He is requesting a loan for 50,000 KES to buy a laptop and a camera.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and a camera

loans.name: Julieta Cecilia

texts.es:
Doña Julieta B. Solís es una mujer de 65 años de edad, ella vive con su esposo, sus 2 hijos y con sus 2 nietos, es una mujer, muy trabajadora, responsable, luchadora .Doña Julieta es una líder comunal de concepción arriba y pertenece al grupo de mujeres de deportes  del sector de Alajuelita .Ella llego hasta primaria ya que por  motivo económico tuvo que dejar de estudiar para trabajar.
El crédito será invertido para compra de mercadería para su negocio el cual es vender electrodomésticos, ella empezó a vender desde hace 20 años útiles escolares.
Doña Julieta aparte de vender cuida a sus dos nietos en la mañana los alista para que vayan a la escuela y luego los lleva, regresa se dedica a vender y cobrar, durante la tarde se dedica a atender a su esposo, después va y recoge a los nietos y sigue vendiendo.
Julieta tiene como meta tener su negocio de electrodomésticos, también ella desea cambiar de lugar de domicilio por uno más bonito, Con este crédito la señora Julieta podrá tener más capital de trabajo y apoyar a gastos económicos de su casa es una mujer  emprendedora ya que es una  líder comunal y desea que las mujeres salgan adelante, como lo ha hecho ella
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia B. Solís, 65, lives with her husband, two children and two grandchildren.  She is a very hard working, responsible, tenacious woman.  She is a community leader in Concepción Arriba and belongs to a group of women athletes from Alajuelita.  She only went to elementary school because economic need forced her to leave school and go to work.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise for her business which is home appliance sales.  She started out 20 years ago selling school supplies.

Besides selling, Julieta cares for her two grandchildren.  In the morning she gets them ready for school and then takes them there.  She returns and spends her time selling and collecting payment.  In the afternoon she tends to her husband and then goes to pick up her grandchildren.  She’d like to move to a prettier address.

This loan will allow Julieta to have more working capital to help cover household expenses.  She is an enterprising woman because she’s a community leader and she wants women to get ahead like she’s done.

loans.use: to buy home appliances to sell.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: El Sr.  Fernando se dedica al servicio de transporte Urbano hace 3 años, tiene 35 años, la Zona De la Villa,  es una persona soltera Su vehículo lo trabaja Los fines de semana  en el horario de noche de 7 a 3 de la madrugada. En ocasiones los hace trabajar a su Vehículo con un chofer el cual le entregan renta diaria. Actualmente el necesita el crédito para reparar su herramienta de trabajo como por ejemplo el sistema eléctrico, Reparación de Motor  y algunos retoques que necesita el vehículo, es una  persona responsable con ganas de superación, ahora se encuentra delicado de un ojo pero el sigue con ganas de trabajar, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Fernando has been providing urban transportation services for 3 years.  He’s 35 years old, single and from the De la Villa zone.  

He works his vehicle the weekend night shift from 7pm until 3am.  Occasionally he leases his vehicle to a driver who pays him a daily rental fee.  

He needs money to repair his work tool, for example the electrical system, engine repair and some finishing details the car needs.  He is a responsible person who wants to improve himself.  He has a bit of a problem with one of his eyes right now but he continues wanting to work and is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Radio San Gabriel Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RADIO SAN GABRIEL” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por once integrantes y tiene como presidenta de la mesa directiva a la señora  Paulina. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos comercio, producción y servicio.

La señora Paulina, indica que es la primera ves que forma parte de una asociación comunal  y que integro la asociación por invitación de la promoción que se hizo en su zona.

Nos cuenta Doña Paulina que el negocio que ella tiene es de tejido de mantas; es por esta razón que el prestamo que sacará es para la compra de Lanas. Posteriormente culminada sus productos los venderá en las ferias.esta forma de trabajo le ayudará a apoyar la economía de su familia , ya que ella esta casada y tiene un hijo.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The “Radio San Gabriel” communal bank will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch Focus Center.  It has 11 members and Paulina is President of the governing board.  The members’ businesses are varied.  Among them are: commerce, production and services.

Paulina tells us that this is the first time she’s been part of a communal association and that she joined invited by the promotion that took place in her area.

She relates that the business she has consists in weaving blankets.  Because of this, the loan she’ll take out is to buy wool.  Once her items are complete she will sell them at the markets and the work will thus help her family’s economy since she’s married and has a son.

When she’s asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the training.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: La señora Sandra se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir para mujer, no esta casada pero tiene su pareja tiene un  hijo comparte juntamente con la institución la  satisfacción de saber que ahora podrá trabajar con mas herramientas de trabajo  y así luchar por la vida por su  hijo y valorar el crecimiento gracias al financiamiento de la institución emprender y el producto Kiva de la misma manera mejorar  su forma de vida con apoyo de su conyugue y pasar cualquier obstáculo que la vida le da. La actividad que la Sra. Sandra realiza es la costura de ropa de mujer (pantalones de tela) hace ya muchos años, por esta razón es que se animo a solicitar el préstamo para comprar maquinaria siendo este un emprendimiento de una señora para un futuro próximo. El esfuerzo que realiza durante todos los días la semana es valorado para que  ella misma pueda tener un desarrollo económico y una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is a Dressmaker; she makes women’s clothing.  She isn’t married but has a spouse and a child and she shares with the institution the satisfaction she’ll feel now that she will be able to work with more work tools to fight for her son’s life and value growth thanks to financing from Emprender and Kiva while at the same time improving her way of life with support from her spouse and being able to overcome whatever obstacle life throws at her.

Sandra’s activity consists in sewing women’s clothes (fabric trousers).  She’s been doing this for several years.  Because of this she felt encouraged to seek a loan to buy machinery that will be an enterprise for this woman’s future.  The effort she puts into it every day of the week is valued so that she, herself, can have economic development as well as a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter N. W. is 28 years old, married, and has one child.  He sells vehicle spare parts to earn a living.  He started this business six years ago.  He works hard so as to provide for his family and educate his child.  He hopes to expand his business in the future.  He is requesting a loan for 50,000 KES to buy auto lamps and vehicle body parts.

loans.use: To purchase auto lamps and vehicle body parts

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny tiene 31 años, ella vive en su propia casa con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace más de 4 años, Marleny ha instalado en su casa su propia tienda, desde entonces vende productos de primera necesidad, motivo por el cual no le queda tiempo para atender a sus clientes. Pero ella sola no esta, su familia la apoya en el trabajo, atendiendo a los clientes. Su trabajo lo considera muy importante ya que se a convertido en una fuente de ingresos, de esa manera puede cubrir los gastos educativos para sus hijos. Para el futuro, Marleny y su familia están pensando en implementar otros productos a fin de seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes. Es su crédito número 20 con MFP,  se siente  muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal porque le ayudo a comprender mejor sobre la importancia de tener una economía estable y esforzarse en su negocio de lo cual esta muy agradecida y se compromete a seguir adelante con su puntualidad en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de azúcar, arroz y menestras.
texts.en:
Marleny, 31, lives in her own house with her husband and three children.  Over four years ago Marleny set up a store in her house and has been selling groceries ever since which leaves her no time to tend to her customers.  But she’s not alone; her family helps her with the work and to take care of customers.

She considers her work to be very important since it’s become a source of income which allows her to cover her children’s educational expenses.  For the future, Marleny and her family are planning to add more products in order to continue meeting customer needs.

This is her 20th loan with MFP.  She feels very happy to be part of a communal bank because it helped her better understand the importance of having stable income and to work hard at her business and she is very grateful for this and committed to continue making punctual payments.  She will use the requested loan to buy sacks of sugar, rice and snacks.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar and snacks.

loans.name: Jeny

texts.es: Jeny tiene 33 años, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su propia casa. Hace más de 6 años, Jeny tiene su propia tienda, negocio que se encuentra ubicada cerca del cementerio de su distrito, motivo por el cual tiene mucha afluencia de gente. Asimismo su trabajo no le impide dedicarse a sus hijos, ya que están en etapa escolar. Este negocio es rentable porque le permite tener más ingresos y apoyarse en momentos de dificultad. Por otro lado también se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales, actividades que le generan ingresos extras. Dentro de sus planes esta el de mejorar su tienda abasteciéndola de más productos que sea de la necesidad de sus clientes, garantizando obtener ganancias. Es su crédito número 20 con MFP, esta muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que se siente segura financieramente ya que aprendió la importancia de distribuir bien los ingresos financieros. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Jeny, 33, lives with her husband and three children in her own house.  Over six years ago Jeny opened her own store located near her district’s cemetery which makes it very busy.  Her work doesn’t keep her from tending to her children, however, since they are school aged.  The business is profitable because it allows her to have extra income and supports her during difficult times.  On the other hand, she also farms and raises animals, activities that generate extra income.  She plans to improve her store stocking it with more products that her customers need thereby guaranteeing better profits.

This is her 20th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to belong to a communal bank because she feels secure financially having learned the importance of spending her income properly.  She will use the requested loan to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard was born in 1988 and is newly married.  He prepares bone soup and sells it to earn a living.  He is also employed as a house caretaker.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, his business has been growing.  He hopes to prosper in his business.  He has requested 35,000 Kes to renovate his business premises.

loans.use: To renovate his business premises.

loans.name: Wilson Paulino

texts.es: El sr. Wilson vive la zona de Cota Cota, el es soltero vive junto a  sus  tres hermanos todos independientes, el se dedica a costura desde hace  tiempo el estuvo en la Republica de Argentina por motivo de trabajo hace un años atrás ahí es donde aprendió a confeccionar Edredones,  actualmente tiene un taller en su mismo domicilio y elabora solo los edredones lo cual distribuye por el centro por mayor y menor, y tiene clientes que la buscan para un determinada cantidad a las cuales les da por mayor, cuenta con dos maquinas tiene planeado ampliar mas adelante su taller comprando mas maquinas, solicita el crédito para la compra de  fibra  por mayor y tela para la confección de edredones, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Wilson lives in the Cota Cota zone. He’s single and lives with his three independent siblings.  He’s been a Tailor for quite some time.  He was in Argentina for work-related reasons and that’s where he learned how to manufacture comforters.  He currently has a workshop at his house and he manufactures only comforters that he sells downtown both at wholesale and at retail.  He has two sewing machines and plans later on to expand the shop buying more machines.  He’s asking for the loan to buy fabric and stuffing to make comforters.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy materials like fabric and fiber.

loans.name: Mirela

texts.es:
La señora Mírela,  es socia del banco comunal Las Rosas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, pero solo uno está a su cargo.
Su hijo es el que se encarga de atender el negocio en sus horas libres, de esa manera apoya a su mamá en la bodega que tiene en casa.

Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 3 paquetes de gaseosas, 3 paquetes de agua, 2 cajas de galletas rellenitas, 2 bolsas de fideo, ½ caja de lava vajilla, ½ caja de jabón en barra, 1 bolsa de lejía, ½ caja de azul para ropa, ½ caja de frutas al jugo, ½ caja de conservas., ½ caja de néctares, ½ caja de yogur.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por la ayuda económica que brinda a mujeres como ella quienes desean salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mirela is a member of the Las Rosas communal bank in Callería District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 38 years old, married and has four children but only one still in her care.  Her son helps her in the store during his free time thereby helping his mother with the store she has at home.

She will use her new 1000 new sol loan to buy the following: 3 cases of soft drinks, 3 cases of bottled water, 2 boxes of filled cookies, 2 bags of noodles, ¼ case of dishwashing soap, ½ case of bar soap, 1 bag of lye, ½ case of bluing for clothes, ½ case of fruit juice, ½ case of conserves, ½ case of fruit nectars, ½ case of yoghurt.

She thanks Manuela Ramos for the economic support it provides women like her who want to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 29 years old and married.  He runs a tailoring business for a living.  He has been in the business for seven years.  He runs his business in a very competitive environment, hence he puts extra effort to get more customers.  

Through Faulu Kenya, he has learnt customer care skills.  He hopes to grow his business into wholesale in the future.  He has requested 30,000 Kes to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es: Nidia C. V.  vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su esposo y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 22 y 26 años, y allí tiene un negocio llamado “Zulú y Pijao” dedicado a las manualidades como  tejidos,  productos en porcelanicron y  fibras naturales además de cuadros. Ella indicó este negocio en el año  1999 haciendo collares y pinturas que había aprendido  cuando estudiaba en el colegio en el bachillerato y que fue gradualmente diversificando con otras técnicas mediante capacitaciones en el Servicio Nacional De aprendizaje “Sena” un  instituto técnico y tecnológico  estatal  y gratuito que existe en Colombia. Su insistencia en el mejoramiento de la calidad de sus productos le ha permitido perfeccionar  su arte y por eso  hoy participa en diversas exposiciones y eventos  feriales, donde exhibe sus productos, se compra frente a la competencia y consigue clientes. Este es el segundo financiamiento que hace con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará  materiales para producir hilo, accesorios peines, piedras ganchos pinturas porcelanicron cintas y bordadores.  porque con ellos desarrollará nuevos productos  y aumentar su atención a nuevos clientes.  Nidia manifiesta que con sus créditos en la Fundación su negocio ha crecido,  en términos de aumento de su capital de trabajo, ingresos por ventas y número de clientes; eso si agregándole ella su trabajo, la disciplina y el servicio especial a sus clientes. Su meta para más adelante es lograr tener un local comercial, aplicar a su sistema de mercadeo el uso de herramientas tecnológicas  y este es justamente su gran desafío. Mientras sigue trabajando fuertemente con una rentabilidad no menor de un 20%.
texts.en:
Nidia C. V. lives in Cartagena, along with her husband.  They have two children, ages 22 and 26.  They have a business called “Zulú y Pijao," that specializes in crafts such as fabrics, products in porcelain, natural fibers, and paintings.  She began this business in 1999, making necklaces and painting, having learned when she was a bachelor student.  She eventually diversified into other areas through training as an apprentice in the national service corps, a free State technical institution in Colombia.  Her insistence on perfection have allowed her to improve the quality of her products and perfect her art forms.  Now she participates in various expositions and fairs, where she exhibits her products near the competition and wins customers.

This will be her second loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the money to buy thread, accessories, stones, hooks, paints, porcelanicron, laces, and embroideries.  She uses these items to develop new products and increase her customer base.

Nilda says that she has been able to grow in terms of working capital, investments, and number of customers with the help of the loans through the institution.  She likes her work; her skills, especially customer service.  Her goal for the future is to have her own shop, use marketing techniques, tools and technology.  This is a great challenge.  In the mean time she continues to work hard with profits of at least 20%.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her arts and crafts business

loans.name: Shena

texts.es:
La señora Shena, es socia del banco comunal Las Rosas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 38 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos menores D. edad.
Tiene un pequeño kiosco donD. expenD. bebidas heladas, lleva 1 año y medio dentro D. la familia D. Manuela Ramos y está empezando D. a poco pero muy segura D. hacer crecer su negocio y así generarse más ingresos.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 10 cajas D. gaseosas, 10 cajas D. cerveza, 2 paquetes D. agua sin gas, 3 paquetes D. gaseosa con gas, 2 paquetes D. gaseosa guaraná.
Su negocio es pequeño pero D. esa manera tiene un ingreso más para poder ayudar a su esposo que es empleado y no gana mucho dinero, apenas alcanza para la comida y  el pago D. algunos servicios básicos.
texts.en:
Shena is a member of the Las Rosas del Distrito Calleria communal bank in the Ucayali Department.  She is 38 years old, is marries, and has 4 young children.

She has a small kiosk where she sells cold drinks and has been with the Manuela Ramos family for one and a half years and is slowly building her business and generating more income.

She will use the money from her 1,000 PEN ($375) loan to buy 10 cases of soft drinks, 10 cases of beer, 2 packs of bottled water, 3 packs or carbonated water, and 2 packs of guarana soda.

Her business is small but in this way she has an income to be able to help her husband who does not earn much at his job; just enough for food and basic items.

loans.use: to buy drinks for resale

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 50 years old and a member of Faulu Kenya.  He sells stationery and lab equipment to earn a living. He started running the business six years ago.  

William is very aggressive as he runs his business because he is looking forward to having a wholesale business.  He wants to buy microscopes and Bunsen burners, hence he has requested a loan of Kes. 20,000.

loans.use: To buy microscopes and Bunsen burners.

loans.name: Sintia Giannina

texts.es:
La señora Sintia, es socia del banco comunal Manos Unidas del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos pequeños.
Lleva 2 años y medio como socia de Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica al alquiler de moto car (motos), por ahora tiene un solo moto car,  más adelante piensa comprar uno más para poder trabajar  mejor y tener sus propios ingresos, su esposo es profesor, el sueldo es poco pero entre los dos solventan los gastos familiares.

Es un negocio que no le quita mucho tiempo y puede atender también a sus hijos que todavía están pequeños y necesitan mucha atención. 
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 comprará: 3 llantas, 3 camaras,1 sistema de arrastre,1 tapabarro, 3 litros de aceite.
Su moto car genera ingresos diarios con el cual puede cubrir la cuota de Manuela Ramos.  Tiene mucho cuidado con sus cuotas para no caer en moras y así pueda seguir solicitando nuevos créditos.
texts.en:
Sintia is a member of the Manos Unidas communal bank in the Calleria district within the Ucayali Department.  She is 24, is married and has two small children.

She has been involved with the Manuela Ramos movement for two years and rents out motocars.  She only has one motorcar for now, but she plans to buy one more in the future in order to be able to increase her income.  He husband is a teacher.  His salary is low but between the two of them they are able to cover the household expenses.

This business does not take much time and she can also care for her children who are still young and need lots of attention.  She will use the money from this 1,200 PEN loan to buy 3 tires, 3 cameras, one locking system, one mudguard, and three liters of oil.

Her motorcar generates daily income with which she is able to meet her Manuela Ramos dues.  She is very careful with her dues so that she won’t get into a bad position and will continue to be able to ask for new loans.

loans.use: to buy parts for her motocar

loans.name: Sol Radiante Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal ”SOL RADIANTE”, está iniciando su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Esta asociación comunal cuenta con la participación de ocho  integrantes.  La  mesa directiva tiene como presidenta a la señora Roxana. 

Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: costura de deportivos, cafetería, venta de salchipapas, punto de cabinas, artesanías, confección de deportivos, costura de blusas, venta de refrescos.
 
La presidenta, la señora Roxana es una mujer joven de  23 años es soltera. Esta es su primera ves que participa en asociaciones comunales. 

En la actualidad vende salchipapas en la puerta de su casa todos los días, con el crèdito que sacara comprara por mayor su mercadería (verdura para la elaboración de las salchipapas)

Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer ella respondió que le gusta todo.
texts.en:
The ”SOL RADIANTE” communal association is beginning its first cycle with the Los Andes office and is made up of eight women.  The advisory council has Roxana as its president.  The members are involved in different businesses, including making sports gear, cafeteria sales, salchipapa sales, cabins, crafts, blouse making, and soft drink sales.

Roxana is 23 years old and this is the first time that she has participated in a communal association.

She sells salchipapas out of her home every day and will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients (vegetables) in quantity.  When asked what she liked best about Pro Mujer (Professional Woman), she said "everything."

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Marisol Roxana

texts.es:
La señora Marisol es socia del banco comunal Perla De Pucallpa del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.
Marisol se dedica a la venta de comida china, esta actividad la realiza por las noches y trabaja junto con su esposo, quien la ayuda en la preparación de los platos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 botella de ajonjolí, 1 botella de tau sí, ½  canela china , 20 kilos de fideo chino, 5 paquetes de wantan, 3 patos, 5 kilos de chanco, 3 gallinas.
Tanto Marisol como su esposo trabajan juntos para poder solventar los gastos de la casa y criar a sus hijos, siempre pensando que no les debe faltar nada para crecer sanos.
Manuela Ramos ha tenido mucho que ver con el crecimiento económico de esta familia y se encuentran muy agradecidos.
texts.en:
Marisol is a member of the Perla de Pucallpa communal bank in the Calleria district within the Ucayali department.  She is 33 years old, married, and has three children.

Marisol makes Chinese food in the evenings and she works together with her husband, who helps her prepare the dishes.

She will use the money from this 1,700 PEN loan to buy a sack of rice, a bottle of sesame seeds, a bottle of tau si seasoning, Chinese cinnamon, 20 kilos of Chinese noodles, 5 packets of wonton, 3 plates, 5 kg of crushed herbs, and 3 chickens.

Marisol and her husband work together to be able to pay the household expenses and raise their children.  They want to be sure that they are healthy and in need of nothing.

Manuela Ramos (program) has a lot to do with the financial growth of this family and they are grateful.

loans.use: to buy incredients

loans.name: Tarapaca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TARAPACA” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Mercedes.   Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos:tienda, venta de comida, taxi, trabajo de construcción, tejidos de mantas, venta de verduras, costura.

La señora Mercedes, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que participa hace una año en Pro Mujer. Ella cuenta que se integro a la institución por la invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio, que ha iniciado por iniciativa propia. Es por esta razón que el crédito que sacará es para la compra artículos para su tienda (sardinas, panes, fideos, etc.). Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con las señoras.
texts.en:
The “TARAPACA” communal association is made up of eight women and is a part of Pro Mujer (Professional Woman) in the Senkata office.  Mercedes is the president and the women are involved in a number of businesses including running a store, selling food, driving a taxi, construction, making blankets, vegetable sales and sewing.

Mercedes says that she has been with Pro Mujer for one year and joined after being invited by a friend.  Now she has a neighborhood store that she started on her own.  She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise (sardines, bread, noodles, etc).  This type of work allows her to earn an income and support her family.  She is married and has two children.  She says that she likes to share with her fellow Pro Mujer members.

loans.use: to stock her store

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
La señora Mirtha es socia del banco comunal Manos Unidas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.
Ella se dedica a la venta de madera, tiene un pequeño aserradero que junto a su esposo lo han sacado adelante a base de mucho esfuerzo.  Su esposo es el que se encarga del negocio familiar, negocio que les ha servido para poder tener algunas comodidades en su hogar.
Con su nuevo préstamos de S/. 1,400.00 nuevos soles comparará: 1 sierra circular, 2 trozas de madera para sacar listones, y 10 polines para sacar tablillas.
En estos tiempos la madera tiene buen precio en el mercado local, hecho que le ha permitido generar mejores ingresos. Es un negocio muy rentable.  
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que brindan a las mujeres para salir adelante impulsando algún negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mirtha is a member of the communal bank United Hands of the Calleria District in the Ucayali Department, is 46 years old, married, and has 3 children.

She sells wood and has a small sawmill she and her husband have been able to build with much effort. Her husband is in charge of the family business which has given them means of acquiring commodities for their home.

Her her 1,400 Peruvian Soles loan she will buy: 1 circular saw, 2 pieces of wood to make strips, and 10 poles to make shingles.

Around this time wood is at a low price in local markets thus allowing her to make larger profits. Overall this is a very profitable business. She thanks Manuela Ramos for the support offered to women and encouraging them to succeed in their businesses.
